loans.name: Johnson Street Business Group

texts.en:
Augustine S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Johnson Street Business.  He is 56 years old, married and has seven children who range in age from 8 to 35 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.

For 6 years, he has been selling timber on Johnson Street in Monrovia, Liberia.  He plans to use his portion (20,000 Liberian Dollars) of this 86,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more timber.  

He describes himself as a devoted family man. His dream is to grow his business and continue to educate his children.

Augustine is holding the sign in the photo that accompanies this profile.  Benjamin is inset at the lower right of the photo as he was absent during the loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old. Josephine is married. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La Sra.  Flora  oriunda de Santa Cruz  actualmente vive en la zona de San Luis,  la Sra. cuenta con su casita propia tiene  hijos que actualmente están estudiando,  su negocio es la  elaboración de pan se dedica a esta actividad hace 4 años en la zona de San Luis.
Su Estado civil es soltera, de edad de 55 años ,madre soltera ,la Sra. es una buena clienta que esta muy agradecida con la institución por brindarle el apoyo para poder superarse como persona y en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Flora, a native of Santa Cruz, now lives in the San Luis zone. She has her own little house, and she has children who are now students. Her business is making bread. She has worked in this business for four years in the San Luis zone. Her civil state is single, she is 55 years old, and she is a single mother. She is a good client who is very thankful to the institution for offering her the support to aim ever higher as a person and in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and purchasing an oven

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-at O. and his wife, Mrs. Vuthy Khut, are 40 years old. They have been married since 1990, and have two sons, both of whom are in school. The couple lives along national road number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam-at has been a motor taxi driver since he got married. His wife has been a scarf weaver since 2000. He is asking for his first loan of $700 to pay school fees for his sons.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his sons

loans.name: Erika Marjori

texts.es:
Erika tiene 26 años, se dedica a la venta de Ropa también a la venta de hamburguesas y hot dog, ella reside en San Francisco Gotera, y vive con su esposo y sus hijos Marjori de 10 años, Cesar de 6, Luis de 4 y Axel de un año, no posee casa propia sino que renta una.
Ella desarrolla dos negocios en uno prepara Hamburguesas y Hot Dog y vende la ropa por las calles de la ciudad, dedicándose de esta manera desde hace vario tiempo para dar el sustento diario a sus hijos.
Erika necesita un préstamo para comprar ropa y abastecer su negocio, pues ella desea ofrecer diferentes colores y modas en las prendas de vestir, esta inversión la ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y a mejorar sus ingresos.
Su objetivo es mejorar la condición económica de su familia y poder algún día contar con una vivienda propia y digna para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erika is 26 years old and works selling clothing, and also sells hamburgers and hot dogs. She lives in San Francisco Gotera with her husband and children (Marjori – 10, Cesar – 6, Luis – 4, and Axel – 1). She does not have her own house so she rents one.

Erika has two businesses – she makes hamburgers and hot dogs in one, and sells clothing by foot on the streets of the city for the other. She has been working like this for quite some time to provide for her children. Erika needs a loan to purchase clothing and stock her business because she wants to offer clothing of different colors and styles. This investment will help her to increase her sales and to improve her income.

Erika’s goal is to improve her family’s economic situation and to someday be able to own a decent home for the development of her children.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca G. is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Malintubuan in the municipality of Labason, a part of Zamboanga Del Norte province on the islands of Mindanao. Rebecca makes and sells seafood products such as fish and shrimp to the local community. Rebecca has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from PMPC, of 3000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her seafood business

loans.name: Suiumkan's Group

texts.en: Suiumkan K. is the leader of the group. She is 44 and divorced. She has a 16-year-old daughter. Her daughter is in college. With the initial investment of 15,000 soms, Suiumkan opened her own cafeteria. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase products in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to open her own restaurant. Klara A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 30 and married. Her husband works in construction. Together they bring up two sons. Klara is engaged cattle breeding and with money received from the loan, she wants to purchase hay for the cattle. Joldoshbek A., 32, is married. He has two children. A year ago, Joldoshbek started to provide shoe-repairing services. With money received from the loan, he wants to purchase materials needed for repairing shoes. Gulmira T., 44, is married. She has four children. Her husband works in Russia. In order to make money, Gulmira breeds livestock and then resells them at a higher price. Her loan purpose is to purchase goats for breeding. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Vannesa

texts.es: Vanessa Agüero D., ella tiene 21 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Ella quiere comprar cerdas para cría y también construir un chiquero donde tenerlos. Además, ella cuenta con el espacio para la creación de estos establecimientos. Tiene varios años que se dedica a eso y quiere crecer como un  productora de cerdas para la crianza de cerdito . Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no ha tenido problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea un establecimiento productivo y ejemplo para otras mujeres de la zona. Ella no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella tiene como meta llegar a generar ganancias para su futuro y tener un buen estado económico y llegar a producir bastantes cerdos para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Vanessa Agüero D. is 21 years old and in a common law marriage with her partner. She wants to buy pigs to raise and build a pen for housing them. In addition, she has the space to accommodate them. Vanessa has been this business for several years and wants to grow in her capacity as a pig breeder.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not encountered any problems of her own. Vanessa wants to have a productive establishment and set an example for other women in the area. She has not received other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided her with a loan that has better terms and a lower interest rate. Her goals are to generate income for the future, be in a stable financial situation, and produce enough pigs to sell.

loans.use: Acquire pigs

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Norma tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

Norma desea adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio ya que se acercan las fiestas navideñas y durante esta temporada la demanda por su negocio aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Norma es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Norma is 25 years old, single, and lives with her family in the Olmos district, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial activity in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells all types of clothing.  She offers her products on credit and for cash payments and mostly sells to her neighbors and friends.  Her work helps support her family and meets her daily expenses.

Norma would like to acquire more merchandise to expand her store now that the holiday season is approaching and during that time, demand increases.  She has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative to help her meet her goal.

Norma is a hardworking and enterprising young woman.  People who know her admire her desire to succeed.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to expand her clothing sales business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 36 años, es madre soltera y una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su hijo Manuel de 16 años. Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado en diversos oficios, para brindar la mejor educación a su hijo, quien es su mayor inspiración. Desde entonces vende hamburguesas en la puerta de su casa; solo por las tardes hasta altas horas de la noche, en la que también su hijo la ayuda. Asimismo, en horas de la mañana vende productos de belleza, negocio que le va muy bien, ya que los ofrece a sus asiduos clientes, quienes acuden a su pequeño puesto de comida. Se siente satisfecha de realizar ambos trabajos, disfrutando mucho la interrelación con sus clientes. En  adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio con la venta de almuerzos, de ese modo dinamizar sus ingresos. Es su 17avo crédito con MFP, sabe que este crédito que recibirá, le será muy beneficioso  para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Además de ser un socio de su grupo comunal, le gusta apoyar en la organización de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mesas, sillas  y accesorios de cocina, de ese modo emprenderá el negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en: Maria, 36, is an enterprising single mother who lives in her own home along with her son Manuel, who is 16 years old.  From a very early age she has worked in a number of occupations to provide the best education for her son, who is her main motivation.  She sells hamburgers from a door in her house from the afternoons until late in the evening, when her son also helps her.  In addition, in the morning hours she sells beauty products, a business that is going very well, since she offers these products to the regular customers who come to her food stand.  She feels content doing both of these jobs, because she very much enjoys interacting with her customers.  In the future, she will expand her business to include the sale of lunches and thereby boost her income.  This is her 17th loan with MFP, and she knows that the loan that she will receive will be very beneficial for the development of her businesses.  In addition to being a member of her communal group, she enjoys supporting the organization of her group.  With the loan that she requests, she will buy tables, chairs and kitchen accessories

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to start selling lunches.

loans.name: Erich

texts.es:
El señor Erich  de 21 años de edad, soltero, joven emprendedor, realiza instalaciones de polarizados para todo tipo de vehículo, también de alarmas y radio además vende todo tipo de artículos para equipamiento de vehículo como, tazas de vehículos, kit de tunig, amplificador, seguro capot y varios mas. Empezó hace tres años trabajando en una playa de vehículos, el se encargaba de realizar los polarizados, actualmente cuenta con un local que alquila, donde realiza los servicios y venta de artículos para tunig, gracias al apoyo de sus padres y de préstamos realizados le va muy bien, cuenta con mucha clientela.
Solicita nuevamente apoyo crediticio para la compra de mas accesorios para tunig de vehículo ya que aumento bastante la demanda.
Erich agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad, porque gracias a eso él podrá seguir brindado a sus clientes el mejor servicio, y vender los mejores accesorios para tunig.
texts.en:
Erich is 21, single, a young entrepreneur, who installs tinted windows for all types of cars, and alarms, and radios.  He also sells many kinds of products to equip cars such as hubcaps, tuning kits, speakers, security systems, etc.  He began 3 years ago working in a car lot where he was in charge of the tinting.   He now has a shop that he rents where he does his work and sells tuning equipment.  Thanks for the support of his parents and loans that he has received, he is doing well with his customers.
He is requesting a loan to buy more articles for car tune ups since the demand has increased.
Erich appreciates the Fundación Paraguaya  and Kiva for the opportunity because thanks to them , he has been able to offer his customers better service and sell the best accessories for tune ups.

loans.use: Installing tinted windows, alarms, raidios and sale of products for car tune ups.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela Domínguez Ramírez vive en el poblado de Moyotepec  del municipio de CD. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos. Ella tiene 37 años de edad estudio secretaria ejecutiva, ella tiene su negocio de farmacia en el cual va a invertir el préstamo. Principalmente lo va a utilizar para comprar medicamento genérico, perfumería, pañales, papel higiénico, etc. hace dos años que inicio con su farmacia, ella aprendió el negocio porque estuvo trabajando mucho tiempo en farmacias y después decidió poner su negocio sacando prestamos. Sus ingresos son aproximadamente el 30% de sus ventas. Anteriormente no tuvo otros negocios. Su farmacia está en la Col. Año de Juárez en Cuautla, su negocio se llama Farmacia García de su negocio a su domicilio se hace una  hora. Le gusta su trabajo por la disponibilidad de tiempo y que puede trabajar para ayudar  a su familia. Su trabajo le enorgullece porque puede ayudar a la gente. hay una persona que le ayuda a atender el negocio en la mañana y ella lo atiende en la tarde, sus clientes son todo tipo de gente y al día atiende entre 30 a 40 personas al día. Las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio las utiliza para reinvertir, además está ahorrando para ampliar su negocio y poder meter más mercancía como regalos.
La señora Gabriela es casada, su esposo es campesino y él no tiene un ingreso fijo, tienen un hijo que se llama Ángel Gabriel, él actualmente está estudiando la primaria. Su negocio es muy importante para ella porque ha ayudado económicamente a su familia, también desea en el futuro ampliar su casa y construir su cocina. ella Quiere lograr que a través de su negocio pueda sacar adelante a su hijo y que estudie la universidad. Se siente muy contenta al recibir su préstamo y poder invertir más en su negocio y de esa manera obtener más ganancias para tener más dinero y salir adelante.  La señora Gabriela quiere decirle  a KIVA y a Fundacion Realidad lo siguiente: “gracias por el préstamo y que amplíen el monto del préstamo”
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela Domínguez Ramírez lives in the town of Moyotepec, a municipality of Ciudad Ayala in Morelos state.  She is 37 years old and studied to be an Executive Secretary.  She has a pharmacy in which she will invest her loan.  She will mainly use it to buy generic medicines, perfumery, diapers, toilet paper, etc.  She started her pharmacy two years ago.  She learned the business because she worked in pharmacies for a long time and she then decided to set up her own business taking out loans.  Her income is about 30% of sales.  She hasn’t had any previous businesses.  Her pharmacy is the Año de Juárez neighborhood in Cuautla.  Her business is called “Farmacia García.”  Travel time from home to her business is an hour.

She enjoys the work because time is available and she can work to help her family.  Her work makes her proud because she can help people.  She has a person who helps her tend to the store during mornings and she tends to it in the afternoons.  Her customers are all kinds of people and she has between 30 and 40 customers daily.  Profits from the business are used to reinvest.  In addition, she is saving up to expand the business in order to stock more merchandise like gift items.

Gabriela is married.  Her husband is a field hand and does not earn a steady income.  They have a son, Ángel Gabriel, who is currently in elementary school.  

Her business is very important to her because it has helped her family economically.  She also hopes in the future to enlarge her house and build her kitchen.  She hopes to support her son through her business so that he can go to the university.

She feels very happy upon getting the loan and being able to invest more in her business thus obtaining more profits to have more money to get ahead.

Graciela would like to say the following to KIVA and to Fundación Realidad: “Thanks for the loan and for enlarging the amount of the loan.”

loans.use: To buy generic medicines, perfumery, diapers and toilet paper.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S., a junior high graduate, is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. They live in Abura.

Ama makes Fante kenkey to sell [kenkey is a fermented maize dough. The Fante people typically sell their kenkey wrapped in banana leaves]. She has been selling kenkey for three years.

Ama’s loan will be added to her working capital to increase her production of kenkey. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: For working capital to increase her production of kenkey

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor R. B. labora desde hace diez años en la ciudad de Masaya, Departamento de Masaya, es casado, dependen de él tres personas de los cuales dos de ellos son sus hijos que están en edad escolar.

En estos momentos el señor R. quiere realizar mejoramientos de vivienda aprovechando que estamos en la época de verano y por esta razón se está acercando a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para compra de materiales de construcción y poder realizar las mejoras que tiene previsto, considera que al hacer estos cambios en su casa le estará dando mejor condición de vida a su familia y estará adelantándose para los cambios de la época de invierno.
texts.en:
Mr. R. B. has worked for ten years as an analyst of accounts payable for ENACAL (Nicaragua's national water and sewerage utility) in the city of Masaya in the Masaya department.

He is married and has three people who are dependent upon him.  Two of them are school age children.

Mr. R. would now like to make improvements to his house.  He wants to take advantage of the fact that it is now summer.  That is why he approaches CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy construction materials.  

With the materials he will be able to make the improvements that he has planned.  He feels that making these changes to his house will be giving his family better living conditions.  He will be moving forward on the changes for the winter.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his house

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El señor Carmelo C. es una persona trabajadora esforzada, y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de mercadería en general en especial ropa y electrodomésticos como abanicos, cocinas, radios…etc.  desde hace 5 años. El invertirá el crédito en sabanas, cubrecamas, fundas, etc. y abanicos.
C. tiene el sueño de crecer como comerciante que su negocio aumente.
texts.en: Mr. Carmelo C. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising person who has been selling general merchandise, especially clothing and home appliances like fans, stoves, ratios, etc. for the last five years.  He will invest the loan in sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases, etc. and fans.  He dreams with growing as a merchant and his business growing.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets, bed spreads, pillow cases, etc. and fans.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo soltero, tiene dos hijos a los cuales los tiene estudiando, hombre trabajador, responsable tiene su negocio de venta de perfumes, talcos, colonias para caballeros, y todo encargo de productos que su clientes requieran. 
Lo inicio con fondos propios desde hace un tiempo es el medio con que sustenta a su familia ya que la situación de encontrar trabajo esta escaso por tal empezó a comercializar producto de variedad.
Con el préstamo compra productos como. Perfumes, colonias, cremas, talcos, desodorantes, prendas de caballero, damas y niños para mantener en existencia en el momento que el cliente busque el producto. Gracias por la oportunidad de fortalecer su negoció mediante el préstamo y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is single and he has two children, both of whom are in school. He is a hardworking and responsible man. He has a perfume business and he sells perfumes, talc, gentlemen's colognes, and any products that his customers request. 

He started out some time ago with his own funds and now it is the way he supports his family. It is difficult to find work which is why he started selling these types of products. 

With his loan he will purchase products such as perfumes, colognes, skin creams, talc, deodorants, and clothing for men, women, and children. This way he will have in stock whatever products his customers are looking for. He is thankful for this opportunity to strengthen his business through this loan which will help him to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase various personal care products for resale

loans.name: Nixon

texts.es: El señor Nixon es contador en una empresa, el crédito lo necesita para comprar material de construcción como ser cemento, arena, ladrillo, estuco, esto le ayudara a mejorar su vivienda. Su trabajo es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es soltero, tiene un hijo y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de  Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mr. Nixon is an accountant at a company. He is single, has a son and lives in his own house located in the Tembladerani area of La Paz. His work is the source of income to support his family.

He needs the loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, bricks and plaster to upgrade his housing. This is the first time to request a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, plaster and bricks to upgrade his housing

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar  O. C.  de 57 años es un hombre que  vive en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de  Bolívar con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos que  están en las edades de 32 a 35 años   que en la actualidad viven de manera independiente, lograron estudiar y están casados. Julio Cesar inició su negocio   debido a que no encontró un empleo formal que le permitiera   generar ingresos, fue así como  vio la oportunidad de negocio,  en la venta de minutos, celulares, accesorios  y  en un principio también se dedicó al  comercio de productos agrícolas. Su meta en la actualidad es ampliar las ventas de minutos  e invertir en compra de celulares porque muchos clientes se quieren modernizar; mientras Julio Cesar sigue en su paraguas ofreciendo el servicio de telecomunicaciones, que le proporciona un porcentaje de ventas no inferior a un 29%. Está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pues quiere ampliar su capital de trabajo, con el comprará celulares y accesorios que tiene encargados.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar O. C. is 57 years old.  He lives with his wife in San Jacinto, in Bolívar department.  He has three children, aged between 32 and 35, who live independently.  They all managed to complete their education and are married.

Julio Cesar started his business because he couldn't find a formal job that would allow him to make income.  He saw a business opportunity selling cell phones, minutes and accessories.  In the beginning he also sold agricultural products.

Julio Cesar's current goal is to expand his sales of minutes and to invest in buying cell phones because a lot of customers want to upgrade.  In the meantime, Julio Cesar continues offering his telecommunications service which makes him a sales percentage of at least 29%.  He is applying for a Kiva loan (his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) because he would like to expand his working capital.  He will use it to buy cell phones and accessories that he has ordered.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories that he has ordered

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael Pérez M. es un hombre que desea ir mejorando su calidad de vida es por ello que para obtener mas ingresos puso en un negocio de abarrotes en que ofrece calidad y buen precio este es denominado “Abarrotes Alex” que tiene una antigüedad de 4 años al servicio de la comunidad. .Aparte de este ingreso el trabaja por las tardes en un centro comercial en el área de cocina para poder estar pagando su casa que es de interés social y tener su seguro para alguna atención medica. Rafael se ve en la necesidad de comprar mas mercancía para el negocio como lo es botanas, refrescos, comida en lata para tener mayor variedad y así sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en:
Rafael Pérez M. is a man who wants to improve his standard of living.  This is the reason why, in order to obtain more income, he opened a grocery store where he offers quality and reasonably priced items.  He named his business “Alex’s Groceries”, and has been serving the community for 4 years.

Apart from this income, he works afternoons in a kitchen in the commercial center of the area.  This helps him pay for his house, with is social housing, and for health insurance.  Rafael finds himself needing to buy more merchandise for his business, such as snacks, beverages, and canned foods.  This will allow him to offer a greater variety of products and increase sales.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as snacks, beverages and canned foods for his business.

loans.name: Mabel Antonia

texts.es:
Mabel, resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. productos lácteos y ropa, vive con su esposo y una hija D. 26 años quien es madre D. dos pequeños niños, ella inicio el negocio contando con la ayuda D. su madre, lo tiene ubicado en su propia casa y a la vez sale a ofrecer a las colonias cercanas, sin tener un horario establecido.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa y productos lácteos como queso, crema, cuajada, quesillo, con esta compra le dará mayor fuerza al negocio, capacidad para atender la demanda  y ampliar sus ventas.
Ella quiere ser una mujer D. negocios, con capacidad para desarrollarse en el comercio y ofrecer a su familia una condicione D. vida estable.
texts.en:
Mabel lives in Concepción Batres, Usulután Department.  She sells dairy products and clothes.  She lives with her husband and 26-year-old daughter who is the mother of two small children.  She started the business with help from her mother and it’s located in her home but she also goes out to neighboring areas to sell her products with no set work schedule.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothes and dairy products like cheese, cream, cottage cheese, etc.  This purchase will strengthen the business, her capacity to respond to customer demand and expand her sales.

She wants to be a businesswoman with capacity for development in commerce and to proviD. her family with stable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and dairy products.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a small market entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov. She sells small fancy goods, i.e. hair clips, combs, ponios, headbands, hair pins and imitation jewelry, in the central marketplace of her hometown. Nataliya started the business 12 years ago. She makes about 4,000 Grivnyas of net profit each month. 

Nataliya is seeking a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase better quality merchandise and attract more customers to her vending kiosk. She is a widow and thus has to provide for herself. Nataliya is hoping to see her business grow and expand in the future through the opening of additional vending locations in Belaya Tserkov.

loans.use: to purchase better quality merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.fr: Née le 09 mars 1951 au Bénin, Euphrasie  est mariée à un certain Thomas. Le couple à quatre enfants dont deux restent encore à leur  charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Euphrasie n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Euphrasie vend des tissus et des tenues (hommes et dames) depuis près de vingt ans. Euphrasie  achète ses produits au  Bénin et au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Mais Euphrasie  vend ses vêtements dans sa boutique et parfois par le système de distribution. En vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Euphrasie sollicite pour la première  fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in Benin on March 9, 1951, Euphrasie is married to a man named Thomas. The couple has four children, two of whom still depend on them. All the children attend school. The couple provides for the various needs of the household together.
Euphrasie only attended primary school. To support herself and her family, Euphrasie has been selling fabrics and outfits (for gentlemen and ladies) for almost twenty years. Euphrasie purchases her products in Benin and Togo, a neighbor country to Benin. She retails clothing in her shop and sometimes through the distribution system.
In order to increase her level of activity and to better satisfy her customers' needs, Euphrasie is requesting for the first time ALIDé's financial support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and fabrics.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Editha has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads, biscuits & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Editha is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 38 years old, married and has four children.
Sharifa has run a food market since 2008 selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. She is requesting a $1800 loan to buy an air conditioner, a generator and more foodstuffs for her market. She is aiming to earn more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, a generator and more foodstuffs for her market.

loans.name: Mery Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery; la socia tiene 39 años; la socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 5 hijos y ella se dedica a  trabajar en  una empresa de televisión en el area de personal de limpieza, la socia trabaj desde hace 5 años; la socia ahora desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de viveres para el hogar, pago de estudios de sus hios en el colegio y la socia ira pagando poco a poco con su sueldo las cuotas. La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de víveres y pagos de los estudios de colegio de sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the "SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Mery is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has five children.  She works as a cleaner at a television company.  She has been working there for five years.  She would like this loan to invest in buying provisions supplies for her home.  She will also pay her children's school expenses.  She will make her loan repayments gradually with her salary.

Mery is very happy and grateful for the support that she is receiving.  She pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy household products and to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Flor Carolina

texts.es:
Flor, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, es casada, administra una venta de ropa y cosméticos, este negocio surgió por iniciativa de su madre, quien se lo heredo, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los días.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos  y más mercadería que es demandada por sus clientes, esta compra le permitirá ampliar su negocio y tener más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando fuerte para sacar adelante a su familia y con el apoyo financiero seguir creciendo en su microempresa.
texts.en:
Flor lives with her husband and three children,  She is married, and runs a clothing and cosmetics sales business.  This business was started on the initiative of her mother, from whom she inherited it.  Her hours are from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 pm every day.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of shirts, pants, skirts, dresses and more merchandise that is in demand by her customers.  This purchase will allow her to expand her business and have more merchandise to offer her customers.

Her biggest dream is to continue working hard to move her family ahead in life, and with financial support, to continue to grow her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses for her business.

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.ru:
Абдуразок добрый и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 15 лет он занимается купля продажей крупного рогатого скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он покупает скот с других рынка районов, а затем продает на местном рынке. Он взял 1 га землю в аренду, и там выращивает картошку, помидоры, кукурузы и лука. Его семья помогает ему для посева семена и переработки земли. Абдуразок хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Он запрашивает займ для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарит вас за вашу помощь и доброты. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Abdurazok is a kind and honest person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  He has been involved in buying and selling cattle and growing agricultural crops for over 15 years.  He buys livestock at other district markets and then sells it at the local market.  Abdurazok leased a hectare of land and grows potatoes, tomatoes, corn and onions there.  His family helps him with sowing seeds and re-conditioning of the land.  Abdurazok wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.  He thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ruth Marisol

texts.es:
Ruth Marisol tiene 36 años de edad es viuda, vive con los cuatro hijos de 14,13,4 y 1 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR 28 de Enero  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El retorno, Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Ruth Marisol se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial del Cantón Puerto Pechiche y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio propio y comprar terreno para que trabajen los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta estar con los hijos ya que debe hacer de madre y padre a la ves.
texts.en:
Ruth Marisol is 36, a widow, and lives with her four children, ages 14, 13, 4 and 1 in the Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The communal bank "28 de Enero" is located in the community known as El Retorno which belongs to the Puerto Pechiche Parish in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This group is involved in agriculture, mainly raising shorty-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Ruth Marisol grows corn and rice and buys her supplies at the shopping center in Puerto Pechiche Canton.  She sells her produce at the same place and in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizer for her crops.  The loan will help her buy everything she needs.  She is up against insect plagues and plant illness.  Her dream is to have her own business and buy land so her children have a place to work.

In her free time she enjoys being with her children since she is both mother and father to them.

loans.use: To buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Shafi

texts.ru:
Shafi yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Shafi 41 qod. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. UJe 12 let kak Shafi zanimayetysa skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Shafi is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Shafi is 41 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows and expand his business.  Shafi has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years and breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows and expand his business

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a bamboo supply business. He provides bamboo to different construction companies and also provides them on a rental basis. With the loan, he will buy bamboo in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill client orders on time and increase his income.

Amna is a very good housewife and performs her household duties very efficiently. She is very confident that her family’s life will get better after making an investment into her husband’s business. Her husband has been operating his business for the past five years and she is very sure that it will definitely improve after the investment.

loans.use: To buy bamboo

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal is 48 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her children are high school and college students. Her husband works as a clerk at the local high school. 

She started her business in 2000 by planting vegetables at her home. She has many years of business and work experience. Her family supports her business. She is planning to expand her business activities. She just bought 20 chickens to start a chicken farm. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says "With the bank loan, I want to expand my business and improve my life. In the future, I also want to buy a car for the family. Like this I have many plans."

She is requesting a 1,000,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to transport the vegetables to the city of Ulaanbaatar and sell them.

loans.use: To transport the vegetables to Ulaanbaatar and sell them

loans.name: Makongo  K K Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has had a retail shop since 2000. She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees, household expenses, and improve her shop's inventory. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the shop's inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to open another shop in a different place. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Makongo K K" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Mmwanarusi

texts.en:
Mmwanarusi is a married woman with 5 children 3 of whom are enrolled in school while the rest are too young for school. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for children.

Mmwanarusi has operated a cashew nuts selling business for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; cashew nuts are harvested in seasons. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 2 bags of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bags of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Dioleta has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like caldereta, afritada and also groceries like coffee and milk powder. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and groceries for the store.

Dioleta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dioleta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and groceries for the store

loans.name: Huber

texts.es:
Huber de 28 años de edad, convive con Ketty de 25 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el caserío de Caucrican – Palcamayo. Huber aprendió sobre las labores del campo desde niño gracias a su padre. Ahora que ya tiene familia trabaja arduamente en sus terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra papas de la variedad: “de color”, “yungay” y “única”. “El trabajo es sacrificado, y empieza temprano, en la madrugada, para el riego, para la siembra y para la cosecha, pero al final trae su recompensa”, cuenta Huber.
A su vez, también se desempeña como guía turístico en la “Cueva de Guagapo” (lugar turístico y muy visitado por turistas). En esa labor llega a ganar hasta 50 soles al día, cuando son días domingos o feriados, mientras que en los días hábiles gana de 15 a 20 soles, por guía. 
Pero resalta que el trabajo agrícola, es lo que más le conviene, de acuerdo a como comercialice y en que días.
Con el tiempo, Huber quiere adquirir nuevos terrenos para ampliar sus sembríos. Así podrá asegurar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Con su ayuda, Huber podrá acceder a su préstamo número 15 de MFP, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. En cuanto a su banco comunal menciona sentirse a gusto y alegre con los integrantes. De obtener el dinero del crédito, comprará 5 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus cultivos de papa para la cosecha del mes de julio.
texts.en:
Huber, 28, lives with his common-law wife Ketty, 25.  They have three children, ages 6, 4 and 1 and live in their own house in the rural community of Caucrican - Palcamayo.  Huber learned agriculture as a child alongside his father.  Now that he has his own family he works hard on his cropland where he grows different varieties of potatoes: "colored", "yungay" and "únca".  "The work requires much self-sacrifice, since it begins very early in the morning requiring irrigation, planting and then harvesting, but in the end one is compensated", says Huber.

He also works as a tour guide at the "Cueva de Guagapo" (very popular tourist site).  He can earn up to 50 PEN a day on Sundays or holidays, although during the week he earns 15 to 20 PEN per tour.

In the future Huber wants to acquire more land and expand his plantation.  This will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.  With your help Huber will receive his 15th loan through MFP, and he is committed to paying it back on time.  He is happy with his communal bank and enjoys being with the other members.  He plans to use the loan to buy five bags of organic fertilizer for his potato crop which will be harvested in July.

loans.use: To buy five bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: C9216 Abizerwa Group

texts.en:
Console is 42 years old and has six children, between 6 and 21 years old. Her business is well-organized. She sells bananas and is the leader of the group, which is called "C9216 Abizerwa" in the local language. 

Console has one year of experience in this business. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more bananas to sell. With the profit, she expects to save money for her future and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu, 44, is a married woman with seven children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business selling palm wine made from coconuts, selling to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to become a main supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for making palm wine for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for making palm wine for sale.

loans.name: Celia Jenny

texts.es:
Celia Jenny tiene 42 años de estado civil Viuda, vive con el papá  y con su  hijo, de catorce años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, arroz fréjol y soya.

Jenny  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  superarse y darle un mejor futuro hijo en el estudio.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pescar y estar unida con la familia.
texts.en:
Celia Jenny is 42 years old, a widow, living with her father and her 14 year old son.  She lives in the Ventanas canton of the Rios province.

The service point El Recreo is located in the San Vicente Las Lomas area, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  This service point is dedicated to short cycle farming such as growing corn, rice, beans and soy beans.

Jenny has been making a living growing corn, beans and rice for the last three years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells her production in the same place.

The requested loan is for the purchase of fertilizers for the sowing of corn.  The loan helps her to increase her income for the support of her family and for investment.  Her dream is to improve herself and provide a better future for her son in his schooling.

In her free time she likes to fish and be with her family.

loans.use: to purchase various fertilizers for her corn crop.

loans.name: Sorofina

texts.en:
Sorofina  is a 51 year-old  and married . She has been selling charcoal for the last six years. Her monthly income from her business is kes 10,000. 

This is her first loan of Kes 20,000  from KADET ltd to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to the residents of Mshomoroni. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business more and repay her loan. 
Her hopes and dreams are to open charcoal distribution store to supply charcoal to other parts of  Mombasa.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: C.c.e.p.e/ Thiocé Group

texts.fr:
Le C.C.E.P.E  est une association des éducateurs du préscolaire, représentée par deux dames qui exercent le métier depuis plusieurs années. Aminata habillée en blanc, est la présidente, elle est divorcée et mère d’un enfant qui est à sa charges. Elle évolue dans le métier depuis 20 ans. Avec le crédit, elles veulent réhabiliter l’école avant la réouverture des classes.
 Aminata participe à la gestion familiale car elle vit avec ses parents et a la charge de son enfant qui s’y trouve aussi.
Comme projet futur, elle désire acquérir un terrain à elles seules pour pouvoir construire d’autres classes.

loans.use: réhabilisation de l'école

loans.name: Sadou

texts.fr: SADOU est né en DÉCEMBRE 1973 à GOUAN, cercle de KADIOLO, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali .Mr SADOU est âgé de 42 ans avec 4 enfants dont 1 fille. Mr SADOU réside à SOROMANA dans une famille traditionnelle. Mr SADOU s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de bœufs. Sa vente se fait à SOROMANA, FAKOLA et à NIENA. Fort de  ses 8 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  sixième prêt. Mr SADOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 bœufs. Il s’approvisionne à SOROMANA et environnants. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant à une clientèle mixte. Mr SADOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat de bœufs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 25-year-old, charismatic young woman who is a strong example of hard work. Nancy is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers. On her farm, she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Nancy makes a commission on sales for which she helps to arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a two years. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. Given that Nancy can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal such as maize and beans from local farmers at fair prices and to use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Her vision is to one day become the leading supplier of cereal produce. Support her dream by giving Nancy a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereal from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 49-year-old woman from the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a married woman. Her husband works hard as a sound system operator while Gemma operates a small sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells a variety of goods. Aside from this, she also sells coconut wine known as “tuba” in locals.

Gemma describes her biggest business challenge is having an insufficient capital. This is the reason why she is requesting for a loan. She will buy grocery items such as snacks foods, food seasonings, noodles and canned goods. She will also buy “tuba” wine. Gemma’s main goal in life is to augment their livelihood for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy rocery items such as snacks foods, food seasonings, noodles and canned goods; tuba wine

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Teresa has been divorced for some time. She has two children and she lives in the city of Kanasin in Yucatan. She saw the need to start a business that would permit her to support her children, as her ex-husband did not help them with their expenses. Following this difficult situation, Maria Teresa started two years ago with a small grocery store, and to increase her earnings she started a movie rental. She found that movie rentals were in great demand to she decided to set up her Video club, a business that she has managed for the past two years, and it has been improving thanks to her efforts and arduous work.

Her integrity and responsibility are the qualities that define Maria Teresa. She now requires a loan in the amount of $925 to purchase movies and be able to have more new releases and improve her income. Your generosity can be a great help for her. Do not doubt any longer and support her. She and her children will forever thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María Teresa es divorciada desde hace algún tiempo, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la localidad de Kanasín, Yucatán. Ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le permitirá sostener a sus hijos, ya que el su ex esposo no le ayuda con los gastos. Frente a esta difícil situación, Maria Teresa comenzó hace dos años con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y para incrementar sus ingresos decidió rentar películas, ella vio que la renta de películas tenía mucha demanda y se decidió a poner un Video club, con este negocio lleva más de 2 años y ha mejorado gracias a su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo.

La entereza y la responsabilidad son cualidades que definen a María Teresa, ella ahora requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS par comprar un lote de películas y así poder tener más estrenos y mejorar sus ingresos. Tu generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para ella, no lo dudes más y apóyala, ella y sus hijos te lo van agradecer siempre.

loans.use: purchase movies

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a single mother of 2 children and 24 years old. She was educated to the senior school level. Pressing family needs denied her the opportunity to continue from there.

With her father's help, she has set up a small pub in her community. However, notwithstanding the good patronage she enjoys, she is adversely restricted by the number of crates she can afford to purchase at one time.

Vera would therefore be glad if KIVA could assist her with the loan required to support her capital investment.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Azimali

texts.en: Azimali K. is 49 and he has five children. He is the owner of a small store where he sells plastic furniture, which is in great demand of holiday makers and open cafes and restaurants. The place he works is very cramped and dark and it has had a negative impact on his health. He plans to rent another place to sell his furniture where it is bigger and brighter, and for this purpose he would like to borrow a $1000 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: Mr. Khanmadov would like to rent a better place to sell his plastic furniture because where he is now is impacting his health.

loans.name: Hamil

texts.en:
Hamil A. is a 44-year-old married man who has had his own wood-working studio for six years. Hamil lives with his wife and three children in Sabirabad, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. With his first loan of US$ 600 from Aqroinvest CU he opened his studio, and he managed to repay that amount before term. Hamil makes tables, chairs, window frames and doors in his small studio. He is considered an excellent carpenter, and not only in his own town. Every day he gets more than 20 orders from nearby villages and outlying regions.

Increasing prices in Azerbaijan have affected the wood sector also. The number of wood-working studios is increasing and the price for wood is increasing also. In summer it is easier to get wood than in winter. Summertime is also high season for orders from his customers.

The tools Hamil uses for his work are old, so he has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase new, modern planing tools to make his work easier. The estimated cost for an automated cutter is $600 and he needs other tools as well.

loans.use: purchase a modern planing cutter and other tools

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is an honest, active worker that does not like to depend on anybody else; she currently lives with her partner, they have 4 children and she really likes sales. Her partner works as a security guard with a low salary, and that is why she started her own business to help support her family. She has been working on her business since 1999 when she started selling corn and later on during winter she would sell prepared meals and in the summer she sells fruits and soft drinks that she gives in bags. She wants to expand her business and improve the quality of the products that she offers.

Rosa Maria is asking for a loan of $475 in order to invest in raw materials, merchandise and assets that will allow her to transport her products so that she can offer them in more places, offering to pay back the loan in 4 months. She and her family thank the support that they are given so that they can improve with their business and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa María es una persona, honesta, trabajadora y activa que no le gusta depender de nadie, ella vive actualmente en unión libre con su pareja, tienen 4 hijos y a ella le gustan mucho las ventas y además que su esposo trabaja como velador, tiene un ingreso bajo, fue por ello que decidió empezar con su propio negocio y apoyar en la economía familiar, lleva trabajando en su negocio desde 1999 cuando empezó a vender elotes y posteriormente en la temporada de invierno vendía comidas y cenas y en temporada de calor vende frutas y refrescos que los da en bolsas. Ella desea crecer con su negocio y poder mejorar la calidad de sus productos que ofrece.

Rosa maría esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para invertir en su negocio en materia prima, mercadería y activos que le permitan transportar sus productos para así poder ofrecerlos en más lugares, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le das para poder mejorar con su negocio y salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise, raw materials  and assets in order to expand business

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es:
Rosa is 30 years old, and studied through secondary school. She has four children who are still dependent on her. She lives in the Wichanzao sector in the district of La Esperanza, the province of Trujillo and the department of La Libertad. She is a member of the community bank "Santa Elena II".

Rosa used to spend her days taking care of the household chores. Later she came up with the idea to open a small business, a general store, in her own house. She started the business with the help of her husband, who supported her with a small amount of money. That money served as her initial capital. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 Peruvian sols ($100) she bought additional products such as detergents, soaps, and toilet paper, to add more variety to her store. Currently Rosa sells bread, soft drinks, vegetables, snacks, eggs, etc.

With this new loan of 400 Peruvian sols ($133), which will be repaid in 4 months, Rosas will buy additional products such as sweets, cookies, and juices, as a way to continue adding variety to her inventory. She dreams of someday having a house with all the modern comforts and a great store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 30 años, su grado de instrucción es secundaria completa, tiene cuatro hijos que aun dependen de ella; vive en el sector Wichanzao en el Distrito de La Esperanza, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad, pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Elena II”.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar y tuvo la idea de poner un pequeño negocio en su propia casa, una bodeguita. Comenzó con la ayuda de su esposo que le apoyo con una pequeña propina que le sirvió de capital. Con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 ($100) compró otros productos como detergentes, jabones, papel higiénico para surtir su bodeguita. Actualmente la señora Rosa vende pan, gaseosas, menestras, huevos, etc.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.400.00 soles ($ 133) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró otros productos como golosinas, galletas, jugos para continuar surtiendo su bodega. Ella sueña con tener una casa con todas las comodidades y una gran tienda.

loans.use: Purchase of sweets, cookies and juices

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif S. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 1 child. Sharif S. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and the loan sums are permanently increased, which shows business stability and development. His business includes meat and milk production and milk products. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and cow for further meat and milk-sour goods production. He plans to add to his inventory of milk and sour products pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. Now Mr. S. requires a loan of 4000 STJ for a pedigree bull and milk cow purchase,  which will allow him to increase significantly the family income, and permit him to plan for further business and inventory expansion.

loans.use: Pedigree bull and milk cow purchase

loans.name: Noralam

texts.en: Noralam lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 6 children. He is an educated man who studied the University of Agriculture. He has a lot of land for cultivation but he is unable to continue working and  is facing with lots of winter snow. He wants to get ready for next summer and is requesting an individual loan to make his land ready for cultivation and start working. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To make his land ready for cultivation

loans.name: Groupement Gameli

texts.fr:
The GAMELI Group was created by these three gentlemen. They have been raising pigs for five years and are the main suppliers to the bars in the region. By the income from their work, each gentleman manages to support his family. This group has also employed five young men, who help them with their work. They would like to use these funds to increase the size of their herd by buying a dozen sows and five hogs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement GAMELI est créé par ces trois messieurs. Ils opèrent dans l’élevage des porcs depuis 05 ans et sont les premiers fournisseurs des bars dans la région. Par les revenus de leur activité chacun arrive à supporter les charges de sa famille. Ce groupement a aussi engagé 5 jeunes hommes qui les aident dans l’exécution de leur tâche. Ils désirent par ces fonds augmenter la capacité de leur troupeau en achetant une dizaine de truies et 05 cochons

loans.use: To buy five female pigs and ten males  pigs and also to enlarge the pig pen.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen C., 30, is the mother of one child. She stays at home looking after her child and cooking food for her family. Her husband works growing a variety of vegetables on a plot of farmland; he makes about $1.50 a day of profit.

With this loan, they will purchase fertilizers to put on their corps to gain more profits.

(Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Olipa

texts.en: Olipa B. M. is a mother of five. She lives in the Mburahati area of Dar Es Salaam. She runs a charcoal store in the area, a business she has been doing for the past six years. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her store and increase business.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Ndeye F. is a married mother of two children. She runs a store that she opened in 2005 in the Moussante market in Thies, where she sells foodstuffs. With this loan, she would like to purchase supplies for her store in order to better satisfy her customers and build a loyal customer base.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

NDEYE F. est une femme mariée et mére de deux enfants .Elle gère une boutique qu'elle a ouvert depuis 2005 au marché moussanté de THIES et elle y vend des denréees alimentaires .Avec ce pret elle veut acheter de la marchandise pour sa boutique pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qu'elle veut fidéliser.

loans.use: Sales

loans.name: Babalarov

texts.en: Babalarov S. is 52 years old, married, and has three children. He earns income breeding calves for meat production in the Internally Displaced People's Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. S. has more than 20 years of experience in this field and currently needs a loan of US$900 to be able to purchase three additional calves for US$300 each.

loans.use: Purchase of three calves

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji, the wife of M.S., lives in Raiwind, Pakistan, where she owns a two room brick house. She is the mother of five children: four daughters and one son, all enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband works in a factory, while Nusrat baji has a milk business. She successfully completed three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Naziran baji wants a loan for her embroidery business, while Rashda baji, Razia baji and Sabra baji want to buy a buffalo for their milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Tagoiali.

texts.ru:
Tagoiali Z. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. For his whole life he has been engaged in animal industries. He has a small farm where he breeds livestock. He breeds sheep and bulls and goats. After he fattens up the animals, he sells part of the herd, and in their place buys more livestock.. Therefore he plans to receive a loan so that he can increase the numbers of his livestock. He plans to repay the loan within 6 months. Tagoiali is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Зоиров Тагойали житель города Яван. Всю жизнь занимается животноводством . У него небольшое хозяйство , где разводит домашний скот. У него есть и овцы и бычки , и козы. Откормив животных , он какую-то часть продает и на их место покупает новых. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит он сможет в течение 6 месяцев. Тагойали женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Increase livestock

loans.name: Gevifer Ngoda's Ngorogoro Group

texts.en:
Genifer Ngonda, age 55, is a widow with six children (ages, 36, 34, 32, 30, 27 and 25). She has a chicken business which she started in 1987. She opens from 7am to 5pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $435.

In the past Genifer has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy chicken feed. She hopes for a new loan to build a water reserve pit because of the shortage of water in her area. She also plans to buy more chicks. Genifer will share this loan with her subgroup, which belongs to Ngorongoro, who deal in selling fish, soap, clothes, rice and the tailoring business.

In the picture Genifer is the 1st from the left.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and build a water storage

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac es un noble joven dedicado a la agricultura, labor con la cual puede ayudar a  su familia frente a la crisis económica que vienen atravesando, a sus 22 años está íntegramente dedicado a sus terrenos de cultivo, donde invierte su  juventud y tiempo  con el fin de lograr el bienestar en su familia.  Acompañado con sus ganas de progreso, desea ser independiente, forjar su futuro y conformar su propia familia.  Es consiente que  eso podrá realizar siempre en cuando logre  adquirir una estabilidad económica para ofrecer a su familia lo necesario y no hacerles pasar carencias.  Es por ello que  desea adquirir un terreno donde para ampliar su producción, sembrar nuevos productos y llevarlos a vender a los mercados de la ciudad más cercana.  Bajo estas metas requiere de su apoyo, solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes necesarios  para toda  producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Isaac is a noble young man who works in agriculture; work with which he can help his family face the economic crisis that is coming through. At 22 years old, he is completely dedicated to the land he cultivates, where he invests his youth and time with the goal of obtaining the well-being of his family. Accompanied by his desire to progress, he wants to be independent, to shape his future, and to form his own family. He is aware that he will be able to accomplish this when he is able to establish economic stability to offer his family the necessities and not have them go through shortages. It is because of this that he wants to acquire land, where he can expand his production, plant new products, and take them to the markets in the closest city for sale. Given these goals, he requires your support. He requests a loan to buy seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers necessary for all agricultural production.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his farming

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn M. lives in Koh Nhae Village in Takeo Province. She is 35 years old and the mother of five children. Four of her children attend the local school while the youngest, at three years old, is too young for work or study. She is a farmer who cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sao Phat, helps her in their rice plantation.

However with only one business, it is hard for them to support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Lorn M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a breeding cow. She hopes to increase their income by selling bred cows in addition to rice.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Ugomma

texts.en: Ugomma makes a living selling foodstuffs like bags of garri, a food made from cassava that's popular in West Africa. She has been in this business for a long time. Ugomma is 25 years old and married with one child. She hopes to be a major distributor of garri in future, and has applied for a loan to buy more of it to sell. She extends her thanks to everyone who helps make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov K. is a villager in Chi Paing village in Kampong Cham province. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school.  She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since this business is going well, Mrs Pov K. wants to expand and so she decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Ry Khim, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables. Her husband is shown on the right in the picture.

loans.use: Tto buy grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng P., 65, is married and lives in the Battambang province. Working on a farm together with his wife Vith Sambath, Teng P. typically makes US$1.50 per day. His family is also supported by one of their three children who works for an organization. Teng P. currently needs a loan of US$500 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds for the farm, a purchase that he believes can increase his daily income.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Zlotescu's Group

texts.en:
Zlotescu P. is the coordinator for this group in the village of Cimislia district. The group members all live in the same village.

This group hopes to utilize this loan to further their existing business ventures or create new operations in order to increase their profit levels. They want to buy 15 hectares of land in their native village and they will also need fuel for the tractor that will help them plow the land. Sales will be in the region. P. hopes that his relatives will support him to provide them with the possibility of starting their own businesses.

On behalf of P. and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support.

loans.use: Buy land and tractor fuel

loans.name: Celina Alejandra

texts.es: Celina Alejandra C. D. G., resiD. en el cantón el Carmen en Zacatecoluca. A sus 42 años D. edad trabaja arduamente para proveer D. todas las necesidades básicas a su familia, ya que ella tiene 4 hijos cuyas edades oscilan desD. los 11 años hasta los 19 años D. edad, todos son estudiantes. Es por esto que Celina día con día trabaja en su propio negocio el cuál esta ubicado en el Instituto Nacional del Rosario D. La Paz, ahí ella venD. pupusas (comida típica salvadoreña), golosinas, bebidas  como sodas, café, entre otros productos, todo esto lo comercializa a los estudiantes D. dicho instituto. Celina solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar los productos D. su negocio, D. manera que logre vender más y obtener mayores ingresos, los cuales le permita dar alimentación, vestido y estudio a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales son el motor que impulsa a Celina a esforzarse cada día.
texts.en:
Celina Alejandra C. D. G. lives in Carmen, Zacatecoluca. At 42 years old, she struggles to proviD. basic necessities to her 4 children, ranging from 11-19 years of age, all of whom are in school.
