That is the reason that Celina works day in and day out at her food stand, where she sells popusas (a traditional Salvadoran food), candy, sodas, coffee, as well as other products, to the students of Instituto Nacional Del Rosario D. La Paz, the school near which her store is located. Celina is asking for a loan which she will use to improve the selection that she can offer in order to attract customers and improve her income, which in turn will allow her to proviD. food, clothing, and schooling to the 4 beautiful children who are her reason for getting out of bed every day.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more products for her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ROSA; es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, vive en ayllupampa, ubicado a 10 minutos de la provincia de Urubamba.

La socia tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos de (18, 16,12 y 10), años, ella alterna sus actividades domésticas con la compra al por mayor de verduras y la venta de las mismas, ella también desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de aves de corral, como pollos, gallinas ponedoras de huevos. Para lo cual solicita el préstamo.

La socia esta muy agradecida con este medio por otorgarle el préstamo y así mismo se compromete en el pago total de su deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Our member, ROSA, was born in the province of Urubamba, she lives in Ayllupampa, located 10 minutes from the province of Urubamba.

The member is 36 years old, a single mother with 4 children, 18, 16, 12, and 10 years old, she alternates her chores with the purchase in bulk of vegetables, which she sells. She wants to invest her loan in buying poultry such as chickens and egg-laying hens. This is the reason for requesting the loan.

The member is thankful to these means for giving her the loan and she is committed to repay her total debt within the deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling vegetables and poultry.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Salma R. N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 6 and 10.

Salma has been running a charcoal-selling and a fish-selling business since 2004. She sells charcoal, which is used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative! Salma works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by two people. Salma currently earns about 250 USD from her business.

Salma is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to establish a new business. Salma thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk for her business

loans.name: Merum Group

texts.en:
Merum is the leader of the Merum group. There are two members in this group and they want to take a loan to progress their businesses. Merum wants to take a loan for her son's car part shop. Safara wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business.

They are requesting a group loan for 28000 Afghanis for the term of eight months. They are thankful for AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her son's car part shop.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is forty-five years old. She is married and the mother of six children. All of the children are in school. She has been a manufacturer of palm oil for seven years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits, and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil.

Alima produces and supplies the oil to food vendors to prepare their meals, and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished product elsewhere when demand becomes very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and gallon containers to store the oil, and to increase her efficiency by producing oil in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and to finance her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means "see what the Lord has done."

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to produce palm oil in larger quantities.

loans.name: Aterei F Aanyu Mary Group

texts.en:
A. Mary is 21 years old and married with three children of which one is schooling.

Mary operates a retail shop and sells fish, so far for two years. She is using the loan to purchase retail stock such as sugar, rice, millet flour, soap, matchboxes, cooking oil and smoked fish for sale. She hopes for improvement in her business and her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock such as sugar, rice, millet flour, soap, matchboxes, cooking oil and smoked fish

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Greetings from Beatrice M., a 41-year-old married woman with five children, ages 18, 16, 13, 11 and 9. She and her family live in Nyarugenge district in Kigali city the capital of Rwanda.

M. runs her business in Nyarugenge district, where she owns a small printer and produces postcards, invitation cards and more. Beatrice is seeking her first loan worth 500,000 Rwf (US$900) from Vision Finance Company to buy another printing machine. 

This entrepreneur has six years of experience and employs three people who help her in running the business smoothly. She starts her business at 8:00 a.m. and closes at 6:00 p.m. every day.

This business enables Beatrice to have a monthly profit of $1,000, and with the increased profit she hopes to pay school fees for her children and continue to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy a printing machine

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị L. (1830071571) is a 51 year old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling rice cakes in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. L. is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Benkadi 3  De (Benkadi A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe  BENKADI 3  de l’association BENKADI A sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans  et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles  achèteront de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 26  hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue dans les marchés de  Marka-Coungo et Fana,  après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Benkadi 3 of the BENKADI A association are married women with an average age of 38 years old and 3 children. For the most part, these women live in polygamous marriages in Tingole, the capital of a rural commune under the prefecture of Fana, the second administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to get financial support for their winter labors. Largely, their labor surrounds the cultivation of sorgho and peanuts. This is their fifth loan from the institution and all of their previous loans were completely repaid on time. With this new loan they will purchase fertilizer, pesticides, other basic tools, and pay the hoeing and labor fees that are required to cultivate 26 hectares. Some of their cultivation is shared among the group members for personal consumption and the rest is sold in the Marka-Coungo and Fana markets after the harvest to male and female clients. They believe that they will make an average profit of 30 000FCFA after the harvest and sale of their crops.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, pesticides, hoeing and basic tools

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is a forty-eight year widow with five children between the ages of ten and thirty. Three of her children go to school and the other two are working. Teo doesn't have any responsibility for caring for any additional family members.

She rents a four-room house in a semi-urban area where she lives with twelve people. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs because she both buys and sells from her place of work. She sells the local brew and gin to an average of twenty customers a day. Teo sells to mature people only and works seven days a week.

Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence, plus medication. She has been in this business for six years. Teo has been with the Kiva field partner, MCDT, for four years, now servicing her tenth loan, and working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local brew and gin. Teo hopes to see her business grow bigger.

loans.use: To buy more local brew and gin to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de diverses qualités ; elle habite le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé ; elle a débuté cette activité en 2007. Ce commerce lui permet surtout de se prendre en charge et donc, de subvenir à ses besoins de base. Elle est bien connue de biens de femmes habitant non seulement son quartier mais aussi des femmes d’autres quartiers. Elle accepte même parfois de vendre à crédit pour ne pas perdre certaines de ses clientes qui ne peuvent payer immédiatement. Actuellement elle a besoin d’acheter des pagnes au Grand Marché de Lomé, mais aussi dans le marché de Kpalimé à quelques dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 pagnes de qualité Super Wax, 15 pagnes Soso et 25 pagnes Bogolan. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.

loans.use: Achat de pagnes de qualité

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat C., 25, lives with her husband and young child in the Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a professional decorates handicrafts. Since 2000, she been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$4 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive, too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Khat C. would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase more silk for decorate.

loans.use: To purchase more silk for decorate.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie R. is from the village of Tag-Ibo, Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Marjorie is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Marjorie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of electromagnetic therapy bracelets in the local community. Marjorie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjorie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marjorie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Diotilia

texts.es:
La señora  DIOTILIA A. I. tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito de FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  LA PERBOLA . Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es casada  y tiene 4 hijos de  los cuales solo 2 dependen económicamente de ella.
La socia  se dedica a la fabricación y venta de zapatos de damas y niñas. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para la fabricación de zapatos como: cuero, hebillas, tacos, plantas, hormas, terocal, etc.
Con este nuevo crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles comprará hebillas, pegamentos, hormas, plantillas, etc para fabricar su calzado.
DIOTILIA sueña con tener su propio taller de fabricación de calzado parta así poder aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
DIOTILIA A. I., 49, lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru, and belongs to the Communal Bank La Perbola. She studied up to the 5th grade of secondary school, is married and has four children, of which two are financially dependent on her.

She works in the manufacturing and sale of shoes for women and children. With her first loan of 300 new soles, she bought materials for manufacturing shoes such as leather, buckles, heels, soles, lasts etc. With this new loan of 600 new soles, she will buy buckles, glue, lasts, insoles etc. to make her footwear. Diotilia dreams of having her own workshop for manufacturing footwear to thereby increase her sales and obtain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buckles, glue, lasts, insoles etc.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.es:
La señora Rolanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de  01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Rolanda, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, que se dedica a la venta de mercería y lleva 10 años en el negocio y a pesar de las dificultades, que paso en el trascurso de su vida, siguió adelante la cual esto le dieron muy buenos resultados. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará mercería para su stock como: desodorantes, kolynos, talcos, espejos, cepillos, papel higiénico, linternas,  lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Rolanda, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Rolanda is a member of the Sargento Lores Communal Bank in the Morales district, San Martín province, San Martín province. She is 56, married, and has one child who is still dependent upon her. He goes to school. Rolanda is a fighter and a hard-working woman. She has been in the business of selling merchandise for ten years. In spite of the difficulties that she has had during her life, she continued on, and that gave her very good results. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy merchandise like deodorant, toothpaste, powder, mirrors, brushes, toilet paper, flashlights, lipstick, and nail polish. Rolanda, with her maturity, is an example to follow for many women who start a business. With perseverance they can achieve their dreams. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products

loans.name: Lass

texts.en:
Lass P., 54, is a low-income woman living in an area where there are many Islamic people, in Cambodia. To earn a living, Lass P. sells dry fish in the busy local market and typically generates an income US$ 3 each day to meet her family’s daily living expenses. She also buys fresh fish and turns them into dried fish and sells them retail to her regular customers who come to buy things in the market. Her husband earns money by providing a taxi service.

This couple has three children, one of whom is married and the other two single; both are employed in a garment factory. In the past, Lass P. hired a rental shop inside the market to sell her fish and she hopes to own a shop in order to cut down on rental cost. That is why she requested a loan of US$ 1000.

loans.use: To buy a shop

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto R. is from the village of Barangay Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 44 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Ernesto owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Ernesto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is forty-eight years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Comfort is a food vendor, preparing and selling all kinds of local dishes. She procures foodstuffs from nearby communities.

Comfort has been in business for fourteen years and wants a loan to buy foodstuffs and other ingredients in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 30 years old and unmarried. He completed primary school and passed the exam to attend intermediate school.

The borrower owns a restaurant. He will use this loan to expand his restaurant and purchase a grilling machine, refrigerator, freezer, and food for his restaurant. 

He offers good service, a neat and clean place to eat, and all of the services that his customers require, thereby, gaining more customers. He has been able to enlarge his shop and hire more waiters to serve the clients. 

He has a good reputation among his colleagues in the market and is pleasant to his customers. This attracts many clients who decide to have their meals there. He serves a three-course meal every day.

loans.use: To buy a grilling machine, refrigerator, freezer, and food for his restaurant

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en: Nasser is a 47-year-old married man with 4 unemployed children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1990. He serves his village and its surroundings. He is well known by his customers, and sometimes he works on a private basis to earn extra profit for his family. Today, Nasser is requesting a loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance on his car after being in bad circumstances.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Carla Josefa

texts.es: La señora Carla Josefa tiene 7 años de experiencia de maestra de educación, soltera anteriormente se le financio un crédito para estudios, ella está solicitando actualmente un crédito para ayudarla a su mama a comprar  materiales de vivienda ya que terminara de arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carla Josefa has been a teacher for 7 years. She is single. She got a previous loan to pay for her schooling. She is currently asking for funds that will be used to help her mother buy building materials and supplies to finish fixing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is divorced. She is a single mom raising a six-year-old daughter. Tetyana is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. She owns a small bakery making bread and pastries. Moreover, she owns eight vending locations selling her products in different parts of her hometown. She can boast of affordable prices and favorable locations for her vending kiosks. Tetyana has 15 hired employees. She has been in this trade for seven years. Currently, Tetyana has 10,000 Grivnyas in monthly income. Her working capital amounts to 40,000 Grivnyas.  

Tetyana is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to purchase four tons of flour to manufacture additional merchandise for sale before Easter season. She is hoping to continue expanding her business, providing for her family’s needs. Tetyana is using the generated profit to save for her daughter’s college and ensure a decent education for her only child.

loans.use: To purchase four tons of flour

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 32 years old. He is married to Jackline Kiptanui and both live in Kabarnet Town. Douglas runs a posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into flour) that he started two years ago. He gets a monthly profit of Ksh.8000, and additional income from farming.

Douglas was introduced to KADET Ltd. by an existing client. He has borrowed Kshs. 40000 from Kadet. This is his first loan from any MFI (micro-finance institution. He will use the loan to buy maize and millet for his milling business. If this loan boosts his business, he will use the extra profit to expand the business.

Douglas hopes and dreams of going back to school for further studies, of buying a lorry for fast transport of maize and millet, and of having a plot of land in the town. He describes himself as honest, faithful, hardworking, and sober-minded.

loans.use: To buying more stock for his posho mill

loans.name: Tres De Mayo De Poroy Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY” está representado por la señora Vilma que es la presidenta, Yovanna que es la secretaria, Ana María que es la tesorera y Martha que es la fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el IV ciclo y está conformado por 11 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
 
Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios es por ejemplo; crianza y venta de ovejas, elaboración de artesanía, venta de frutas, compra y venta de animales menores, venta de verduras y menestras y venta de comestibles. Otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo; especialistas en nutrición, transportes, mecánico dental  y docencia.  

Cornelia, tiene 60 años, es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos y se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado central de la ciudad del Cusco, ella nos cuenta que va al mercado aproximadamente a las 5 de la mañana y se queda vendiendo hasta las 6 de la noche. Ella requiere el préstamo que invertirá en comprar productos como por ejemplo machas, papas, huevera de pescado, etc. Ella vende sus productos por Semana Santa. Desde 1969 es vendedora en el mercado de San Pedro. Ya son 5 años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien gracias a la puntualidad y responsabilidad de los pago de las cuotas. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la región sur del país.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Tres de Mayo de Poroy” is led by Sra. Vilma who serves as president, Yovanna who serves as secretary, Ana María who serves as treasurer, and Martha who serves as auditor. The members meet every thirty days at the microfinance offices of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. The Communal Bank is currently in its fourth loan cycle and consists of 11 hardworking and enterprising individuals who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and provide their children with a better future. Some examples of the businesses the members are engaged in include buying and selling sheep, producing handicrafts, selling fruit, buying and selling small animals, selling vegetables and stews, and selling groceries. Others work in service positions such as nutritionists, transport drivers, dental technicians, and teachers. Cornelia is 60 years old and a single mother of five children. She sells vegetables at the central market in Cusco. Cornelia says that she leaves for the market around 5am and stays until 6pm. She needs a loan to buy products such as clams, potatoes, fish eggs, and other items to sell for Holy Week. Cornelia has been a vendor at the San Pedro Market since 1969. She has participated in the Communal Bank for five years and has performed very well as a result of her timely and responsible payments. The members value and appreciate the loan that has been provided to them and promise to make their payments on time. Cusco is a city known for its archaeological sites, historical center, landscapes, and history. It is a charming city located in the southern part of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various food products to sell during Holy Week

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie N. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a une ancienneté de 7 ans et demi dans le Banc Villageois et a bénéficié 15 fois de suite de crédit. Elle est propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure, elle a pris en location un local dans son village pour y exercer son métier de coiffeuse. Son crédit lui servira à acheter de la matière première pour la coiffure, des mèches et à payer les frais de location. Elle soutien son mari dans les différentes charges quotidiennes de la maison.
texts.en:
Marie N. is 39 years old, she is married and the mother of five children. She has a seniority of seven and a half years in the Banc Villageois and has enjoyed 15 consecutive loans. She has a hairdressing salon and is renting a premise in her village to practice her trade of hairdressing. Her loan will allow her to buy the basic material for hairdressing, hair extensions and to pay the expenses from her rent. She supports her husband with the various daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her hairdressing business

loans.name: Emperatriz Iliminada

texts.es:
Emperatriz de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos. Como toda madre que se esfuerza por sus hijos Emperatriz empezó a trabajar para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos invirtiendo sus ahorros en telas y hilos, porque hace ya años atrás ella había estudiado costura y confección.  

Emperatriz después de haber comprado la maquina de coser y las telas se promociono como costurera a todos sus amigos, poco a poco tuvo clientes. Ahora ella tiene un taller de costura, confección y trabaja de su casa. Para trabajar mejor desde su casa quiere comprar con el préstamo una maquina de coser. 

En el futuro quiere fusionar su taller de costura con una papelería para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
]Emperatriz is 55 years old, she lives in an urban zone in the Orquideas of Guayaquil and has two children. As all mothers who make an effort for their children, Emperatriz started to work to give her children a better life, investing her savings in material and thread as years ago she had been studying sewing and dressmaking.

After having bought the sewing machine and the cloth she promoted herself as a dressmaker among her friends and little by little she got customers. Now she has a sewing workshop and works at home. To improve her work from home, with the loan she will buy a sewing machine.

In the future she wishes to merge her workshop with a stationery store to obtain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and material.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen V. is from the town of Banga. She is 57 years old and married with 4 children. To make a living, Belen plants and harvests rice for sale. Belen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Belen joined CEVI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen is requesting her first loan from CEVI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seed, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About CEVI

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seed, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo P. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. He is 49 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Leo owns & operates a boarding house. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from the income generated from leased properties. Leo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for personal purposes. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leo from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For personal use

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel M. Riveros es una señora de 65 años  y  tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad y ya con familias independientes. 
Se dedica a la costura desde hace 40 años, dicha actividad la desarrollo en diversas situaciones, ya sea trabajando para otras personas, como en los primeros tiempos o desarrollando un emprendimiento propio, como lo hizo Ysabel hace 20 años. 
Luego de trabajar por mucho tiempo como empleada de fabricas de ropas, Ysabel pudo comprar una maquina de coser y empezar de esa manera un trabajo independiente, al correr de los años pudo formar un pequeño taller de costuras.
El crédito obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya, lo ha invertido en el mejoramiento de su salón de trabajo, que con el crecimiento del emprendimiento ha ido quedando chico. Ysabel agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ysabel M. Riveros is 65 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are independent and have their own families. She has been a seamstress for 40 years and has developed this skill through many different working situations. She worked for others in the early stages of her vocation and launched her own business 20 years ago. After working for some time as an employee in a clothing factory, Ysabel was able to buy a sewing machine and in this way begin working independently. Through the years, she was able to start her own little sewing workshop. She invested the credit that she received from Fundación Paraguaya in improving her workspace, which with the growth of her business became too small. Ysabel is grateful for the support that Fundación Paraguaya has offered her.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish her workspace

loans.name: Seda

texts.en: Seda B. has a family of ten. She and her daughter are the main financial supporters.  Seda has been managing her clothing business since 1999  and has applied for the loan to purchase new clothing stock. While she manages the business, her daughter will travel to the neighboring country to purchase the clothing.

loans.use: renewing the clothing stock

loans.name: Constantino

texts.es: Constantino tiene 47 años, convive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, actividad que le ayuda para sobrevivir en caso de escasez económica, sin embargo su trabajo se intensifica más en la agricultura, sembrando y cosechando papa. Por otro lado tuvo riesgos de perdida, por tal motivo siembra productos alternativos como la oca y la cebada, alimentos que también guarda para la despensa de la familia. Afirma que le gusta su trabajo, y se siente contenta ya que sus hijos y su esposa lo apoyan en el trabajo, pero cuando se requiere de mucho esfuerzo contrata a peones para que le ayuden a terminar el trabajo. Para el futuro desea tener más extensiones de terreno y  comprar cabezas de animal ovino. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas de papa.
texts.en:
Constantino is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their own home. He’s been farming and raising livestock for more than 20 years. This helps him to survive in times of financial scarcity. Never the less, his farming work is more intense; planting and harvesting potatoes. He lost money in his other work, so he’s been planting alternative crops, such as ocra (a type of tuber) and barley. He reserves some to feed his family. He tells us that he likes his work and feels happy that his children and wife support him in his labors, but he also has to hire field hands when the work requires more effort. He hopes to have more extensions to his land in the future and wants to buy heads of cattle. This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial backing. He also likes being a part of a communal group, because its members are responsible, united people. He is also grateful to the generous people who will make this loan possible. It will be very helpful to his business. He will use the money from this loan to invest in sacs of potato seed and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Potato seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann M. is from the town of Trento. She is 39 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann has been farming rice for over 10 years. She works hard to provide for her children's education.  Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: The Rebels Group

texts.es:
“Rebeldes” es el nombre de la asociación comunal que está por iniciar su noveno ciclo en el centro focal Santiago II. Integran esta asociación diez y seis personas, quince mujeres y un varón. 

La señora Yola es la presidenta. Su negocio es la venta de “palos”.
Los mismos que pueden ser utilizados de diferentes formas, ya sea en la construcción como en la elaboración de algún mueble sencillo.
Aprendió este negocio de su esposo y lo lleva adelante desde hace siete años. Ella recuerda que su primer crédito fue de Bs.500 y lo utilizó para el arreglo de una máquina.  Ahora su crédito solicitado es por Bs.3000, ella espera que con este dinero pueda comprar una motosierra.

Los negocios dentro de la asociación son variados, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, tienda,  puesto de fruta, venta de ropa interior, librería, panadería, confección de edredones, repostería, venta de comida y venta de DVD´s.
texts.en:
"The Rebels" is the name of the community bank and they are on their ninth loan cycle. They are located in the Santiago II region. There are sixteen members in this group, of whom fifteen are women and there is one man. Yola is the leader of the group and she sells wood. The type of wood that she sells can be used in a variety of ways. They can be used in construction of in the production of a simple piece of furniture. She learned this business from her husband and she has been running the same business for the past seven years. Her first loan was in the amount of Bs. 500 and she used it to repair a machine. The loan she requests now is in the amount of Bs. 3000 and with it she will purchase a chainsaw. The businesses carried out by the group are various, among them are: the sale of clothing, cosmetics, a general store, a fruit stand, undergarment sales, bookstore, bakery, apron sales, pastries, catering and DVD sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A. is from the village of Calamagui. He is 38 years old. Emmanuel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Emmanuel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Emmanuel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when he sells his raised pig.

In 2010, Emmanuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmanuel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Emmanuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Joanitah

texts.en:
Joanitah K. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children.  Two of her children are currently in school. Joanitah has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Joanitah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joanitah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Joanitah hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Santos Pablo

texts.es:
Santos tiene 34 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza, y venta de pollos, residen en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán junto a su esposa y sus siete hijos todos dependen económicamente de él. 
Este negocio consiste en la crianza de pollos, alimentándolos bien para que a las 16 semanas estén listos para su venta, la cual Santos realiza por los alrededores de la zona ofreciéndolos por libras.
La época mejor de este negocio es para las fiestas de fin de año, es por ello que quiere comprar más pollos y su alimentación también por tal motivo el solicita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar esta inversión y a su vez le ayuda a desarrollar el negocio. Él Sueña tener un mejor negocio y contar con fondos para seguir progresando y de esta manera generar los ingresos para que sus hijos estudien preparándose académicamente.
texts.en: Santos, 34, makes his living raising and selling poultry.  He lives in San Francisco Gotera, departamento Morazán, with his wife and their 7 children, all still economically dependent on him.  This business involves raising poultry, feeding them well so that they are ready for sale at 16 weeks.  Santos completes the sale in the surrounding area, selling them by the pound.  The biggest seasons for this business are the year-end fiestas. He wants to buy more poultry and feed, which is why he is requesting a loan to help him carry out this investment that will help him to build up his business.  He dreams of having a better business, and is looking to these funds to keep getting ahead, in this way generating the income enabling his children to go to school and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: Purchase poultry

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 30-year-old married, ambitious man with two children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is determined to see that his household members get the minimum socially accepted standards. He is a cyclist and operates a retail shop. He has been in this business for two years. Asked whether he enjoys the business, he proudly defends his decision although he confesses to have challenges in finances due to seasonal customers. Richard intends to use the loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil, soap, and domestic items to sell at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, soap, and domestic items for selling at a profit.

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA ELTRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Judit; ella tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio técnico para todo tipo de electrodomésticos,la socia tiene su local por el centro de la ciudad el cual  trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo,la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas repuestos para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Judit, 42, is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” (United for Success) communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a technical service business for all kinds of home appliances.  Her shop is located around downtown and she operates it with her husband.  She is a very enterprising person with a strong desire to get ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy more replacement parts for the business.

She thanks those who will be part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Rwenshama Tukore Group C

texts.en: M. James is the leader of Rwenshama Tukore Group in Rukungiri. He is 45 years old and married with five children. He has a bar in Rwenshama that has been in existence for over eight years. He sells beers, waragi (a local brew), and so on, and he needs a loan to buy more beers for resale. James is very hardworking and trustworthy and that is why his customers believe in him. He hopes to buy more land for agriculture in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beers for resale

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja y de sus dos pequeños hijos; cada día se esfuerza por continuar adelante. Desde hace 4 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida en un paradero de la zona por donde vive. Ella saca su parrilla todos los días a las 4 de la tarde y empieza con la venta de pedazos de pollo, y corazón de res que cocina a la parrilla en el momento; y el tiempo le ha permitido captar varios clientes, sobretodo trabajadores de las líneas del paradero pues le consumen porque saben de su buena sazón y precios. Lo que no le gusta del trabajo es que por la zona tiene bastante competencia de venta de comida, por lo que debe esmerarse bastante en la buena presentación y los precios de las parrillas. Como es una mujer que siempre se proyecta al futuro tiene pensado instalar un restaurante, donde ofrezca todos variedad de platillos, de esta manera espera salir adelante. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Adela tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor que le hacen falta para continuar preparando sus platillos, ya que quiere aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Adela, age 36, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two small children.  She puts forth great effort every day to continue getting ahead.  For four years this enterprising woman has been selling food at a bus stop in the zone where she lives.  At four every afternoon she takes her grill and starts selling pieces of chicken and beef heart.  She cooks them on the grill at the bus stop.  Time has allowed her to win various customers, mostly the workers of the bus lines at the stop.  They eat her food because they know it tastes good and for the prices.

What she does not like about her work is that there is plenty of competition selling food in the area.  Therefore, she needs to take great care in the good presentation and the prices of the grilled food.  As she is a woman who always plans for the future, she plans to establish a restaurant where she would offer all types of dishes.  This is the way she hopes to get ahead.

This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible.  The loan allows her to continue working as she seeks to make progress.  Adela plans to use the requested loan to buy wholesale ingredients that she needs to prepare her dishes.  She wants to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy wholesale ingredients to continue making food

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 37 años, vive al lado de sus 2 hijas en una casa arrendada. Hace más de 3 años que tiene su negocio, que es un restaurante, donde ella misma prepara los alimentos. Asimismo sus hijos la apoyan en la atención y servicio a los clientes, ofreciendo desayunos y almuerzos. Le agrada su trabajo, ya que siempre dispone de la comida de cada día además que le gusta cocinar aunque reconoce en varias oportunidades que es muy sacrificado y que requiere de mucho tiempo. Su negocio ha crecido con el tiempo y esta muy feliz por lo que desea continuar adelante en el crecimiento de su restaurante. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Marina is 37 and lives with her 2 daughters in a rented home. She has had her restaurant for over three years, where she is the chef. Her children help her to serve the customers. They offer breakfast and lunch. She enjoys her work, since she always has food for the day. Furthermore, she likes cooking even though she recognizes that at times it takes great sacrifice and requires a lot of time.

Her business has grown with time, and she is very happy because she wants to continue to succeed and expand her restaurant. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. She is also happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are people whom she knows, who are responsible and very supportive. She thanks those of you who will support this loan, as it will be very useful for her business. 

With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of non-perishable ingredients for making her food.

loans.use: to purchase non-perishable products.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela, tiene 61 años de edad, y reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.  Esta actividad la realiza en un espacio ubicado dentro de su vivienda.  Por el trato amable que da y sus diseños exclusivos, tiene clientela fidelizada, quien acude a ella para vestimentas para cualquier ocasión.  Esta actividad le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Manuela desea adquirir una máquina de coser más sofisticada, la cual le permitirá ampliar su capacidad de producción y atender a más clientes.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente  obtener un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Manuela is 61 years old and she lives together with her family in a sub-urban region of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque. 

She makes articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children. She carries out her work in a space in her home. She has earned herself a loyal clientele for her kindness and for her unique designs. She caters to her clients' needs for garments for every occasion. Her business helps her provide for her personal expenses and of her family.

Manuela wants to acquire a more sophisticated sewing machine which will help her increase production and be able to attend to more clients. IN order to achieve her objective she has requested a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda, who is married to Abdulhakim, is the mother of four daughters and five sons. Her husband is a freight car driver. He transports goods for shops, companies, factories, etc., in the city of Tulkarem.

Warda came to FATEN and took out a loan to help her husband as he needs money to cover car maintenance, insurance and annual car licensing. The car is the only source of income for this big family. One of the sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee and helps Warda and her husband when he can.

Warda's husband appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman who doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: For freight car maintenance and car insurance fees

loans.name: Diana Yadira

texts.es: La Sra. Diana Yadira    tiene  un  negocio, en esta  ocasión  necesita  comprar  mercancía  para  su  local ya  que  tiene  una  gran cantidad  de  pedidos  de  sus clientes y  siempre  se  a caracterizado  por  brindarles  un excelente  servicio, nos  comenta que  de  esta  manera  mejorara su  economía además  de  atraer  a un mayor  numero  de clientes  así  como  también  con estos  ingresos  podrá  ofrecerles una mejor  calidad  de   vida  a sus  tres   hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Diana Yadira manages a business.  On this occasion, she needs to buy merchandise for her shop since she has a large number of orders from her customers.  Diana is always known for providing excellent service.  She says that by working in this manner she is able to improve her finances.  Attracting a large number of customers also helps to generate income so that she can provide a better quality of life for her three children.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Nuestra Señora Group

texts.es:
Jessica Marilia, Ella es Viuda, 35 años D. edad, 02 niños.
La señora Jesssica es presidente del grupo comunal " Maria Nuestra Señora"; en el distrito D. Chilca en Huancayo. 
Ella es padre y madre para su sus 2 pequeños hijos: Carlos y Monica, quienes se han convertido en el impulso y fuerza para su vida.
La Señora Jessica Marilia al no contar con un trabajo estable decidiò abrir una pequeña bodeguita (tienda) en su propia casa; esto ha sido su sustento y por ello requiere el prèstamo para poder ampliar la bodeguita y poder vender otros productos. Ademàs D. este negocio la Señora Jessica Marilia ha aperturado al costado D. su bodeguita un locutorio (servicio D. telèfono pùblico), esto ha sido un buen acierto, ya que por la zona no hay telèfonos pùblicos ni tampoco otro servicio similar.
(En la fotografìa la Señora Jessica Marilia està vestida con chompa color rojo, està D. pie y es la segunda D. la derecha)
texts.en:
Jessica Marilia R. C. Vda. D. P., who is a widow, is 35 years old and has 2 children. Jessica is the president of the communal bank “Maria Nuestra Señora”, which is located in the district of Chilca, in Huancayo. 

She is a single mother for her 2 small children, Carlos and Monica, who have become the motivation and source of strength for her life. 

Since Jessica doesn’t have a stable job, she decided to open a small store in her own house. This has been her source of income. She needs the loan to expand her small store so she can sell other products. In addition to this business, Jessica has also opened a public telephone service next to her store. This has been a good decision because in her neighborhood there aren’t other public telephones or similar services. 

(In the photo, Jessica is wearing a red sweater. She is standing and is the second from the right.)

loans.use: to purchase domestic products to sell in her store

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a businesswoman who does tailoring. She has been in the business for six years and employs one person to assist her. She has an additional job besides her tailoring business. Her previous loan from Faulu Kenya enabled her to boost her business. She hopes to fully establish her business within five years. She has requested 40,000 Kes to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica es una mujer muy responsable que labora en una maquiladora como operadora para el sostén de la familia, su hijo vive con ella por lo que la apoya económicamente. Con ahorros inicio la construcción de su cocina en la parte de atrás de su casa para tener mayor comodidad ya que su casa es muy pequeña y los cuartos son muy estrechos. Para terminar su proyecto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Verónica is a very responsible woman working for a "maquiladora" (a bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the US border) to support her family; her son lives with her and helps her economically. Thanks to her savings she started building her kitchen at the back of her house, in order to live more comfortably as her house is very small and the rooms are very narrow really. In order to have her project finished she needs to buy materials and to pay for workforce wages.

loans.use: To finish building her kitchen.

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y demás familiares, el reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 6 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y pipián, aprendió de su padre los quehaceres agrícolas, hoy día es el trabajo que realiza con mucha dedicación, para llevar la alimentación a su hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la preparación del terreno comprando abono y fertilizantes, con estos materiales dará una buena preparación a la tierra para lograr una buena producción.
Su objetivo es tener una buena cosecha del cultivo, trabajar por el bienestar de su familia y por superarse.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer who lives with his wife and other family members in Jiquilisco, located in the department of Usulután. He has been growing corn and squash for 6 years, having learned farming from his father. Today, he farms with much dedication in order to nourish his household.

He is requesting a loan in order to prepare his fields by purchasing both organic and chemical fertilizers. With these materials, he will better prepare the crop fields for good production.

His goal is to have a good harvest, to work for his family's well-being, and to improve himself.

loans.use: to purchase chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her late 30s, is married and has five children who are still going to school. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years now. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwajuma's fifth motisha loan from Tujijenge. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loans to increase her business stock and has paid back all the loans successfully. 

She wishes for a loan to again increase the fruits and vegetables stock. 

Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group, "Uvumilivu," which has a total of 13 members. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mwajuma is in the middle with a light blue dress.

loans.use: To increase the stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 21 years old and he is single. He has been a tailor for four years. He works in his business from 6 am until 9 pm every day of the week. 

He would like to use this loan to buy a new machine for his tailoring. With any profit, he will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Narciso Natividad

texts.es:
Narcizo tiene 55 años de edad el cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en una zona rural en un pueblo llamado San Pedro de Lloc, en la provincia de Pacasmayo, La Libertad.

Narcizo se dedica la venta de ceviche, el tiene un puesto de ventas en una de las principales calles del mercado de San Pedro de Lloc el tiene varios años en este negocio y en este tiempo a adquirido experiencia en el rubro, además Narcizo cuenta con muy buena acogida y con clientela fidelizada a su negocio.

Narcizo está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar mobiliario para su negocio como sillas y mesas, de esta manera sus clientes contaran con mayor comodidad al momento de recurrir a su negocio.

Narcizo es una persona bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Narcizo is 55 years old and he owns his own home which is located in a rural region, in a village called San Pedro de Lloc, in the province of Pacasmayo in La Libertad.

Narcizo sells ceviche (a popular seafood dish). He has a stand on one of the main streets of the market in San Pedro de Lloc. He has had this business for many years and during that time he acquired experience in the field. Additionally, Narcizo enjoys a good reputation and he has a loyal client base for his business.

Narcizo requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase furnishings for his business, such as tables and chairs. This way his clients will enjoy greater comfort when they patronize his business. 

Narcizo is a very hardworking person and he struggles every day to move forward and to have a better quality of life. Those that know him consider him to be a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to purchase furnishings for his business, such as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Irene Mae

texts.en:
Irenne Mae is 20 years old and lives in Impasugong Bukidnon. She is single and has 1 child.  

Irenne Mae has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, soap and more. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase additional rice for wholesale .  

Irenne Mae has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.  In the future,  she hopes to have a successful business for the benefit of her entire family.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice for wholesale

loans.name: Bacilisa

texts.en:
Bacilisa, 46, is married with three children. She is the owner of a small grocery store that sells a variety of products. In her store, she also sells pizzas that she makes herself at home. In addition to her grocery store, she also has a small farm in which she produces vegetables. She sells the vegetables in the Urubamba market and also distributes them to various clients in Cusco.

Bacilisa is asking for a $500 loan in order to expand the merchandise she sells in her grocery store. She is a very hard working woman and is fully committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to add more merchandise to her grocery store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, 50, lives in the Philippines and is married with five children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. Irma has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Irma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Irma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es:
Claudia, vive con su esposo y dos hijas, es propietaria de una tienda donde ofrece diferentes artículos, surgió por iniciativa propia, atiende el negocio de tiempo completo por ello no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dulces, refrescos, boquitas, galletas y más mercadería que es demandada por los clientes, esta compra le permitirá tener más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es crecer n ventas y en ingresos para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her husband and her two daughters. She is the owner of a store which offers different products. She acted on her own initiative.  She works full time and she does not have a set schedule to tend to her customers. 
She is requesting a loan to purchase sweets, soft drinks, chips, cookies and other merchandise in demand by the customers. This will allow her to purchase more merchandise to offer to her customers. 
Her biggest dream is to increase her sales and profit in order to have a better life for her family.

loans.use: purchase sweets, soft drinks, chips, cookies for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 43 years old, married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. He has high self-esteem and a passion for success.

For the last five years Richard has been a taxi driver. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy tires and to repair and service his vehicle.

Within the next five years Richard wants to have bought another taxi. His dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy tires and to repair and service his vehicle.

loans.name: Glenda Magdalena

texts.es:
Glenda, se dedica al comercio con lácteos y trabaja como enfermera, ella vive con su familia y tiene un hijo. Inicio hace dos años con el negocio de los lácteos, ofreciéndolos en el mercado municipal, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Ella invertirá un préstamo en la compra de leche, también necesita pagar la mano de obra por unas reparaciones que está realizando a su vivienda, con este apoyo financiero tendrá la posibilidad de continuar atendiendo a los clientes y solventar la necesidad del pago de mano de obra. El sueño de ella es contribuir a la formación de su hijo y toda su familia, continuar incrementando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Glenda sells dairy products and works as a nurse. She lives with her family and has a son. She started the dairy business two years ago, selling dairy products in the local market. She works from Monday to Saturday. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of milk. She also needs to pay the labour for some repairs being done to her house. This financial support will enable to continue to serve her customers and meet her need to pay for the labour. Her dream is to contribute to her son's education and to the whole family and to continue to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy milk to make cheese and pay for labour costs of home improvements.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a mother of two, aged nine and ten, and she lives with her family in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is a farmer who produces milk and eggs for the local market. She is 34 years old and has been in farming for five years.

Violet has requested a second loan of 30,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry business by buying more birds. She wants to grow the business to expand her dairy farming to at least three cows. She adds that the previous loan helped her care more for family provisions.

Violet says the farmers' limitation is caused by scarce finances and animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase more birds for her poultry business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling tomatoes and onions in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more tomatoes and onions to sell. The extra income will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 44 years old and is married with four children.

Mary Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Mary Joy has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Mary Joy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teresa tiene ya más de diez años con su negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mas mercancía ya que le esta haciendo falta ropa de invierno, zapatos y quiere empezar a vender aparatos eléctricos. 
Con esta inversión su negocio tendrá más mercancía e ingreso a su negocio y familia.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene ya que su esposo el señor Marco Antonio se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos  que están estudiando la secundaria.
texts.en: María Teresa has been selling new and used clothes in various parts of the city for over ten years now.  She’s asking for a loan to buy more merchandise since she needs winter clothes and shoes; she also wants to start to sell electric appliances.  With this investment the business will have more merchandise and income for the business and her family.  She plans to repay the loan with profits obtained since her husband, Marco Antonio, will take care of family expenses and school costs for their two children who are going to secondary school.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Zulfizar

texts.ru: Зулфизар трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и имеет два сына и одну девочку. Её муж занимается земледелием, тракторист. Его заработанные деньги не хватает на содержании семьи и чтобы помогать мужу Зулфизар начала заниматься скотоводством и более 4 года она продолжает свое дело. У нее большой опыт в по данному виду бизнеса. Она стремится улучшить условия домохозяйства и хочет устроить мероприятие по обрезанию. Зулфизар хочет получить займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Zulfizar is hardworking and conscientious woman.  She is married and has two sons and one daughter.  Her husband is involved in farming as a tractor operator.  His earnings are not enough to support the family, and, in order to help her husband, Zulfizar started to get involved in animal husbandry and has been running her business for over four years.  She has an extensive experience in this business.  Zulfizar tries to improve conditions of her household and wants to hold a circumcision ceremony.  She wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Evangeline has a shop that sells canned goods, shampoo, soaps, and detergents. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, shampoo, soaps, and beverages to sell. Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, soaps, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Nos

texts.en:
Mrs. Nos is a garment factory worker from Km 6, Reussey Keo commune, a suburb of Phnom Penh City. She works eight to ten hours per day from Monday through Saturday. She gets her salary monthly, approximately $70 per month. Sometimes she has to work overtime in order to gain more money to cover her daily expenses. Presently she has a child who is under her care and who is attending a local school. 

In the past few months, Mrs. Nos bought a plot of land, an open space area, in Kampong Chhnang province. She wants to build a fence to protect this land, yet she has inadequate funds to start doing it. Now she would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy the necessary building materials and to pay for construction labors to build the fence. 

In the future, she hopes to provide her only child great opportunities for education.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials and to pay for construction labors to build a fence.

loans.name: Carmen Marcelina

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en la  provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene  50 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija.  Estudió educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles dinero que incremento al capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,200.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de arroz, carne, verduras y pollos, para su respectiva venta, en el negocio le ayuda su hija.

Su sueño de la señora es tener una tienda grande de mercadería variada.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo  y los plazos de pago.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Ahorro es Progreso” (Saving is Progress) Communal Bank, located in the province and department of Puno. She is 50 years old and a single mother with 1 daughter, who studied higher education.

Carmen has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last 3 years. Her initial loan was for 200 new sols, which she invested in her business, a grocery store.

Now she is requesting a new loan for the sum of 1,200 new sols, to purchase rice, meat, vegetables, and chicken to sell. Her daughter helps her in the business.

Carmen's dream is to have a large store with varied merchandise. What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease of obtaining loans and the convenient repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, vegetables, and chicken to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 31 years old and married.  She lives in Buchanan with four children between 1 to 15 years old. Three of the children are currently in school.

For the past six  years, she has been selling fried chicken and fish in her community.  She established this business through her mother; she enjoys the independence her income gives her.

Currently, Comfort is selling used clothes. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business.  Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo (La ciudad es un sitio arqueológico incaico, capital del Distrito de Ollantaytambo (Provincia de Urubamba), situado al sur del Perú, a unos 90 km al noroeste de la ciudad del Cuzco.). 

Apolinar tiene 53 años edad y es casado, él se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía y tiene un pequeño taller en la ciudad de Machupicchu,  él elaborar diferentes tipos de artesanía pero en especial mochilas, chompas, mantones, maletines y otras cosas más. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Apolinar requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina remalladora. Su sueño de Apolinar es abrir una empresa formal con su propia marca y poder distribuir en el extranjero.  

Apolinar es integrante del grupo “Siempre Adelante” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Apolinar was born in the city of Ollantaytambo, an Incan achaeological site and the capital of the district of Ollantaytambo in Urubamba Province in southestern Peru, around 90km northeast of the city of Cusco.

He is fifty-three and married. He earns his living making handicrafts and has a small workshop in the city of Machupicchu. He makes a variety of handicrafts, including shoulder bags, sweaters, shawls, handbags, etc. He's been in business for fifteen years and it's going very well thanks to the effort he puts into it. Apolinar currently needs a loan to buy a sewing machine. His dream is to open an official company, with his own brand, so he can distribute internationally.

Apolinar belongs to the "Siempre Adelante" [Always Forward] group, which has twelve members that live and run their businesses in the city of Ollantaytambo.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 35-year old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcycle rider and has been in this business for ten years. He started transporting for another person and, after saving enough, he bought his own motorcycle. However, his challenge has been high fuel costs and the seasonal weather. His desire is to educate his children and to build a permanent home. He also longs to diversify and deal in other income generating activities. Julius needs the loan to buy a grass cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy a grass cutting machine.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
