Eunice is a hardworking mother who lives Nyamasaria in Kisumu. She is married to Barnabas, who is a businessman, and has four children who are 25, 21, 18 and 15 years old.

Eunice sells cereals, a business she has been doing for last three years, and comfortably makes a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings. She has applied for her fourth loan to buy more cereals like maize, beans and groundnuts for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business, hence, more income. She has a dream of making her business more stable to help her purchase a piece of land and support her family.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Yazgul

texts.en: Yazgul is a widow and lives with the children in the Fuzuli region. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. She cooks national Azerbaijan dishes and  national sweets sells their to customers. Yazgul has been in this business for many years. Today she needs her third loan in the amount of 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).She wants to buy a new fridge and to improve her business. In the future, she wants to have a baker store for her business and she wants engaged her daughter. She is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge and to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tomato farming business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Sala is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She schooled up to the junior level. Having sold around for some time, she decided to settle in the family house and ply her trade by selling general provisions. She took advantage of a store room in the family house to display her wares.

Sala is seeking the KIVA loan to stock up on goods that are in demand in her community. It is her firm hope that this will go a long way toward improving the well-being of her family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nikola

texts.en:
Nikolay Y. is a 30-year-old Roma man from eastern Bulgaria. He has three small children with his wife and lives in a small village outside Sliven. Niki is a landscaper and contractor.

Niki has several regular corporate clients, for whom he provides ongoing lawn and garden care, as well as the occasional larger landscaping project. When not working, Niki actively searches for new projects, directly approaching the owners of plots of land that are untended.

This loan will enable Niki to purchase several pieces of new equipment and provide him with a working capital cushion. First and foremost, he’ll be purchasing a gas-powered trimmer and will also pick up a hoe, spade shovel, manual bush trimmer, and new overalls.

loans.use: New equipment

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en:
Born in 1971, N. Marceline is married and a mother of four children. Having had no opportunity for secondary education, she was unemployed, and her business of selling cooked food was not moving because of little capital. As a result, she could not pay school fees for her children nor provide them with basic needs. She has also suffered a lot as a result of the loss of her 3 day old baby, the loss of her unborn baby, and a surgical operation. Motivated by these hardships, she joined GHAPE and after being trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. She is requesting a first loan of $100.

Given a loan of $100, she plans to invest in the business of selling cooked food. Her business is promising as she sells to early eaters like school children and those in a hurry to get to their job sites. With the profit, she plans to increase her business and pay school fees for her children. She plans to pay off the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase ground nuts, corn, big pot, grinding machine, and other foodstuff

loans.name: Mudafig

texts.en: Mr. Mudafig is a low income person which makes him vulnerable. He is 37, married with two children, and lives in Saatli city in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Mudafig is a taxi driver and has been driving a taxi for ten years now. This will be Mudafig’s first loan with Normicro. He has been approved for a loan of $500.00 with which he plans to purchase new tires for this taxi as well as do some minor repairs to his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and do minor repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Raising pigs is something that Faaiuga’s family has been doing for some years now. This is her first loan, and the purpose is to help support this family's development. Her family very much depends on this as a source of income, and she wants to ensure that it is sustained. She will utilise her loan to buy some of the materials that they now need for the plantation, and she is really happy for the assistance that SPBD is able to provide to help her and her family.

loans.use: Buying equipment and supplies for her pig farm

loans.name: Suparni

texts.en: Suparni is 25 years old, married with one child aged 1. She has a small shop which sells snacks, rice, cooking oil, gasoline and a few household items. She usually earns US$10 per day with a small profit. Suparni needs a loan to buy more goods and fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Asiyah

texts.en: Asiyah is 45 years old. Her husband Y. sells waste materials and earns $10 a week. To help her husband earn extra income, she raises ducks and earns $40 a month. Asiyah requests a loan of $125 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sitsofe

texts.fr:
Sitsofe A. is 33 years old, married, and the mother of five. She has been a retailer of grains at the big market in Adeta for over six years. Since her husband is a polygamist, she is responsible for covering the cost of schooling her children. She would like to use this loan to buy 10 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of peanuts, and 5 sacks of millet and to lease a store for stocking her goods. This will meet the ever-growing demands of her customers and will provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Sitsofe A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de ADETA depuis plus de 06 ans. Son mari étant polygame les frais scolaires de ses enfants sont à sa propre charge. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 05 sacs d’arachides, 05 sacs de mils et louer un magasin pour le stockage de ses marchandises pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of peanuts, 5 sacks of millet, and to lease a store for her inventory of goods.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov H., 43, is the mother of three children and works with her husband growing rice on a plot of farmland. On average, they earn around $2 a day.

Two of their children are married and live away from home. Their other daughter is a garment worker earning a salary of $80 a month.

This loan will be used to purchase a grinding mill.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
C. Hannah sells clothing. She is married and has no children. Her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the needs of the family. Hannah is working very hard to help support the family’s finances. At the moment she wants to increase her sales to meet increasing demand of her goods but she lacks adequate capital.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua H. prepares a local soup popularly known in Ghana as ‘Don’t touch me’. She is a widow with two children and her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Business is doing well but she would like a loan to increase sales by producing more soup for her market. The additional money will allow her to purchase more ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for soup production

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị Yên, 40 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2007. Her husband is a carpenter. Though having high skill, he did not have his own shop therefore his income alone was barely enough to cover the family’s expense. The funds from her first loan was partly used to invest in breeding pigs and a larger sum was to build his woodshop. Since the new shop, the income gets better and they can provide more for their two children’s education. They also buy prefabricated furniture to resell. The current monthly income is about 2,000,000 VND. She is applying for a loan of 9,000,000 VND to invest more into their businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Dương Thị Yên năm nay 40 tuổi, chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2007. Chồng chị làm nghề thợ mộc, tuy anh có tay nghề cao nhưng do anh chỉ đi làm thuê nên thu nhập cũng không được nhiều. Vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị trước đây chỉ đủ chi tiêu trong gia đình. Năm 2007 chị bàn bạc với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn, một phần nhỏ chị dùng để mua con giống về chăn nuôi, phần còn lại gia đình chị đầu tư mua sắm các dụng cụ, máy móc mở xưởng mộc tại gia đình. Từ việc đầu tư mở xưởng mộc riêng, gia đình chị đã có thêm thu nhập, anh chị lại đầu tư thêm để mua đồ dùng bằng gỗ bán cho nhân dân trong vùng. Thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện nay khoảng 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Với thu nhập ngày càng tăng lên anh chị cũng có điều kiện để đầu tư hơn cho 2 con đang tuổi ăn học Vòng vốn này chị muốn vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua thêm máy cưa phục vụ cho xưởng mộc của chồng chị và mua thêm con giống để nuôi.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Kunti

texts.en:
Kunti A., 40 years old, is a tailor in the town of Koteshwor in the Kathmandu district.  She opened her tailoring shop 6 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses. 
Before starting her own business, Kunti took a 6 month training course in tailoring near her town. Six year ago, her husband, Puspa Raj A., died and now she is the sole responsible for her 3 children.She has two daughters and one son.  Her older daughter is studying for her BBS level and her younger daughter passed 12 level this year. Her son is in grade 8.
She plans to use the $300 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She is having difficulty fulfilling  the basic needs of her family. So she needs the loan to expand her business to earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Duyen

texts.vi:
Ms. H. Thi Duyen is 54 years old, retired military personnel with a stable monthly income. However, she is a hardworking woman and likes to stay active. In 2006 she joined TYM fund to borrow money for a breeding farm, and she chose to raise pigs. Because she is retired, she has a lot of time to invest in the family's pig breeding farm. Her first year in the fund already brought good results right from the first loan. She decided to borrow a higher amount for her second loan,and also invested it in her pig farm. The income she made from her pig farm was used to purchase things for their daily lives, and to educate her children. She currently has 2 children in trade school. For this loan, she would like to borrow 550.00 USD to invest in her pig farm. Her average monthly income is 305.00 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Duyên 54 tuổi là cán bộ về hưu có lương tháng ổn định, nhưng bản thân chị là người phự nữ chịu khó lại luôn thích vân động. Năm 2006 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, chị đã chon mô hình chăn nuôi lợn. Bản thân chị là cán bộ về hưu nên chị có rất nhiều thời gian để đầu tư vào việc chăn nuôi của gia đình. Kết quả cho thấy trong năm đầu tiên chị tham gia vay vốn đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao ngay từ vòng vốn ban đầu. Sang vòng vốn thứ hai chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn cao cũng đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, thu nhập từ việc chăn nuôi được chị mua sắm các tiện nghi trong sinh hoạt và đầu tư cho con đi học. Hiện nay chị đang nuôi 2 con học chuyên nghiệp. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs breeding

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 34 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 14, 12 and 7 years old. She has been a used clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

Pili now requests a loan to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 50 años es madre de 3 hijos que están estudiando carreras profesionales, vive con su esposo Landis, quien es mecánico y la apoya en todo lo posible.   Ella se dedica a al arte textil, aprendió empíricamente de su mamá, Lina es muy solicitada por muchas instituciones, por su buena labor, lleva en esta actividad mas de 10 años, confecciona ropa para niños y adultos en los distintos géneros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que intercambia ideas y se socializa, pero lo mas importante es que mediante ese negocio está sacando adelante a sus hijos, quienes muy pronto serán ¿profesionales. Lo más difícil para ella es no contar con un taller adecuado.  Invertirá el dinero del préstamo en mandar a construir un local para su taller textil y así brindar mejor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lina is 50 years old and she is the mother of 3 children, they are all attending professional training classes. She lives with her husband Landis, he is a mechanic and he supports with all that he can. She works with textiles, a trade that she learned from her mother. Lina's talents is highly sought after by institutions for her excellent work. She has been carrying out her business for the past 10 years. She produces clothing for children and adults of both genders. She loves that she can exchange ideas with her customers and she can socialize with them. But the most important thing is that her business is providing for her children. They soon will graduate and start their professional life. The most difficult part about their job is that her shop is not adequate to function. She will invest the funds of the loan to have a space built for her where she can set up her textiles shop and provide her customers with better care.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a space where she can set up her textiles shop.

loans.name: Nasreen M. Nazir Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the widow of M. N. and lives in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine of great Punjabi Sufi poet, Baba Fareed Ganj Shakkar. She has been living in this city for the past 10 years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has a juice stand. Her second son has a salon, and her youngest son is not currently employed. Both of her daughters are in school, in the 5th standard. Nasreen baji sells clothing, and she has been in this business for the past two years. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy more clothing to expand her business.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by three other members. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothing to sell. Razia baji also wants a loan to buy more clothing to sell, and Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy spare motorbike parts to sell. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Adetoun

texts.en: Adetoun is happily married with four children. She is 42 years old and lives in Afro-media, Lagos state, Nigeria. Adetoun makes a living selling drinks, pepper soup and fried meat in her shop. She has been in this business for a long time, and works hard to meet the demands of her customers. Adetoun has applied for a loan to buy more drinks to sell in her shop. She says thank you to everyone who helps make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Dar es salaam, Tanzania!  This is 43 year old Matilda A. N.. She is a married mother of three children who are between the ages of 6 and 18. She also supports two dependents who attend school near her house. Matilda is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who has been running a poultry business since 2007. In Tanzania it is called a “Kuku” business, as kuku means chicken in Swahili. Kuku is a favorite among Tanzanians and they make finger-licking good fried chicken here!

Her business is simple, however tedious. She buys chicks, tends to them for five weeks, and then sells them in the market. But as you can see from her photo, tending to chickens is back breaking work!

Her business is doing well and she is able to make an average monthly profit of about US$100. Matilda is requesting a loan in order to buy additional chicks and feed. She thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional chicks and feed

loans.name: Tit

texts.en: Tit K., 54, is widowed, has two children, and lives in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells a variety of wines, beers and meat. From this activity, she is able to make US$5 per day. Tit K. would now like to take out a loan of US$500 to re-invest in her business and to purchase a sugar cane cart for producing sugar cane juice.

loans.use: Investment in a restaurant business and purchase of a sugar cane cart

loans.name: Juan Sergio

texts.es:
Juan inició el negocio por superación económica y personal, para tener un negocio propio y  también tener mayor ingreso para la manutención de su familia. 
comenzó el negocio? (Fechas) En Marzo de 1998

Un amigo lo invitó a iniciar el negocio de venta de material para soldadura, luego el se independizó cuando tenía suficientes conocimientos del mismo.
Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1998, debido a su esfuerzo ha ido progresando  gradualmente conforme a la situación económica y a la afluencia de la clientela, pero el crecimiento se ha debido más al cumplimiento de los trabajos encomendados, ya que se hacen en el tiempo en el que se lo solicitan.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por MXN $6,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más material para que el negocio sea mucho más productivo, y tener con que financiar sus compromisos en lo que le hacen los pagos.
texts.en:
Juan started the business to improve his personal and financial situations, as well as to generate more income to support his family. It began in March of 1998, when a friend invited him to start an enterprise selling soldering materials. Later, after learning enough about the business, he set off on his own. Thanks to his hard work and efforts, he has grown gradually, along with his economic situation and flow of customers. The growth has occurred, in large part, because of the completion of work orders, which he makes sure are delivered on time. He currently needs a loan of 6,000 MXN, to be repaid in six months, to buy more materials so the business will be more productive. Also, it will help him finance his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for his work.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena M. se ha dedicado a su negocio de pulpería siendo ella la propietaria el cual ha logrado surtir su pulpería con el propósito de mejorarla y llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. 

Ella ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones y para ello se ha apoyado en Ceprodel. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su inversión.
.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Magdalena M. makes her living running a local grocery store. As the owner, she has managed to stock her store, with the intention of improving it and of supporting her home. She has managed to improve her conditions and for this reason she has pursued Ceprodel's help. The reason that she puts her hope in Ceprodel is to receive a loan to purchase merchandise and in this way to get ahead in her business, which greatly needs your investment.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Products

loans.name: Ndoumbé

texts.fr: Ndoumbé S. est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thairé Dendel. Son activité est l’embouche. Elle veut  acheter des bœufs pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndoumbé S. is married and has six children to support. She is a member of the village lending group Thairé Dendel. Her work involves fattening livestock. She wants to buy cattle to bolster her business and to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock for resale

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Née le 04/02/1957 à Attitogon, Mme A. Améyo est mariée et mère de deux (05) enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit pour étendre son étalage de vente de chaussures et sandalettes pour augmenter son rendement. Le bénéfice servira à améliorer les conditions d’existence de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Born on February 4, 1957 in Attitogon, Ms. A. Améyo is a married mother of five children. She's requesting a loan to extend her display of shoes and sandalettes (flip-flop sandals) for sale, so as to increase her returns. The profits will serve to improve the living conditions for her entire family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell shoes and sandalettes

loans.name: Koun

texts.en:
Mr. Koun K., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Channa Touk, 28, who live in a small village in the suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 1999 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and another one is still young. 

Koun has been a fisherman for fifteen years and his wife has been growing vegetables for fifteen years. Besides fishing, Koun wants to run a new business raising ducks, which could allow him to earn more income to support his family. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise.

loans.name: Ana Mabel

texts.es: Ana Mabel P. V. de 52 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una venta de jugos y licuados de frutas naturales, los cuales los vende de manera ambulante en Cojutepeque. Ella se esfuerza día con día para brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual tenga la capacidad de comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de los jugos y licuados, los cuales ya tiene ocho años de comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Ana Mabel P. V. is 52 years old and lives in Cojutepeque with her two children, who are still minors and are currently in school. Ana sells natural fruit juices and smoothies from a mobile cart in Cojutepata. She works hard each day to provide her children with everything they need, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to make juice and smoothies. She has had this business for the past eight years.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make juices and smoothies

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Aterei B Atim Grace Group

texts.en: Grace A., 26 and married with two children, one of whom is attending school, has owned a retail shop selling basics such as soap, sugar, beans, maize flour, etc. for over three years. She is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, soap, beans, maize flour, salt, millet flour, rice, etc. to meet customer demand. Active and hardworking, Grace believes the loan will increase her stock; her future plan is to open a big shop in town.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, beans, maize flour, salt, millet flour, rice, etc. to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Thuli

texts.en:
Thuli M. and her husband own a plot of land in their village of Dulchoky, Nepal. They use the land to grow vegetables, which they sell at the local market or in the city of Patan.

Thuli is applying for a loan of Rs. 10, 000 to purchase new seedlings for her vegetable farm.

Thuli has three sons and one daughter and is happy that she can make an equal contribution to her family’s living expenses.

Some of Thuli’s produce is sold in Patan, a city that takes two hours to reach by car from Thuli’s farm. A vegetable seller comes every few days to Thuli’s town and purchases vegetables from her and her neighbors to sell in Patan. In the future Thuli would like to sell the vegetables herself in Patan, because then she could make a bigger profit.

Thuli hopes that her Kiva loan will help her to expand her farming business and create more opportunities for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
N. Vũ Thị (1805070721) is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. N. is now requesting a new loan of 11,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a husband and father of five children who are currently in school. He is 45 years old and trades in charcoal. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. James obtains his supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Techiman and sells it to his customers. 

He wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal to increase his stock. He believes the loan will enable him to increase his savings and provide for the educational needs of his children. He dreams to make enough to complete his building project and would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah M. is married and has three children. She has primary school level background. Hannah sells groceries like milk sugar, Milo and also food stuffs such as plantain, tomatoes and pepper at Bronyinima near Elmina, which been doing since 2002. Her husband is a fisherman. Hannah uses part of her income in running of the home. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more of the groceries and food stuffs for sale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to start a business for her child by buying a commercial car for him to drive.

loans.use: Hannah will use the loan to purchase more of the groceries and food stuffs for sale at the market.

loans.name: Ogesoo

texts.en:
Ogesoo T. is a 61-year-old woman living in the town of Faga.  She is married and has eight grown children.  To make a living, Ogesoo owns and operates a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro to sell.  Ogesoo has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately $160 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ogesoo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Ogesoo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  That loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Ogesoo is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  This will be her second loan from SPBD.  Ogesoo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: United Traders Group

texts.en:
This is Marie B., Yeabu K. and Marie S.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town. They called their group United Traders. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. This is the first loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses by adding more goods into their stalls. This will attract many customers into their businesses; sales and profit will improve for these entrepreneurs. Consequently, the living standard of these entrepreneurs will also improve. 

Marie B. (left) is the leader of this group. She was born in a small town call Mile Ninety-One, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age twenty-nine, married to a teacher and the two of them have four children. Two of her children are in class four, one in class three and the other is in nursery school. Marie sells ground-nuts/peanuts; rice and other locally produce goods. Marie also sells shoes. She has been a businesswoman for five years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Perseverance and humility are the guiding principles of Luz O.. She manages a store within the village of San Fabian Echague. According to her, expanding her store is what she wants to happen to be able to achieve success in life and business.

Luz is married to Noel who is the driver of a passenger van. They are thankful because they have two children who are their helpers in managing their store.

Luz would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000 to further improve her sari-sari store. She hopes that she will be able to budget the loan amount she is requesting so that she can purchase additional groceries for her store. She hopes that she and her husband will be able to sustain their children’s needs.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina S. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 43 years old. Edwina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Edwina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a junk shop in the local community. Edwina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edwina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Edwina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Blanca Justina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Damas responsables está conformado por un grupo de mujeres  capaces y luchadoras que tienen como prioridad sacar adelante a su familia a  pesar de los obstáculos que día a día deben surfear, además han formado un excelente ambiente y equipo de trabajo velando siempre el bienestar de todas sus integrantes, este banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del país en la región sierra centro.

La señora Blanca I. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en la comunidad de Visorey  en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 63 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de seis hijos de 44, 42, 40, 38, 36, 28 años, todos sus hijos son casados y viven independientemente,  solo vive con su esposo y un  nieto que  quedó huérfano al nacer, su esposo tiene 67 y  trabaja en su carpintería  desde hace veinte años que es el sustento diario,  fruto de su  trabajo conyugal lograron construir su  casa propia que aun les falta por terminar.

Blanca  trabaja en la carpintería con su esposo  y también realiza las actividades del hogar, debido a sus enfermedades de presión alta e infección renal no puede hacer mucho esfuerzo por lo que no puede llevar una vida normal y solo pasa ratos en su negocio nos manifiesta que se encuentra preocupada porque el trabajo ha decaído mucho porque existen otras alternativas de la madera y más barato.
 
Lleva seis  años trabajando en su bankito y los créditos obtenidos ha invertido en  su negocio y en su hogar, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a  comprar  madera para elaborar camas, armarios, etc. para tener abastecido su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es continuar con su negocio, ir incrementándolo ya que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The Responsible Ladies Communal Bank is comprised of a group of capable and strong-willed women who make supporting their families a high priority. Despite the obstacles that surface on a daily basis, they have been able to form an excellent working team that looks out for the welfare of its members. The Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca, which lies in a mountainous region of southern Ecuador.

Sra. Blanca I. is a member of the Responsible Ladies Communal Bank. She lives in the neighborhood of Visorey in central Cuenca. She is 63 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children ranging in age from 28 to 44. All of her children are grown and live independently. Blanca and her husband are raising a grandson who was abandoned at birth. Her husband is 67 years old and has been working at his carpentry workshop for 20 years. This business has provided for their daily needs and enabled them to build a house, although it is still unfinished.

Blanca assists her husband in his workshop and also performs the household chores. Since she suffers from high blood pressure and kidney disease, she is not able to overextend herself and lead a normal life. She is also concerned about her business because orders have declined significantly because customers are finding alternatives to wood that are less expensive.

For six years, Blanca has been working with her Communal Bank. She invested her loans into her business and her home. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy wood for making beds, cupboards, and other pieces so that she will have inventory for her business.

Blanca’s biggest dream is to continue and grow her business since this is her family’s livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for making furniture pieces

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda B. is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Daylinda is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Daylinda sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Daylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Daylinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely M. is from the town of Rizaluna Cordon. She is 39 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Emely owns and operates a business providing recycling services and managing a fish pond. Her main source of income comes primarily from hauling plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. In 2009, Emely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Doung

texts.en: Doung S., 36, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries. She has operated this business since 2004 and is able to earn a gross income of US $15 per day. Her husband sells coffee and sells or rents CDs and VCDs in his village, earning a gross income of US $10 per day. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. She said that this month is a peak season for selling because people have just finished harvesting their rice fields. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to run a big store for selling groceries in the province. She also wants build a new nice house for her family.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-nine years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to seven children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Janet is a trader, trading in cereals: maize. She procures bags of maize from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to supply.

Janet has been in business for six years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Simeon

texts.es:
El Sr. Simeon vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico, comunidad de El Torno; es casado tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su actividad principal es el transporte de persona, en motocicleta, cuenta con su propia unidad de trabajo, su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica, con esta actividad ella ayuda en la economía de la familia. Ambos trabajan mucho para cumplir uno de sus sueños que es tener su casita propia y poder ver a sus hijos profesionales.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de una motocicleta, para poder incrementar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.

El Sr. Simeon es un persona responsable dinamica y trabajadora.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Simeon lives in the Puerto Rico area, in El Tomo community. He is married with 4 school-aged children. His main job is transporting people on his motorcycle. He has one that he uses in the business. His wife works as a domestic servant and with this job she is able to help with the family expenses. They both work hard to be able to fulfill one of their dreams: to have their own little house, and to see their children become professionals. The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to increase their income and to help the family get ahead. Mr. Simeon is dynamic, responsible and hard-working. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust offered him in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the city of Tagoloan in Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jocelyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles D. is from the village of Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 66 years old, married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Angeles operates a business selling clothes in the local community. Angeles has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Angeles joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeles has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angeles is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Angeles from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Martha Jacoba

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Jacoba E. Martínez  vende piñatas por encargo y en su casa y vende repostería y bisutería ambulante y en las escuelas.

Ella Va a utilizar el crédito para comprar papel para hacer  piñatas, productos de repostería y comprar productos de bisutería.
Ella vive sola con su marido y el le ayuda a movilizarse en un triciclo que es donde caminan vendiendo para llevar el pan diario de la comida.

La Sra. Martha ha tenido 15 créditos con la Institución y todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma y dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, por la confianza que le han otorgado y la ayuda que siempre ha tenido por parte de nosotros para seguir trabajando
texts.en:
Martha Jacoba E. Martínez sells piñatas by special order from her house. She also sells pastries and costume jewelry on a traveling basis and in schools. She will use the loan to buy paper to make piñatas, as well as pastries and costume jewelry products. She lives with her husband, and he helps her get around on a three-wheeled vehicle, so that she can sell her products and provide for their daily sustenance. Martha has had 15 loans with the institution, and she has paid all of them very punctually and correctly. She reports that she is very grateful to CEPRODEL for the confidence it has placed in her and the help she has always received from us to continue with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business by purchasing paper for piñatas and costume jewelry products

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique B. G., tiene 56 años y es un ferviente juniorista, (seguidor del equipo de futbol de Barranquilla), este fue su principal inspiración cuando pasó de vender frutas,  al negocio que tiene actualmente  en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde comercializa artículos deportivos, como camisetas pantalonetas, medias, afiches, llaveros  y banderas, que inició en el año 2000 y que para él, ha sido mas rentable que el anterior en la plaza del mercado.  Luis está justamente ubicado  en las afueras de uno de los escenarios de futbol mas importante de Colombia: el estadio Metropolitano; él es pionero en su actividad y trabaja junto a su esposa (a su lado en la fotografía) durante mas de 12 horas diarias de lunes a domingo; sus clientes son los peatones, recomendados y los seguidores del  Futbol, inclusive provenientes de otros estadios del país; tiene una gran competencia pero se sostiene porque es innovador, consigue precios buenos para sus clientes  y diversifica constantemente el surtido que ofrece. En la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor de $1.300.000 para comprar artículos deportivos al pormayor  y de contado, especialmente de cada uno de los que exhibe como souvenirs, camisetas de diferentes equipos, banderas y afiches.
Sus créditos con la Fundación siempre han sido para incrementar el surtido y en alguna oportunidad con ellos pudo  salir de deudas onerosas con los paga diario. Su meta principal es pasar de la informalidad a la formalidad y convertirse en mayorista  y es que estos son precisamente sus desafíos.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is 56 years old and a die-hard Barranquila soccer fan. This was his main inspiration when stopped selling fruit and started his current business in the 20 de Julio square, in Barranquilla. He has been selling sportswear such as jerseys, pants, socks, accessories, key chains and flags since 2000 and, for him, this has been more profitable than his previous business in that market. Luis's business is located just outside one of Colombia's most important sports arena, the Metropolitano Stadium. He is the pioneer in his activity and works along with his wife (pictured by his side) for more than 12 hours a day, from Monday to Sunday. His clients are pedestrians, people referred to him and soccer fans, including from other stadiums in the country. He has a strong competition but he is able to stand out for being innovative, having good prices and diversifying the inventory he offers. He is currently asking for a loan in the amount of $1.300.000 to buy sports articles wholesale and in cash, especially the ones he offers such as souvenirs, jerseys of different teams, flags and accessories. His loans with the bank have always been aimed to increase the variety of his inventory. He has also at times used them to eliminate expensive debt with loan sharks. His main goal is to transition from being a street vendor to being a registered business owner and convert his business into wholesale. These are precisely his challenges.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sports articles wholesale and in cash, especially souvenirs, jerseys of different teams, flags and accessories

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel De Jesús tiene la actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio inicia por que anteriormente su esposa era quien se hacía cargo del negocio, pero desafortunadamente su esposa fallece y Manuel se encarga de que este negocio no desaparezca, por lo que ambos han luchado fuertemente para mantener este negocio. El está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de gaseosas, detergentes, golosinas y granos básicos. El desea proporcionarle ciertas mejoras a su vivienda para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús operates a general store. For the last 10 years he has dedicated himself to this activity. Originally, his wife was in charge of the business but, unfortunately, she died and Manuel took charge of the store. The business which both of them had worked so hard to preserve, did not disappear. He is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, detergents, treats, and basic grains, and he wants to carry out some improvements to the house (that hosts the store) in order to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SOFT DRINKS, DETERGENTS, TREATS, AND BASIC GRAINS FOR HIS STORE

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto P., 55 years old, is a rice farmer who tills a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. He has nine children and his eldest child is 33 and already married. When he has a good harvest, he shares some of it with his children.

Roberto hopes that he will have an abundant harvest so that he will be able to provide his family with their needs. He would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go far in buying farm supplies to increase his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Chepén,  perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de toda clase de productos, comida y jugos en un kiosko instalado en la salida de la ciudad de Chepén, frente al paradero de los vehículos que van a la ciudad de Chiclayo, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida y lo que principalmente ofrece son productos comerstibles a los pasajeros que frecuentan el lugar. Debido al buen trato con el que atiende a sus clientes y a la buena sazón con la que prepara los alimentos su negocio ha ido creciendo y ya cuenta con una clientela fiel.

Clara desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos comestibles envasados, así como también en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de platos de comida, para llegar a su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Clara es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, sus clientes y conocidos le consideran una persona honrada y que siempre ayuda a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Clara is a 46 year old woman who lives with her two children in the Chepen district within the province of Chepen in the Libertad region, about an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For the past five years she has been selling all types of food products as well as juices in the city of Chepen, out of a kiosk located in front of a rest area for cars on their way to Chiclayo. Her business does quite well as she mainly offers food products to the passengers who frequent the stop. Since she treats her clients well and prepares excellent dishes, her business has grown steadily and she now has a faithful group of clients.

Clara wishes to expand her business through the purchase of more prepared foods as well as staple ingredients to prepare dishes from scratch. In order to achieve her goal she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles (PEN). This is her first request for a loan.

Clara is a happy and hard-working woman. Her clients and acquaintances consider her an honest person and say she always helps those who need her.


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prepared food products and basic ingredents to expand her business.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es: Marisa tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la comunidad de sirenachayocc, localizada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Marisa es una persona calculadora y estratégica, su primer objetivo era producir un producto de buena calidad, ya que los compradores potenciales pagaban según a la calidad del producto y desde luego que consiguió vender sus productos rápidamente. Como segundo paso fue  posicionarse en un mercado competitivo y así lo consiguió, que ahora se encuentra con otros vendedores potenciales. No obstante en el futuro quiere ampliar su terreno en grandes extensiones para que así produzca a gran escala, sin embargo reconoce que debe trabajar duro en sus plantaciones de cacao, solo que en tiempo de cosecha necesitará de operarios para que trasladen su producto a los centros de acopio de su comunidad y realice su respectiva venta. Por el momento no tiene complicaciones en su rubro agrícola debido a que le está  yendo de la mejor manera y ya tiene 12 años trabajando de forma independiente y segura. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y  por tal se compromete a pagar de manera puntual y oportuna, además asegura estar cómodo con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cacao, además comprará abono para asegurar la producción de este producto.
texts.en:
Marisa is 39 years old. She is married and has 3 school-age children. They live together in the Sirenachayocc community, in the beautiful Cuzqueña jungle. They own their own home, which is made of wood. Marisa thinks strategically: her primary goal was to produce a high-quality product because potential buyers would pay more for high-quality and of course she would be able to sell her products quickly. Secondly, she wanted to be in a competitive market, and, achieving this, she is now with other potential sellers. In the future, she wishes to greatly expand her cultivated land in order to produce on a large scale. She recognizes that she must work hard in her cocoa plantation. Only at harvest will she need workers to transfer her product to markets in the community in order to sell it. She currently has no difficulties in her business because everything is progressing smoothly and she already has 12 years experience working independently and successfully. This is her second loan from MFP, and she is committed to making timely payments. In addition, she assures us that she is comfortable with her communal bank. This loan will be invested in cocoa and in fertilizer, and the latter will ensure production of this product.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cocoa trees and fertilizer

loans.name: Nhoeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhoeng L. (in the photo), age 51 years old, is an old maid. She lives with her sister and adopted daughter in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Nhoeng has been selling porridge and Cambodian cake in her village for over 25 years. She wants to raise pigs in her free time, but she lacks money to purchase piglets and build a pigpen. Therefore, Nhoeng is requesting her first loan of US$ 1,000 in order to help fund her initiative.

loans.use: To build a pigpen and buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en: Macrina R. is from the village of Villaramos, Manukan. She is 35 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Macrina owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Macrina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Macrina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her rice production. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice production

loans.name: Enmanuel 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Emmanuel 2 & 3 (Emmanuel). She began with Kiva partner, Esperanza, because she wanted to start a business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Maria makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children.
Maria has run her business for over six years, starting with her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying fruits and vegetables such as avocados, bananas, oranges, mangoes, etc. She is excited to be taking her 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She will use her profits to buy school supplies and uniform for her children, improve her business and progress. She says that her most difficult challenge is to progress in her business. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to cook.

loans.use: To buy all kind of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sophia  Achando

texts.en:
Sophia Achando is a small-scale businesswoman who sells secondhand clothes in an open air market. She has been in this business for four years, and is able to make a profit of $55 a month.The business is located in a strategic place where her customers can access the items easily.

Sophia is 36 years old, married, and blessed with four children. The first born is 14 years old, the second is 10, and the third and fourth are 5 and 3, respectively. The husband has a job and they work together to provide the basic needs of the family. She has no history with any other micro-finance institution. She is applying for her 2nd loan of 20,000 KES with KADET, after repaying her 1st loan successfully.   

She plans to purchase more materials to sell, with a desire to expand her business. With the income from the expanded business, she plans to improve the standard of living for her family, and she hopes to open her own shop where she will display the materials for sale.

loans.use: Buying more stock of materials

loans.name: Juan Oswaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es él Sr. Juan;  el tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo;  es natural de Lima y se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio vende todo tipo de productos como por ejemplo, vino, néctar de frutas, yogur y todo lo relacionado a la agro industria desde hace 7 años. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en diferentes productos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Mi Perú (My Peru). The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco.

The client is Mr. Juan. He is 41 years old, has a live-in partner, and has a son. He is originally from Lima and he works in the retail business. He sells all types of products – for example, wine, fruit nectar, yogurt, and anything related to the agricultural industry. He has been in this business for the past 7 years. He is requesting this loan to invest in different products.

Juan is grateful for those who are part of this dream and he promises to make his payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in different products

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea L., 56 years old, owns a medium-sized stone house where she lives and operates a café business. She is a single mother and has three children. Two of her children are already married and have started new homes. The other one, a single son, appears on the photograph above. Chea L. receives help for her responsibilities from her son who is a car detailer in a private garage. 

Chea L. is concerned that her income is not very much as her business has recently suffered due to insufficient financial capital. Chea L. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital, which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To increase her capital.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S., from the village of Dapaon, is a 57-year-old widowed mother of four adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling baked goods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to provide financially for her son going to another country to work, Elsa is requesting her fifth loan of 35000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions, etc. and is requesting a loan to start a fish farming business.  A 45-year-old widow, Lilia has five children, four of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To start a fish farming business

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia (pictured with the raised hand) is a 37-year-old, married woman. Her husband is M. A., and they have two daughters. Both of their daughters are in the 7th grade. They live in a two-room brick house in an area called Mughalpura, which is located in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is the second-largest city in Pakistan, and it is famous for its history and culture.

She supports her family with her dye (coloring) clothes business. Specifically, she dyes different items of women's clothes, including shawls and shirts. She has been doing this work for over 6 years and has a good number of clients. Her husband operates a gentlemen’s beauty salon in the nearby market, where he provides services such as hair-cutting and facial treatments.

Razia has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s salon. He explains that he will utilize the loan proceeds to purchase beauty products such as creams, scrubs, and lotions. By doing so, he will be able to serve more clients and to thereby increase his business income. Razia is hopeful that her husband’s business will continue to grow after he utilizes the loan proceeds. She is a new loan applicant and this would be her first loan from Asasah.

loans.use: To further expand her husband's business by purchasing additional beauty products

loans.name: Nilda Alivia

texts.es:
Nilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de EL Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos hijos y  grado de instrucción de secundaria completa.
Nilda viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar  el capital  de su negocio de compra y venta de ganados entre ellos corderos, toros y chanchos.
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño es ser mayorista y llevarlo directo a la ciudad de Lima.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la utilidad del ahorro y compartir sus fiambres.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the “Ciudad Nueva” communal bank, located in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 28 years old, is married, has two children, and has completed high school.

Nilda has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for three years. Her first loan, for 300 soles, permitted her to increase her investment in her business, the buying and selling of livestock, including lambs, bulls, and pigs.

Nilda is now seeking a loan of 3000 soles that she will use to again invest in livestock. Her dream is to become a wholesaler and sell her products directly to the city of Lima. 

What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings accounts and sharing her meat products with the other members.

loans.use: Purchase more livestock

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 32-year-old married woman living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of the family and her family dream is educating her child up to a tertiary instituition. She sells second hand shoes and has been in business for one year. Her business dream is to diversify into the transportation sector. Betty needs the credit facility to buy a motorcycle for business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for business

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
HISTORIAS KIVA

Ana Patricia T., tiene 28  años de edad es casada. Tiene 2 hijos los dos van a la escuela, Patricia trabaja en la elaboración de trajes de pantz y trajes formales para uniformes escolares y sweteres etc.
Los trajes que hace lo entrega en las escuelas, y en diferentes instituciones. 
Tiene 6  años de estar trabajando con esta actividad, patricia solicita este crédito a KIVA, para invertir en compra de telas para empezar a  elaborar los trajes para el otro ciclo escolar.
El sueño de Patricia es mejorar su vida con sus hijos y luchar para darles sus estudios hasta graduarse.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia T. is 28 years old.  She is married and has two children who go to school.  Patricia works making pant suits, school uniforms, sweaters etc.

She delivers the suits and uniforms that she makes to schools and different institutions.  Patricia has been in this business for 6 years.  She is requesting this Kiva loan to invest in buying fabric to start making uniforms for the next school year.

Patricia's dream is to improve her life with her children and to work hard to provide them with an education until they graduate.

loans.use: To make pant suits and formal suits for schools

loans.name: Leonad

texts.en: Leonad is 37 years old, married to Eunice, and together they have four children. He has rental houses in Kawangware, a very busy and highly populated region. Leonad was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and this will be his second loan; he has never borrowed elsewhere. Having operated the business for the last two years, Leonad intends to use the loan to buy building materials in order to renovate the houses as the New Year begins. He hopes to become a landlord with many houses for rent in the area.

loans.use: To buy some bulding materials in order to renovate rental houses.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flora; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente en la clínica San Juan de Dios, ella enseña a los diferentes niños que viven en esta clínica san Juan de Dios, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Urpi communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Flora is 58 years old, a widow, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her work as a teacher at the San Juan de Dios Clinic, teaching the different children who live in this clinic. She wants to have a grocery store and she is requesting the loan for housing maintenance.

Flora is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: Maintenance for her house

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 61 años, tiene 2 hijas adoptivas, que la adoran mucho, y viven en su casa  que es propia. Por muchos años atrás vende productos de belleza, ofreciendo de casa en casa; después  apoyaba a sus hijas con su negocio, atendiendo a los clientes. Con el tiempo sus hijas la motivaron para que tenga su propio negocio, desde entonces, tiene una vitrina donde exhibe sus cosméticos en una tienda que alquiló, ahora ya no tiene necesidad de caminar largos trayectos para vender sus productos. Le gusta el negocio que realiza, porque se siente muy entretenida realizando esta labor, aparte de eso capta buenas utilidades. Para intensificar su negocio, está pensado diversificar con más productos y  también implementar con más joyas de catálogos  y de fantasía finas. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y como es socia antigua es muy responsable en la pago de sus cuotas, ya valora la utilidad del  dinero  para su progreso. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en el incremento de productos de belleza para continuar trabajando con su negocio.
texts.en: Felicita is 61 years of age.  She has 2 adopted daughters, whom she adores very much.  She lives in her own home.  For many years she sold beauty products, offering them house to house.  Later she supported her two daughters with her business, tending to her clients.  With time her daughters motivated her to have her own store.  Since then, she has had a case where she shows her cosmetics in a store that she rents.  Now she doesn't need to walk such long distances to sell her products.  She enjoys running her business, because she feels entertained by her work, aside from the fact that it gives keeps her well occupied.  To grow her business, she is thinking of diversifying her products and adding more jewelry and fine fantasy items from catalogs.  This is her 11th loan with MFP, and, since she is an old associate, she is very responsible in making her payments.  She values the use of money to get ahead.  On obtaining the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products to continue working with her business.

loans.use: To grow her inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Liliam Lerroyde

texts.es:
Liliam tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donD. ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos D. uso diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes, ella suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo D. cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza para el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Liliam desea implementar su negocio con más productos D. modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Liliam, 56, is married and lives with her family in the TambogranD. farming zone, an area with semitropical weather known primarily for mango and lemon production, that belongs to Piura province and is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small home-based store where she stocks daily use items and groceries.  She tends to customers with dedication and charisma so she has an established base of regular customers that prefer to buy in her store.  Income from this activity is used to support the family’s economy.

Liliam wants to stock more products in her store so that sales will increase and she can meet current demand.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to help her meet her objective.

loans.use: To stock her store with more products.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach T., 49, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of approximately $3.50 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $30 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $500 to rent a plot of farmland to grow vegetables. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: rent a plot of farmland to grow vegetables

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Sandra se siente muy feliz porque pudo concretar  lo que tanto ansiaba tener su propio negocio   fue su hermana quien la animo a realizar su sueño, después de verla  trabajar en las calles informalmente  lo cual implicaba dejar a sus hijos  solos y muchos riesgos en las calles,  es así que empezaron  habilitando un lugar  en su misma casa  para poner el negocio   en su bazar  ofrecen todo tipo de prendas de vestir y accesorios para damas, niños y caballeros . Por la variedad que ofrecen y la facilidad de pago  han logrado ganar clientela y esperan seguir creciendo, en la actualidad esta inmersa en la campaña escolar, su préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de uniformes escolares como chompas, camisas, blusas, medias, pantalones y faldas.  Para mas adelante esta pensando incorporar  la venta de zapatos, gracias a su trabajo es que ella puede ayudar  en la manutención del hogar, por otro lado pertenecer al grupo” LAS EXITOSAS”  le da la oportunidad de seguir creciendo actualmente es la secretaria del grupo que esta formado por  07 socias.

  * Sandra es la tercera de las paradas.
texts.en:
Sandra feels very happy for finally obtaining what she always longed for: her own business.  Her sister encouraged her to fulfill her dreams after seeing her work informally selling items in the streets which forced her to leave her children and run the risk of working in the streets.  They began making the arrangement to run a small store out of their own home; they offer all types of clothing and accessories for men, women and children.
