Due to the variety of goods they offer and the good prices, they have earned a loyal clientele and they hope to continue growing.  Right now, the school year is beginning so she needs this loan to buy school uniforms like sweaters, shirts, blouses, socks, pants and skirts.  In the future, she would like to begin selling shoes.  Thanks to the earnings from her store, she helps to pay for the household expenses.  She belongs to and is the secretary of the Las Exitosas group, made up of 7 women.

* Sandra is the 3 woman standing

loans.use: COMPRA DE UNIFORMES ESCOLARES

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. has six dependants she is taking care of. Ama cooks kokonte at Abura near Frami in Cape Coast, which she has done for 7 years. She sells “wele” (the coat or skin of a cow) as well.  It is used in preparing soups and sauces. Her husband is a farmer. Ama contributes her income to the well-being of the home. Ama will use the loan to purchase more "wele" to supply her increasing customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to buy a piece of land.

In front of her she has displayed some of the coats yet to be sold.

loans.use: to purchase more "wele" (cow hide) for resale

loans.name: Jesus Victor

texts.es:
Jesús nació en la ciudad de Pucartambo donde se celebra la fiesta de la Virgen del Carmen y la fiesta de la salida  del Sol en Tres Cruses de Oro, él tiene 29 años de edad es soltero y no tiene hijos aun. Actualmente, Jesús vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde hay hermosos casas, calles históricas y donde antes vivieron los Incas, él es una persona trabajadora que sale adelante y es guía de turismo, él trabaja en la agencia de viajes “MBA TOUR OPERADOR” desde a hace varios años y le va muy bien. Jesús en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar equipos de camping, carpas, utensilios y otras cosas más que el necesita. El sueño de Jesus es abrir una agencia de viajas de turismo.   

Jesús es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Jesús was born in the city of Pucarambo where the feast of the Virgen del Carmen is celebrated as well as the Rising of the Sun feast at Tres Cruces de Oro.  He is 29 years old and single; he has no children yet.

Jesús is currently living in the city of Cusco where there are beautiful houses and historic streets where the Incas used to live.  He is a very hard working person who gets ahead working as a Tourist Guide.  He has worked for the “MBA TOUR OPERADOR” tourist agency for several years and does very well.  On this occasion, Jesús needs the loan to buy camping equipment: tents, utensils and other things he needs.  His dream is to open his own travel agency.

Jesús is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Puntualito” (Right on Time) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy camping equipment.

loans.name: Mulya Sari Group

texts.en:
Mulya Sari Group is a group of women who are located in rural areas and consists of 12 members. Ni Ketut I. W., trusted by the members, became chairman of the group.

Ni Ketut I. W. has been raising pigs since she married 15 years ago because the business can help the family income. Ni Ketut I. W. had four children who are still enrolled in  school. Her husband worked as a brick maker, but because his business went bankrupt, her husband finally migrated to Sulawesi, to look for a new source of revenue.
 
Ni Ketut I. W. proposes to venture into capital loans to buy piglets and feed. This loan will be used to purchase two piglets at Rp. 350,000 per pig and the rest will be used to buy feed. The profits will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets at  Rp. 350,000 each and pig feed.

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en:
Valelia is 25 years of age and married with three children. She has a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has three years of experience in this business. Valelia needs a loan of WST $1400 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Valelia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Valelia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Miurell Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Miurell Vanessa  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 24 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años al inicio compraba la paca ahora compra por pieza. El sueño de L. es tener una mega butique donde venda de todo un poco.
Ella tiene una niña de 4 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y compañero de vida en el negocio.
texts.en: Señora Miurell Vanessa is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman. She is 24 years old and has been selling used clothing for three years. In the beginning she bought in bulk but now she buys by the piece. Her dream is to have a mega boutique one day where she sells a little bit of everything. She has a 4 year old daughter and receives help in the business from her mother and her life partner.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with 10 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 1 year, she has operated a business selling firewood from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also owns a retail shop which contributes to her income. She faces a major challenge  in her business with the high cost of transportation.

With the Kshs 20,000 she has requested, Kibibi plans to pay school fees and also purchase more stock of firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees and also purchase firewood for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Sael

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 36 años de edad, el es soltero, cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en el sector llamado ciudad de Dios en el distrito de Pacasmayo, en La Libertad.

Carlos se dedica a brindar servicios de alquiler de sonido para eventos especiales como matrimonios umpleaños bautizos, etc. en la zona en donde vive y en los alrededores, es muy conocido por sus vecinos, ya que para cualquier evento están solicitando sus servicios. Carlos cuenta con mas de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro tiempo que le a permitido conseguir clientes fijos para sus negocio.

Carlos está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 para que pueda dar mantenimiento a la unidad móvil en la que transporta su equipo de sonido, d esta manera su movilizacion sea mucho mas rapida y efectiva poder crecer como empresario en el rubro.

Carlos es una persona muy carismática y de muy buen carácter , que desea crecer como empresario y conseguir una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Carlos is 36 years of age, single, and has his own home which is located in the region called Ciudad de Dios in the district of Pacasmayo in La Libertad. 

Carlos works in sound equipment rentals for special events such as weddings, birthdays, baptisms etc. in and around the area where he lives. He is very well known by his neighbors, since they are seeking his services for all their events. Carlos has over three years of experience in this line of work during which time he has been able to acquire regular customers for his business. 

Carlos is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 Peruvian soles in order to provide maintenance to the mobile unit in which he transports his sound equipment. Thus he will be able to mobilize much more quickly and effectively, and so grow as a business owner in his line of work. 

Carlos is a very charismatic person and of high character. He wants to grow as a business owner and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain a mobile unit used for transporting his sound equipment.

loans.name: Mary Muthoni

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and married to Geoffrey. They do not have children yet. She owns a hardware shop in Ruai, Nairobi, where she supplies hardware items to various institutions. She has been doing this business for the last three years and gets an income of 20,000 KES per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client of KADET. She has a good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her fourth loan of 78,500 KES from KADET Ltd., which she plans to use to buy more iron sheets and nails to supply to a school.

She will use the extra profit to open another shop. Mary hopes to grow her business and, in future, to own a mega hardware shop. She is very hardworking and focused lady.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets and nails to supply to a school

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria, 71, is married with seven children, six of whom are no longer dependent while one child still lives with her and her husband. She has a business selling charcoal and chicha, a local peruvian drink maD. from corn, at her home. After Macaria sells the charcoal from her store, she buys corn in order to make chicha to sell.

She was born in Urubamba and has been selling charcoal and chicha for 12 or 13 years. Macaria is asking for a $400 loan in order to buy more charcoal that she can sell at the store located in her house. She is committed to making all of her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell at her store.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child.

Genalyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Genalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Genalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Jose Rufino

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas es casado, agrícola y ganadero, dicho negocio surgió gracias a sus padres quienes le enseñaron el oficio desde hace ya varios años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. 
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, veneno y otros fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, esta compra le ayudara garantizar la siembra y ofrecerles mejores granos a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y cubrir sus gastos económicos cotidianos.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife and two children.  He is a farmer who learned his trade from his parents several years ago.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

He is requeting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his corn and bean crops.  The purchase will help guarantee a successful harvest and better quality produce for his customers.

His dream is to give his children an education and to take care of daily household expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 33 years old, is married with three children and lives in Tangub City. To earn a living, she makes and sells snacks. From this she earns about 3,000 PHP each month.

Julieta has been a member of PMPC for a year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more ingredients to make her snacks.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make her snacks.

loans.name: Los Mangos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo  esta conformado por  once mujeres indígenas que se dedican a diferentes actividades  económicas, ellas formaron  este grupo  por que  son vecinas y de la misma localidad.
Este grupo se llama  Los Mangos  sus integrantes decidieron ponerle  así  por que  donde se van reunir para ser sus juntas  es en la casa de la señora  Fortunata  y donde ella vive esta un  árbol de mangos  que da una hermosa sombra y unos  mangos bien deliciosos.
Este  grupo esta ubicado  en un lugar hermoso donde esta un río  donde las persona se van a bañar, lavar la ropa y a pescar.
La representante de este grupo es la señora  Fortunata  de cuarenta y cinco años de edad esta felizmente casada  con el señor  Seferino de  cuarenta y nueve años de edad.
La señora  Fortunata  es quien envito a las personas a formar este grupo para hacer mas grande su negocio y las que no tenian negocio, poder empezar uno y cambiar sus vidas.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos una mujer y un varón.
Ella  trabaja con un molino que tiene en su casa  donde muele nixtamal y chile para moles, le gusta su negocio por que le deja muy buenas ganancias, mas cuando las personas de su localidad tienen fiesta, boda.
Pidió el préstamo para comprarle nuevas piezas a su molino como son: la bandeja  para echar el nixtamal u nuevas piedras por  que las que tiene están picadas.
Las que  integran este grupo son las personas siguientes:
Carmela  - se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Francisca – se dedica a la venta de materiales para la construcción.
Silvina- se dedica a la venta  de  antojitos mexicanos.
Clotilde- se dedica a la venta  de pollos.
Rodelfina – se  dedica a la venta de  tacos de guisados.
Minerva-  se dedica a la venta de manualidades.
Martina- se dedica a la venta de  a la venta de carne de res.
Elizabeth- se dedica a la venta de  calzados.
Clotilde Ana - se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Erica – se dedica a la venta de a la venta de pasteles.
Fortunata- se dedica a moler nixtamal y chile para mole.
A nombre de todas las integrantes  de este grupo  le agradecen a fundación realidad y  a los que colaboran  en este proyecto  para mejorar sus vidas  y cumplan los sueños  de los más desprotegidos.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 11 indigenous women who devote themselves to different business activities.  They formed this group because they are neighbors from the same place.  The group is called Los Mangos.  Its members decided to give it this name because the place that they meet together is at Fortunata’s house, and there is a mango tree there that provides lovely shade and delicious mangos.  This group is located in a beautiful place where there is a river where people go to bathe, wash clothes, and fish.

Fortunata, age 45, represents the group.  She is happily married to 49 year old Serefino.  Fortunata is the one that invited people to be part of this group to make her business bigger and so that those that did not have a business were able to start one and change their lives.

She has two children, a girl and a boy.

She works with a mill that she has at her house.  She grinds corn and peppers to make “mole” (sauce).  She likes her business because it gives her good income, especially when people from her area are having a fiesta or wedding.

She requested the loan to buy new pieces for her mill.  She will buy things like the tray for the corn and new stones because the ones she has are bad.

The following are members of this group:

Carmela – sells chickens.
Francisca – sells construction materials.
Silvina- sells Mexican snacks.
Clotilde- sells chickens.
Rodelfina – sells “tacos de guisados” (tortilla filled with a variety of prepared meats, vegetables, and moles.”
Minerva- sells handicrafts.
Martina- sells beef.
Elizabeth- sells shoes.
Clotilde Ana - sells chickens.
Erica – sells cakes.
Fortunata- grinds corn and peppers to make mole. 

In the name of all the members of the group they are grateful to the Fundación Realida and those who collaborated in this project to improve their lives and to fulfill the dreams of those who are the most vulnerable.

loans.use: to buy stones for the mill in order to grind corn and peppers for mole.

loans.name: Adiba

texts.ru: Адиба умная и добросовестная молодая мамочка. Она занимается предпринимательством. Ей в бизнесе помогает её мать. Её супруг уехал в России и не вернулся, а также там женился на другую женщину. Адиба с двумя несовершеннолетними детьми вернулась домой к своим родителям, и спустя 6 месяцев она официально развилась с мужом. Ей было тяжело, пережить все эти трудные моменты жизни и её мать всегда поддерживала её и дала ей хорошие советы. Затем она устроила своих детей в детсад, а сама начала свой бизнес. Вот уже более 4 года она занимается купля продажей женской одежды и у неё уже много постоянных клиентов. Адиба хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки новой ассортимент товара с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее благодарит Киву и Имон Интернэшнл за поддержку и поощрение.
texts.en: Adiba is an intelligent and conscientious young mother and a businesswoman. Her mother helps her run the business. Her husband went to Russia for work but never returned to his home country because he married a woman in Russia. Adiba and her two minor children returned to her parents' home and six months later she divorced her husband. It was hard for Adiba to go through these difficult times. She was lucky to have her mother by her side. After her children went to the kindergarten, Adiba started her business, which is four years old by now. She sells women's clothes and has many loyal customers. Adiba is applying for a loan of 3000 USD in order to purchase a new assortment of goods and expand her business. She would like to thank in advance Kiva and Imon International for all their support and encouragement.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a widow with five children, three of whom graduated from school while two still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Dinalyn

texts.en:
Dinalyn is 47 years old and is currently engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells canned goods, candies, instant noodles and breads. She has been in this business for five years and earning a net income of P5,000 every month.

She wishes to expand her income, so Dinalyn is requesting a loan amount P5,000 to buy cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce as additional goods in her business. Dinalyn is looking forward to when her income will exceed the normal amount so that she can easily acquire a better living as well as provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce as additional goods in her business.

loans.name: Water Project Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Water Project Group in Western Kenya! Simon is the facilitator of the Water Project group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Simon takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send  his children to school and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Simon had a very good maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Simon was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Simon will buy more land and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Water Project group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Simon is pictured with his group members in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Khayala

texts.ru:
Khayala rodilas v 31 qod. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Khayala yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona preselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. Ona uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Khayala is 31 years old, married and has one child.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives with her family in the Fuzuli region.  Khayala currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and breeding cattle for two years.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 46-year-old married woman. She has one son and one daughter. She and her husband support their family by selling food in the local community from their food stall. 

Diep would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and better quality of food and furniture to expand her business. She hopes that through the loan she can attract new customers and improve her family's living conditions with the higher income that she generates.

loans.use: to buy more food and furniture to expand her business.

loans.name: Nursapar

texts.en: Nursapar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and six children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife cares for their children. The eldest child is a college student, the middle three are students in school, and rest stay at home. He started his business repairing and selling salvaged cars and in 2003. He also runs a taxi service using his own car. His engineering skills are incredible and he is the only one with an income in the family. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to maintain his own car to run his taxi service properly. He is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es: Rosa Amanda de 36 años de edad, labora como docente de primaria en la Escuela Vigarmy Flores desde hace 21 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, su compañero de vida trabaja como agriculltor, ambos son bien trabajadores y comparten sus gastos familiares y los deberes crediticios ya que son una familia bien unida que trabajan para sacar adelante a su familia. Solicita  su 8vo credito para  reparar las paredes de su vivienda que se encuentran en mal estado y desea reforzarla repellandola, y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones  de vida a su linda familia, en su comunidad es bien conocida por ser una mujer de buen vivir y bien humilde, su sueño en la vida es  tener salud y estabilidad laboral para  ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Rosa Amanda is 36 years old and has worked as a primary school teacher at the Escuela Vigarmy Flores since she was 21. She has done so with great responsibility and honesty. Her life companion works as a farmer. Both are good workers and share family costs and loan responsibilities, and they are a close family who labor to advance themselves.

This will be Rosa's 8th loan for repairing walls at their home, which is in bad condition. They wish to reinforce them by plastering, providing better conditions of living for their lovely family. Rosa is well known in her community for living a good life and for her humility. Rosa's dream in life is to have good health and work stability in order to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to improve her home by reinforcing and plastering the walls.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 26, is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a business of selling deep fried potatoes at an open air market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing potatoes in the market. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the future.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase cooking fat oil, potatoes and flavors. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat oil, potatoes and flavors.

loans.name: Sandra Maricela

texts.es:
Sandra es una madre de familia de 25 años, vive solo con su hija de 5 añitos en Otavalo Provincia de Imbabura. Sandra se describe como una persona amable, responsable y que le gusta su trabajo.

Sandra trabaja sola, ella es vendedora ambulante de ropa, este negocio inició cuando tuvo a su hija ya que es el único ingreso que tiene para mantenerla y darle la alimentación, educación. Es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de calentadores, chompas, porque en esta temporada se le incrementan los pedidos y de esta manera obtiene buenos ingresos para su hija y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

El sueño de Sandra es tener un local propio donde vender su mercadería y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 25 year old mother who lives alone with her five year old daughter in Otavalo Province in Imbabura. She is described as a friendly and responsible person who enjoys her work.

She works alone as a street vendor selling clothing. She started this business when she had her daughter and it generates her only income to support, feed and educate her child. This is her third loan request to Fodemi and it will be used to purchase leg warmers and jackets, because requests for these items increase during this season and she is able to earn a good income for her daughter and cover household necessities.

Sandra’s dream is to have her own shop where she can sell her merchandise and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase leg warmers and jackets since she already has requests for these items during this holiday season.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, nuevamente se ha decidido a obtener otro crédito por que quiere seguir mejorando más su vivienda y comprar materiales como lamina,madera y pago de mano de obra, con ello podra mejorar el techo de la casa, de esa forma podrá vivir mejor su familia. 
La experiencia con el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, porque mejoro mucho su vivienda por el cual quiere seguir trabajando con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
María has again decided to get another loan, because she wants to continue improving her home. She wants to buy materials such as metal sheeting, and wood, and pay for labor. That way, her family will be able to live better. 

The experience with the previous loan helped her a lot, because she greatly improved her home, and therefore wants to continue working with our institution.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, and wood, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa es el grupo formado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas vieron en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran ayuda para ellas y sus familias. Desean trabajar juntas y por medio del trabajo en equipo poder ayudarse las unas con las otras. Oñondivepa es muy reconocido ya que sus miembros siempre trabajan juntas y se ayudan en lo que pueden.
Felisa se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo y de toda temporada, trae siempre prendas de muy buena calidad y a muy buen precio, y eso es lo que la ayuda a tener muy buena clientela y por tanto un buen ingreso. Nos comenta que las ventas que hace la ayuda a mantener a su familia y a darle todo lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de temporada, como ser camisillas, remeras, shorts y demás, con lo cual estará surtida para esta temporada que entra.
texts.en:
Oñondivepa is a group made up of 13 women from the city of San Lorenzo.  They saw in the Fundación Paraguaya program a great help for themselves and their families.  The women like to work together, and through their teamwork they help each other.  Oñondivepa is very well known since the members always work together and help each other when they can.
Felisa makes her living selling all types of clothing for all seasons.  She always has high quality clothing at a good price, which is what helps her to have a good clientele, and therefore a good income.  She tells us that the sales she makes help to support her family and give them everything they need.
Felisa is requesting the loan in order to purchase seasonal clothing, like t-shirts, shorts and other items, with which she will be well-stocked for the coming season.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing for resale.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 26 years old and is married with one child who is six months old .
He is a well-known gentleman in the business of arts which he has been running for the past two years.   Elias's working hours on a daily basis begin from 6.am in the morning till 11pm in the night.

Through Vision Finance Company, he came to request for a kiva loan in order to purchase more art products to enhance on his work and make better quality which will draw in more customers. With the business growing bigger, Elias will be able to look after his wife and young child by giving them good quality of life forexample covering their medical insurance,renovate his house and also save for the future especially since he has a young child who will soon start with school.

loans.use: To buy more tools for ARTS

loans.name: Yéwéwoto

texts.en:
Married and the mother of three, Yéwéwoto G. makes gari (cassava flour), one of the staples of southern Togo for over thirty years. Despite being in her sixties, her experience and energy are undeniable. Her husband lost his ability to work which leaves Ms. G. to face paying the bills by herself. The quality of her product has earned her a large customer base because good women come from Lomé to buy her gari. But without enough money, her production of gari is very limited, and her customers are increasingly disappointed. She is now dealing with a strong demand that she cannot meet. Making gari is difficult, given the high risk of injury, particularly when grating the cassava root by hand. Today, she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy a grater in order to increase her production and her profit margin, all to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame G. Yéwéwoto produit du gari (farine à base de manioc), l’un des aliments de base au Sud du Togo depuis une trentaine d’années. Malgré sa soixantaine, elle possède une expérience et un dynamisme impeccable. Son mari a perdu sa force de travail ; ce qui laisse Madame G. seule devant les charges du ménage. La qualité de sa production lui a procuré une clientèle importante car les bonnes femmes viennent depuis Lomé pour acheter son gari. Mais n’ayant pas assez de moyens sa production est très limitée et les clients sont de plus en plus déçus. Elle fait face aujourd’hui à une forte demande qu’elle est incapable de satisfaire. La fabrication du gari est une activité très pénible avec tous les risques de blessures que cela comporte surtout avec le râpage manuel du manioc. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $600 qui servira à l’achat d’une râpeuse afin d’accroître sa production et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a grater

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donalds lives in Buza area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. He owns a vegetable and fruits stall where he sells different fruits and vegetables. He buys some of the fresh produce like tomatoes and spinach from local farmers nearby his residence. He also buys other farm produce like oranges, bananas and pineapples from nearby regions.

Donald need to expand his business to meet a rising demand from his clients. He is planning to buy baskets to protect and display his produce. He also planning to purchase a bicycle to help him fetch some locally produced produce from nearby areas. To make these purchases he is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for produce stand

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
My name is Nora Z., and I have dedicated myself to selling new clothes for women and children. I've had my business for three years. I sell my product at government offices and private businesses. My goal is to increase my inventory to raise my sales. With the earnings I'll be able to provide my family with food and other necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Nora Z. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para damas y niños, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3años, mi producto lo vendo en diferentes compañias estatales y privadas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia con alimento y otras necesidades personales

loans.use: Purcahse sweaters, shirts, blouses, underwear and shorts.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia C. T. wishes to obtain a loan of $275 to buy clothing in order to make women’s dresses. There is a demand for these dresses in her community.

Lidia lives by herself in this small shed; half of the space is taken up by the area where she does her sewing. Her 3 daughters have now married and live with their family elsewhere. “However, they usually come around here to visit me on a regular basis,” she states. “No one else around this community makes clothing so my business is good!”

Lidia also sells fancy jewelry to complement her income, as there are times when she isn’t doing a sewing job. She’s been a women’s clothing confectioner for over 5 years now, and has done fancy jewelry sales for over 2 years. "It’s a nice combination, as women love to have their clothing matched up with the jewelry they exhibit, so I do just that!” Questioned as to her possibilities in terms of producing and selling men’s clothing and apparel, she states that she can do so, but that as of lately, she hasn’t been asked for this type clothing. However, she mentioned that recently she had done some children’s clothing that she was asked for. She is better known for her women’s clothing design and confection.

loans.use: To buy cloth in order to make women’s dresses

loans.name: Ni Ketut Warni

texts.id:
Ketut Warni lives in a simple semi permanent house in Berawantangi village. With an initial capital of Rp1,300,000 Ketut Warni raised 2 mother pigs. Every day she fed those 2 pigs 2X/day Konsentrat (local brand) mixed with banana tree trunk at a cost of Rp15,000 (about US$1.70). She has been working on this business for 3 years, since her husband's income as a tenant farmer is not sufficient to pay for family expenses. Especially Ketut Warni has a child that now goes to Middle school. Every 4 months the mother pigs give birth to up to 10 piglets, after 2 months those piglets were ready to be sold. From that sales up to Rp 1,900,000 (about US$209) at Rp190,000X10, she could profit Rp800,000 (about $88)/6 months. This profit is used to pay for child school expenses, and other family needs. Ketut Warni is happy that with a loan from Dinari for Rp 1,300,000 (about $143-150 depending on exchange rate fluctuation) she could expand her business by buying another mother pig for Rp800,000 (about $88), while the rest Rp500,000 (about $55) would be used to buy animal feed. She hope her additional income and profit would increase so that it would be sufficient to pay for daily living expenses,

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Warni tinggal disebuah rumah sederhana semi permanen di desa di Berawantangi. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.300.000 Ketut Warni memelihara 2 ekor babi penginduk . Setiap hari babi tersebut diberi makan Konsentrat dicampur dengan batang pisang , sebanyak 2 kali sehari dan biaya yang dikeluarkan untuk 2 ekor babi tersebut sebanyak Rp.15.000. Usaha ini ditekuninya semenjak 3 tahun yang lalu mengingat penghasilan suami sebagai seorang petani tidak mampu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga . Apalagi Ketut Warni mempunyai satu orang anak yang kini sudah duduk dibangku SMU. Setiap 4 bulan sekali babi penginduk tersebut melahirkan anaknya .Dan sekarang salah satunya sudah melahirkan anak sebanyak 10 ekor, setelah 2 bulan maka anak-anak babi sudah siap dijual. Dari hasil penjualan sebanyak Rp. 1.900.000 ( @ 190.000 x 10) maka keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.800.000 setiap enam bulan sekali. Keuntungan ini pergunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya juga untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga Ketut Warni . Sekarang Ketut warni sangat senang dengan adanya pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.300.000 karena dengan pinjaman tersebut Ketut Warni bisa pengembangkan usahanya dengan membeli 1 ekor babi penginduk lagi seharga Rp.800.000 ,sedangkan sisanya sebesar Rp.500.000 dipergunakan untuk modal pakan ternak. Hal ini dilakukan agar hasil atau keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih banyak dan dapat mencukupi biaya hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and animal feed

Membeli induk babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Kemale

texts.en:
Ms. Kemale is a woman with a low income. She is 40, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Kemale owns a herd of milk cows. Every day she sells milk to the local milk processing shop. Her son (he is pictured) assists her in breeding the cows. The income from two cows is too low to support the family and to increase her tiny herd. That is why Kemale applied to the Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make her monthly income higher. The price of a milk calf is $300, the cost of breeding is $100. The other $100 she plans to save for unexpected expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a cow for milk

loans.name: Arif

texts.ru:
Arif lives in the town of Saalti, in the Repbulic of Azerbaijan in Transcaucasia. He is 39 and married with two children. Arif is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife (see photo) in 8-9 months and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today Arif is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase an additional 5 calves per year. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $500 in his business. In order to receive this amount, Arif has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, Normicro.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Г-н Arif живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 39 лет, он женат, имеет 2-х детей. Arif является единственным кормильцем семьи и имеет единственный доход от выращивания и продажи крупного рогатого скота на местном базаре. Ежегодно он покупает молодых телок с приусадебных хозяйств близлежащих деревень, выращивает их с помощью супруги (см. фото) в течении 8-9 месяцев в своём хозяйстве и затем продаёт уже повзрослевших коров и быков местным мясникам. Сегодня Arif думает о расширении своего бизнеса, т.к. дохода с нынешнего стада не хватает для обеспечения необходимых потребностей его семьи. Он планирует расширить ежегодный обьём закупок телят на 5 штук больше. Для этого ему требуется инвестировать в его бизнес около 500 долларов. Чтобы получить эту сумму, Arif обратился в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Kamuli B3(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Harriet is 47 years old and divorced with three children. She is a dairy farmer.She wants to use her loan to buy a dairy cow.She intends to use the extra business profits to finish her rental houses that are under construction and also to buy a motocycle. Joyce wants to use the loans to buy more beds for her clinic. Goretti has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to add in stock. Pheobe has a nursery school and intends to use the loan to expand to a primary school. Syson is a poultry farmer and wants to buy poultry feeds with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow, to buy beds for a clinic, to add stock to a retail shop, to expand a primary school and to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
Silvestre raises dairy cows, selling the milk production to PIL Andina (Milk Production Plant).

He lives in the community of Kallutaka in the Pucarani sector, about three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. He is a widower and lives with his son and daughter in law.

He will use the loan to purchase a better quality milking cow which will enable him to increase his milk production in response to the increased demand from PIL Andina.

This is his first loan with Impro. His financial evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Silvestre se dedica a la cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).

Vive en la Comunidad de Kallutaka sector Pucarani a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz., El es viudo y vive junto a su hijo y su hija política.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche, en vista de la demanda incrementada de PIL Andina.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow.

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Mrs. Hon V., 52, is the mother of five children and works with her husband growing rice on their plot of farmland. They earn about $3 a day.

Two of their daughters are garment workers in Phnom Penh, each earning $100 per month. One of their sons is a security guard earning a salary $50 a month. Their other children live at home and work on the farm.

This couple will use their loan to renovate their house as their current house is too old. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To renovate their house

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris D. is thirty-eight years old  and a mother of twins and 2 other children. She operates a second-hand clothing store where she sells both adult and children clothes, bed spreads, curtains, type-dyes. She will use her new loan to buy more bales of clothes with more variety, which will appeal to more customers. Through the loan program,  Doris now has a store of her own. It is her heart's desire that her business progresses well so she can send her twin daughters to high school this year. She belongs to a community group called Eagle Trust Group. Group members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. sells shoes and women’s dresses. She is a single parent of 4 children. Business is going very well, so Ms. P. wishes to increase sales to improve her income. But she is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi T., 60 years old, has joined TYM since 1997. She have to take care of all three of her children as her husband passed away when they were young. Now, as they all have grown up and move out, she currently lived with the family of her youngest child. Outside of farm work, she always try to breeding cattle to help out her family. After taking out a loan from TYM last year, she decided to open up a variety store. This service doesn't take much time or effort and also profit handsomely. This cycle, she would like to borrow 10 million VND to put more into this project.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị T. 60 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997, chồng mất sớm một mình chị tần tảo nuôi 3 người con, đến nay các con chị đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, chị sống cùng vợ chồng người con trai út. Vượt qua số phận chị luôn cố gắng ngoài việc làm ruộng chị kết hợp cùng chăn nuôi, sau nhiều năm tần tảo chị đã tiết kiệm được khoản vốn kha khá kết hợp vay thêm vốn của Quỹ chị đã mở một cửa hàng bán tạp hóa tại nhà. Công việc bán hàng vừa nhàn hạ và lại cho thu nhập cao. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư mua hàng hóa. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Variety store

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Born in about 1948 in Porto-Novo in the Ouémé department in south-east Benin, Mrs. Christine D. is a widow and mother of four children. Three of her children are already grown up and are no longer dependent on her. She has always lived in Hindé 1, the district surrounding Dantokpa market. For about twenty years she has run a business selling condiments and various food products. In 2007 she took out an initial loan of 40,000 CFA Francs ($100) in order to increase her capital and make her display more attractive. This loan proved to be a great support as her business underwent a considerable improvement. She is currently requesting a third loan of 100,000 CFA Francs ($250) to better satisfy her customers who have come to her because her business is located close to Dantokpa market.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1948 à Porto-Novo dans le département de l'Ouémé au sud-ouest du Bénin, dame D. Christine est veuve et mère de quatre enfants. Trois de ses enfants sont déjà majeurs et ne sont plus à sa charge. Résidant à Hindé 1, quartier périphérique du marché de Dantokpa depuis sa naissance. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de condiments et de divers produits alimentaires il y a environ une vingtaine d’années. Afin de renforcer son capital et rendre plus attrayant son étalage, elle fit en 2007 un premier prêt de 40000F CFA. Ce crédit fut d’un grand appui pour elle car son activité a connu une amélioration considérable. Actuellement, elle sollicite pour son troisième prêt un montant de 100000F CFA pour mieux satisfaire ses clients qui sont devenus à cause de la proximité de son lieu d'activité avec le marché Dantokpa.

loans.use: To buy three boxes of canned tomatoes and 25 kg of dried peppers.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. is 52 years of age. She has been a member since 2006, the home where her family reside sits on a main road and is a very ideal and convenient location for an auto part store. She was able to borrow 3.000.000 on her first loan, which she used as capital to buy a variety of rubber rope products (timing belts) to sell out of her home; averaging 60.000d/day. After seeing the success of her business, she was able to expand her business, offering products such as automobiles rims and tires. This special inventory demands a higher capital; therefore she is requesting a larger loan amount. The auto part business has been a success; in 2007 she was able to purchase a truck to help aid in transporting her inventory. This time she is requesting a loan of 9.000.000d to use as principal for the new inventory. Her average income is about 7.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng 52 Tuổi. Tham gia Quỹ năm 2006, với địa điểm gia đình chị đang sinh sống gần đường quôc lộ nên rất thuận tiện cho việc kinh doanh. Vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 3.000.000đ để thêm vốn buôn bán dây chun ở thời điểm đó thu nhập bình quân là 60.000đ/ ngày. Quá trình buốn bán phát triển nay gia đình chị đã mở rông mô hình kinh doanh, đầu tư kinh doanh mặt hàng xăm, lốp ô tô. Với mặt hàng kinh doanh này yêu cầu vốn đầu tư lớn nên các vòng vốn sau gia đình chị đều vay ở mức vốn cao. Công việc kinh doanh phát triển nên năm 2007 gia đình chị đã mua được 1 chiếc ô tô vận tải để chủ động trong việc vân chuyển hàng hóa. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng buôn bán. Thu nhập bình quân. 7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro es comerciante, adquiere motores de movilidad en mal estado, los arregla para después re venderlos. Su otra ocupación es la de transportista publico inter provincia, viaja una l una vez a la semana. Tiene el deber de mantener a sus tres hijos y esposa, así como pagar el alquiler (vive en la Zona Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar su capital de operaciones, lo que le permitirá vender mayor cantidad de motores

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para  acceder al préstamo
texts.en:
Teodoro is a merchant, who acquires engines in a poor state, repairs them, and later resells them. He also works in public transportation within the province; he travels once a week. He is responsible for taking care of his three children and wife, as well as paying the rent (he lives in the Rió Seco zone of the city of El Alto). The loan will be used to increase his capital for operations, which will allow him to sell more engines. This is his first loan with Impro. The assessment carried out qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his work

loans.name: Shahnaz Ilyas Masih's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is the wife of I. M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of one daughter and reads at the third standard level. Shahnaz baji's husband is a building constructor and also provides construction supplies. He has been in this profession for the last 30 years. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to expand her husband's business.

Shahnaz baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Salma baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy material (leather, nails) for a shoe-making business. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy gold to make sets to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to expand her husband's construction business

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan was born in 1970. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He is married and has two children.

Elshan has three years of experience in fruits and vegetables sales. Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) to buy more fruits and vegetables for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Esperanza El Coco Group

texts.en: Cirila C. is the representative of this group of five people. Cirila is from an extremely poor area in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is looking for a loan to help increase her small business of selling clothing. She buys clothing from other cities at a cheap price, then sells them in her area for a profit. Cirila is the mother of very young children, and is responsible for their health and education. Before her small business, she had no job and was barely able to feed her children. She started her small business with her first loan from Esperanza International, and has been slowly increasing her business. She feels like this next loan will really help her increase the business size, and start generating more income. She said that she finally feels like she has something of her own, and is so happy that she can provide for her children. She dreams of having both her children attend a university so they can have a better life. She is very excited for what the future holds for her!

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA!  This is 31 year old Upendo J K.. She is a married mother of two children who are 6 and 8 years old. 

She runs a grocery store and is assisted by her husband. She works at her business 10 hours a day and 6 days per week. Her business is doing well and her monthly profits are approximately US$250. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and some animal feed. Due to the success of her business, she hopes to open another business in the future. She thanks you in advance for your support.

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and animal feed.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat Y. is 46 years old. She is married with three children of school age. Sharofat is running a café where she is providing meals of the national and European cuisine. The café is located in the central local market which allows Sharofat to have many customers, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market. The business has been generating a stable income during the last 12 years. Now Sharofat is planning to purchase foodstuffs like wheat, potatoes, carrots, onions, and oil wholesale. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 800 US Dollars for a term of 11 months. Sharofat has already been provided with two loans by IMON International and has proved herself a reliable client. Today she thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuffs like wheat, oil, potatoes, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “03 D. Mayo”, centro poblado Mariategui, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 56 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y no posee estudios. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, se dedica a la compra y venta D. productos D. la zona (papa, chuño, quinua, cebada, etc.) y posee una tienda D. abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas mercadería (productos D. la zona) para venderlo en las ferias locales D. Ilave. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, que será pagado0 en 5 cuotas mensuales; con lo cual podrá adquirir más mercadería para su tienda D. abarrotes, tales como: leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, bebidas, etc., con lo cual piensa surtir su tienda; con sus ganancias ella desea incrementar sus negocio D. abarrotes y convertirlo en una bodega granD., ello le permitirá brindar una mejor ayuda a sus hijos en su educación y una fuente D. ingreso económico cuando ella sea D. mayor edad.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Community bank “3 D. Mayo.” She lives in the Mariategui area of the Ilave district in El Collao province in Puno, Peru. She is 56, married, has three children and did not finish school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 8 years. She buys and sells regional food products like potatoes, chuño (a type of dried potato), quinoa, and barley. She also has a small grocery store. Her first loan was for 300 nuevo soles which she used to buy more regional products to sell in the local markets in Ilave. With this loan for 3,000 nuevo soles, which she will repay in 5 monthly payments, she will buy more merchandise for her grocery store, like: milk, rice, sugar, oil, drinks, etc. She wants to offer more variety at her store—with her earnings she would like to expand her business and converter her small market into a large grocery store. This would help her proviD. a better education for her children and proviD. income for her once she reaches a more advanced age.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand merchandise in her grocery store/market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase adult and children's clothing, a mannequin, and sandals

loans.name: Pipiana

texts.en: Pipiana P., 33, is married with one child.  She has five years of experience in the Taro Plantation business. She sells to the public and village people two days per week. She has previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 90 Tala (~30 USD).  SPBD loans are Pipiana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to pay for her child's school fees and to buy timber, iron roofing and cement for the renovation of her house.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees and to purchase timber, iron roofing for home improvement

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha I. sells bunches of plantains at Uselu Market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is 55 years old and married with 8 children. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more bunches of plantains to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase plantains for resale

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: The two persons shown in the picture are Hong S. and her husband. She is fifty-seven years old and married with nine children. Six of them are single and the others are married and live independently. To help provide the family's basic needs, three of her sons are employed. One drives a motor taxi and the other two are construction workers. She currently cultivates rice crop and her husband works as a local construction foreman. She has decided to apply for a loan through Kiva to buy a motorcycle that her husband can use to run a taxi for additional income.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es:
En Managua capital del bello país de Nicaragua, la señora María C. se dedica a comercializar los productos de ropa, chinelas y objetos personales como prensa pelos, aretes, entre otros siendo este su negocio el cual le brinda las condiciones para desarrollarse.

Ella, hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos ya que los requiere con mucha urgencia y para ello espera con mucho entusiasmo en que su crédito será aprobado y procederá a la compra de dicha mercadería para comercializarla.
texts.en:
Señora María C. works in Managua, the capital of the beautiful country of Nicaragua, selling clothes, footwear, and personal items such as hair clips and earrings. Her business is ready for development. Today she went to Kiva partner, Ceprodel, to obtain a loan to buy products which she urgently needs. She is waiting with much enthusiasm for the loan to be approved so she can proceed with the purchase of these products and begin selling them.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Võ Thị

texts.en:
Võ Thị X. is a 50 year old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 4 adult aged children. To make a living, X. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. X. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. X. is now requesting a new loan of 14000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu is a food vendor. She prepares and sell diewuo or what is popularly called tuozafi. Tuozafi is prepared from corn flour and eaten with soup together with fish and meat. It is enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it is an appetizing and tasty meal. She is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients like spices, meat, corn flour, leaves, etc. to prepare more food to serve her customers. She has been in business for eight years now and she is grateful for your assistance.

Mamunatu is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children. Four are currently in elementary and junior high school while her last born is still breastfeeding. She lives at Sefwi Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. Sefwi is a farming community where most of the indigenous are into cocoa farming. She belongs to a village bank called Nkunimdie which means "Victory".

loans.use: To buy food ingredients like spices, meat, corn flour, leaves, etc.

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
These people are Isatu M., Baby B., Adama K., and Isatu S.. They named their group 'Tasuthekeh'. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, their businesses will grow, sales and profit will improve. Consequently, their standard of living will also improve.

Isatu M. is the leader of this group. Isatu is now forty years of age. She is married with four children. One of her children is now in secondary school and the other three are in primary schools. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells cucumbers.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Señora Francisca E. S. es Madre de 1 hijo. Ella tiene 54 años de edad. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella dio inicio a su negocio por medio de una amiga. Pero Francisca no tenía el suficiente capital para dedicarse a este negocio, pero ella no desistió de su idea y fue por una amiga que le brindo la facilidad de prestarle el dinero y comenzó con granos básicos y golosinas, la mayoría de sus vecinos les gusta comprar en su pulpería porque la atención de Francisca es la mejor. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, granos básicos, pan, galletas, jugos y refrescos naturales. Su mayor sueño es su pequeño hijo logre ser un profesional y le brinde la ayuda necesaria.
texts.en:
Francisca is the mother of one son. She is 54 years old.

The business she is engaged in is a grocery store. She had been involved in this business for more than 17 years. She got into the business through a friend. She didn’t have enough capital to start, but she didn’t give up her idea, and a friend offered to loan her money, and she began with basic grains and sweets. Most of her neighbors like to buy at her grocery store because the attentiveness from Francisca is the best.

The reason for this financing is working capital for the purchase of sweets, basic grains, crackers, juices, and natural beverages. Her biggest dream is that her little son succeeds in being a professional and that she can offer him the necessary help.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hilda Eugenia

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 53 years old and has five children. Three of her children are married and two of them live with her. Her youngest is going to school at the local public school.

Hilda studied dressmaking and sewing to oblige her husband but she didn’t enjoy the work. Instead, Hilda enjoys cooking and decided to work in a dining hall. Every day she works from 9 in the morning to 2 in the afternoon and in the evenings she sells chicken sandwiches and potato pies. Her sons help her in the evenings.

Since joining FINCA, she says she has been much happier because FINCA charges reasonable interest rates and educates her on how to manage her money. Before FINCA she had to pay very high interest rates.

Hilda needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy seats, tables, a cabinet, and carbonated water to sell along with her chicken in the evenings. Her dream is to expand and acquire a cart so that her sons can sell sandwiches in the street as well.

loans.use: buy seats, tables, a cabinet, and carbonated water to sell along with her chicken

loans.name: Tessy Katty

texts.es: La señora Tessy Katty, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción - Picota”,  Distrito de Picota, Provincia Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 22 años y 01 hija que aun dependen de ella.Tessy Katty, es una mujer que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas, por lo que decidió implementar su propio negocio  con el apoyo de su pareja., poco a poco fue ahorrando y juntando su propio capital y con el prestamo de Manuela Ramos implemento su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en un local alquilado, muy bien acondicionado y hoy ya tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad  y es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Tessy Katty, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarial.
texts.en:
Tessy Katty belongs to the Mujeres en Acción – Picota Community Bank, Picota district, Picota province, San Martín department. She is 22, in a common law marriage, and has one daughter who is still dependent upon her. Tessy Katty is a woman who feels capable of meeting her goals. Therefore, she decided to start her own business with help from her significant other. Little by little she was saving and gathering her own money. With the loan from Manuela Ramos she started her business of selling groceries. It is in a rented, well set up location. She now has a lot of experience in this type of work. She is well known and liked by her customers. She currently has loyal customers who come to her store to shop. They can find everything they need, and she personally waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, milk, boxes of different brands of canned fish, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene articles in order to keep giving her customers good attention. Tessy Katty now feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to get ahead and make her dreams a reality. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also for helping so many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries

loans.name: Eliezer Geovanni

texts.es:
El señor Eliezer G. trabaja vendiendo pescado en el municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde viaja largas distancias para comprar el producto y luego lo traslada vendiéndolo en unos grandes termos y ofreciéndolo a sus clientes que a diario le visitan para la compra de pescado.

Actualmente el señor Eliezer ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los pescados porque los requiere para almacenarlos en los termos y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes y es por esto que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliezer G. works selling fish in the El Viejo municipality of the city of Chinandega. He travels large distances to buy the product, and he transports and sells them in large Thermoses. He offers them to his customers who visit him daily to buy fish. Eliezer currently has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy fish. He needs them to store in the Thermoses and then offer to his customers. That is why he hopes that Ceprodel will give him a loan. This way he will continue to improve his business conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Vath

texts.en: Vath K. was born 1969 on her homeland located in Phnom Penh, where she established her own small family. Vath K. was married, but divorced her husband since her son was very young. To feed her family, she has built a small kiosk where she provides a tailoring service to her nearby neighbors who need her to sew their clothes. She sews both modern women clothe and men clothe and has been started in this sector for nine years. To help meet with the family’s living standard, her son works in construction. Vath K. currently lives with her older widowed mother who helps her in holding entire housework. The part of sewing material has been exhausted; Vath K. has asked for a loan to order more cloths to supply her good business.

loans.use: To order more cloths to supply her good business

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a 34-year-old father of two who runs a retail shop in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. He has been in this business for four years.  He hopes to grow into a wholesale supplier who will distribute products to retail traders in the area. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy more stock of sugar, rice, cooking fat, and other products. He describes himself as confident and determined.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock to his shop.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 30 años, es madre de D. hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de motocar, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo  edén” desde hace un año, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó para el mantenimiento de su motocar. En la actualidad, Gisela necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será utilizado en la compra de un motocar de segundo uso. La meta de Gisela es tener  un terreno propio para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gisela is an enterprising and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Yarinacocha in the Ucayali region. She is 30 years old and is the mother of two minor children. She rents motocars, (3-wheeled, light vehicles), in a business that she runs with her husband. She has been a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Eden" for a year. For her first loan she received 300 soles, which she used to maintain her motocar. Currently she needs a loan of 1200 soles, which will be used to buy a used motocar. Gisela's goal is to have her own land where she can build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a used motocar

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy P. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Mary Joy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Joy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely A., from the village of Tamucco Sto. Niño, Cagayan, is 42 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mely plants and harvests corn for sale. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a new loan, her second, of 33000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen A. is from the village of Baliwagan, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Belen is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Belen owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Belen is just starting this business.

In 2009, Belen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Belen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is fifty-seven years old. She is a widowed mother of eight children. Some of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Afua sells game meat, such as grass cutter (rodent meat that is a delicacy in Ghana). She procures the bush meat from hunters in her locality and in nearby communities. Afua supplies the meat to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for thirty years and wants a loan to expand her business. [Editor's Note: For more information about grass cutter meat in Ghana, see "Bushmeat boom benefits Ghana's farmers" in BBC News.]

loans.use: To buy game meat to sell

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Creciendo para el Futuro fue fundado en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este banco se reúne en un sector llamado Parque Forestal a las afueras de la ciudad está integrado por 20 socias entre ellas la señora Silvia Rodríguez hace dos  ciclos.
