Silvia está casada desde hace 13 años y es madre de tres  niños, su esposo trabaja en la construcción de viviendas y ella a mas de ser  ama de casa también se dedica a su pequeña tienda  donde vende  productos de primera necesidad, lácteos, carnes, y más, este negocio lo monto incentivada por su mamá quien le dio un lugar en su casa evitándole pagar arriendo ya son   dos años con su negocio y le va muy bien,  y con la  ayuda que le brinda la fundación ha podido seguir surtiendo de mercadería e ir incrementando un poquito más cada día, nos comenta que empezó con 300 dólares  y ahora la inversión es mayor. 

Con este nuevo préstamo nuestra socia  comprará  a los distribuidores arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, agua, harinas, etc. para abastecer su negocio y brindar más y mejores productos a sus clientes, su horario de atención es todos los días de 7 am a 8pm porlo que debe trasladarse de su casa a casa de su madre a pocas cuadras para atender su negocio.

El sueño de Silvia es algún día tener un restaurante pues a  ella le gusta preparar  alimentos, desea que su sueño se haga realidad por eso esta ahorrando para lograrlo.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Growing for the Future" is based in the city of Portoviejo. This bank meets in a sector called Forest Park on the outskirts of the city. It is composed of 20 associates, among them the lady Silvia R. for two loan cycles. Silvia has been married for 13 years and is the mother of three children. Her husband works in home construction and she has to be more than a housewife also. She is dedicated to their small store where she sells convenience products, milk, meats, and more. This business was started at the urging of her mom who gave them a place in her house for the store so they would not have to pay rent. Already they have had the business for two years and it goes very well. With the aid that the foundation offers, she has been able to continue supplying merchandise and to grow a little bit more each day. She tells us that she began with 300 dollars and now her investment is greater. With this new loan she will buy rice, sugar, oil, salt, water, flour, etc. wholesale to supply her business and to offer more and better products to her clients. Her schedule of service is every day from 7 am to 8pm, for which she leaves her home and goes to her mother's house a few blocks away to tend her business. The dream of Silvia is to some day have a restaurant, since she likes to prepare food. She would like this dream to become reality therefore she is saving to achieve it.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, salt, water, flour, etc for resale in her convenience store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia F. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old. Lydia is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Lydia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lak

texts.en:
Mrs. Lak S. (pictured here), age 30, and her husband, Mr. Phal Leng, age 37, have been married since 1994 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One about 15 km from Phnom Penh City. 

Lak has been selling sugarcane juice in her village for almost three years. Her husband has been a motorcycle repairer for almost three years. Lak wants to supplement her income with a new business raising pigs.  She will be able to earn extra income from selling pigs when they grow big enough.  

Hence, Lak is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise and to buy motorcycle spare parts for her husband’s motorcycle repair business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María L. se dedica a elaborar tortillas para luego venderlas en su establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua donde ofrece las deliciosas tortillas a las personas que visitan el mercado.

Ella está actualmente solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz, carbón y leña para realizar las tortillas y continuar ofreciéndolas en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Maria makes delicious tortillas to sell in her stall at the Mayoreo market in Managua. She is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients and supplies such as corn, charcoal, and firewood in order to continue making and selling tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Bbogo Women's Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
B. Henry, shown with a raised hand, is an enterprising 24-year-old divorced retail business owner in Nkumbwe landing site, Lugazi district. He has one child who unfortunately does not attend school.

Henry has been plying his business for the last two years and he mainly deals in sugar, maize flour and beans. Currently his business generates him profits to the tune of 100,000 Ugandan shillings, per month. His small scale retail business is his only source of income. Most of his customers are fishermen from the neighboring villages.

Henry says that, with this loan, he will be in a position to rejuvenate his business which has been plagued by losses due to the unpredictable change in customers’ preferences. He became involved in this business after he saw that no-one had a retail shop in his locality. He plans on educating his only child and buying more merchandise for his retail business after he gets this loan.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour, beans and so on and to educate his child

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Kumarhan

texts.en:
Kumarhan is 52 years old and lives with her three children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter, Amanjol, attends a university. Her two other children, aged 10 and 7, attend the local secondary and primary schools.  

Kumarhan operates a meat trading business in a rental space at a local market, called Ah Dam. She pays 6000 tugrugs (~ 4 USD) per month in rent. Kumarhan has been operating her business since 2004, and has built a loyal customer base. She sells prepared meat to local restaurants. Kumarhan sells an average of 20,000 tugrugs worth of meat per day. Her monthly profit is 150,000 tugrugs (~ 110 USD). Kumarhan has a great personality. She says, “My children are my happiness. I will take care of my children and will work hard to provide a better life for them. The most important thing is that I showed my children that even people who have a small amount of money can make a profit.” She is requesting a 200,000 tugrug (~  145 USD) loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Launh

texts.en:
Launh T. is a 33-year-old resident of Kompong Cham, a province of Cambodia. She and her husband have four children. All four of the children are students and also assist with their parents' business when they are free from studying. 

Launh T. earns a living by producing and selling clay stoves for profit. She and her husband always help each other produce their many sets of stoves to sell. She also receives orders from middlemen, who then need to wait one or two weeks for their order. Launh T. is taking out her first loan for assistance in order to start building a new house. 

Launh T. and her husband appear in the photo here.

loans.use: To start building a new house

loans.name: Wolimata

texts.fr: Wolimata D. est une femme de 66 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF-PALAL depuis le 08 aout 2006 et a 08 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers comme des halieutiques, des céréales locales, des fruits etc. son crédit lui permettra de continuer la réalisation de son projet. A partir de ses bénéfices elle a pu acheter du ciment et du sable et fait des briques en vue de construire une maison en dur et son objectif est la réalisation de cette maison tout en participant à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Wolimata D., 66, is married and the mother of six children who still depend on her. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BAYOUF-PALAL since August 8, 2006. She has received eight consecutive loans and has always reimbursed them without difficulty. She sells various items such as seafood, local cereals, fruit, etc., and her loan will allow her to continue to strive to achieve her goal. With her profit, she has been able to buy cement and sand and is making bricks so that she can construct a permanent house. Her goal is to build this house, while also participating in improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle T. is from the village of Bularan, Miputak. She is 49 years old. Anabelle is married, has one school-aged and one infant child. To make a living, Anabelle owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish and dried fish in the local community. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Anabelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house repair

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia M. is from the village of Tiaman Bonifacio. She is 52 years old, married, and has 1 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alecia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, biscuits, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and she also sells vegetables like eggplant, cabbage, cucumber, etc. in the local community. Alecia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alecia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. M. is married and operates a food business where she prepares banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) and fufu (starchy dumplings made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice that is eaten with soup or stew) for sale at Elmina. Her husband is an electrician and together they take care of their five dependents.

Ama’s loan is going to enable her bring more variety into the type of food she prepares. She will use the loan to buy foodstuffs and some new ingredients to prepare the kind of food her new costumers are demanding.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to plough the money back into her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and new ingredients

loans.name: Leonardo Enrique

texts.es:
Leonardo de 37 años, el tiene un pequeño comedor en la entrada de su casa y vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Leonardo comenzó a vender afuera de su casa cebiches (plato común en las playas, contiene camarones) y encebollados (contiene cebollas y pescado). Poco a poco comenzó hacer comidas típicas hasta que pudo comprar mas mesas y sillas, ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 14h30pm. 

Para poder agrandar mas su negocio el quiere comprar una cocina, y bebida para su negocio, en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa ya que una parte esta construida de caña.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 37 years old and he has a small restaurant set up in the front part of his house. He lives in Fortin de Guayaquil (a suburban region equipped with dirt roads among the hills). Loenardo started selling cebiches (a common dish usually found along the coastal areas containing shrimp) and prepared fish dishes. With time he started to make more popular dishes. Eventually he was able to purchase tables and chairs, so now he works at home from 8:30 in the morning until 2:30 in the afternoon. So that he may expand his business he would like to purchase a stove and soft drinks. In the future he hopes to build a better home, where he lives now a section of the house if made of bamboo sticks.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a stove and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yohny David

texts.es:
Yohny es un padre de familia de 22 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa, sus dos menores hijos y su madre, que es viuda, en el sector Hualtaco, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, en la zona se producen principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agicultura, específicamente a la ganadería, el cuenta con cinco cabezas de ganado vacuno que le producen leche de manera diaria, el vende este producto a sus vecinos y a un acopiador de la zona el cual la vende a su vez a una de las empresas procesadoras de lácteos mas grande del país. El alimenta a sus vacas con pastos naturales. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad  los utiliza en el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Yohny desea mejorar la producción de sus vacas adquiriendo alimento balanceado, como no cuenta con el capital suficente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles. Con esta inversion la producción de sus vacas aumentará y percibirá más ganancias.

Yohny es un joven bastante luchador y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocido y estimado.
texts.en:
Yohny is a father. He is 22 years old and lives with his wife, his 2 youngest children, and his mother who is widowed. They live in Hualtaco, a rural area in the Tambogrande district. In this area they produce fruits such as mango, passion fruit, and lemons, similar to the Piura province which is located in the same region, more than 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. The capital of this region is called Lambayeque. He works in agriculture, more specifically cattle-farming. He has five head of cattle who produce milk on a daily basis. He sells this product to his neighbors and a gatherer of the area, who in turn sells it to one of the largest diary processing companies in the country. He feeds his cows with natural grass. He uses the revenue from this activity to maintain the economy of his family. Yohny wants to improve the production of his cows in acquiring a balanced feed, but he does not have sufficient capital to do so. He has decided to apply for the first time for a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 700 new soles. With this investment the production of his cows will increase and he will receive greater earnings. Yohny is a young fighter and hard worker. His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman to provide his family a better quality of life. In the area where he lives he is well known and liked.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feeds and improve the feeding of diary cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon. After graduating from university he established a home business. He is working as an accountant, providing accounting reports to members of his community and some companies. He started this occupation in 2005. He is thankful for his home business; it allows him to help his father in the household. Today he is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new computer. With the new computer, he will be able to deliver his reports faster. In the future he plans to expand his business and to open an accounting office.

loans.use: To purchase a new computer

loans.name: Sialome

texts.en:
Sialome C. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Sialome is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Sialome owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Sialome has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sialome joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sialome has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sialome is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Sialome from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying Kamanyora cloth for tailoring into different clothing

loans.name: Maria Alberto

texts.pt:
Maria Alberto H. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 01 a 11 anos de idade os 2 mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez somente a 3ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da província de Maputo, tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.700.00mt por mês e com ajuda do marido que é pensionista do Ministério da Defesa conseguem poupar algum para eventuais despesas.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo no valor de 13.800.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para construir uma dependência que servira de aluguer para incrementar a sua receita. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 12.000.00mt todos para habitação.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para construir mais dependências como forma de aumentar a sua receita.
texts.en:
Maria Alberto H. was born in the Boane district of Maputo, in Southern Mozambique. She's married and the mother of four children ages 1 to 11 (the two older ones are in school). Her studies were interrupted in 3rd Grade due to her family's financial constraints. She lives with her husband and children in a house they own; she has never left Maputo.


Maria runs a small grocery store by herself, where she sells staples, and makes about 3.700.00mt per month. With the help of her husband, who receives a monthly pension as a retiree from the Defense Ministry, she is able to regularly save some money.


She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku; she has never had loans from other banks or institutions before. Her previous loans with Hluvuku were in the amount of 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt and 12.000.00mt, all used for the same purpose. She plans to use this current loan to buy construction material (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc) to build a rental unit to improve their earnings. She's confident in her ability to pay back this loan ahead of schedule and plans to apply for other loans in the future, to hopefully build more rental units.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, sand, stones, iron, etc)

loans.name: Floriana

texts.es: Floriana, de 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Filomeno de 43 años y su querido hijo Marco de 4 añitos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Floriana, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y hoja de coca, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es el lugar donde los vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. En  adelante, espera mejorar sus productos para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuota puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas, con lo cual espera asegurar sus futuras cosechas.
texts.en:
Floriana is 40 years old and is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her 43-year-old husband, Filomeno, and 4-year-old son, Marco, who are the reason for all of her efforts.

The crops that Floriana has been able to grow with a lot of effort and dedication have helped her a great deal in progressing in life. Every morning she begins to work on her lands because she knows that the care that she provides to her cacao, coffee, and coca leaf plants will determine the quality of the crops that she obtains. What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops and she feels very happy when she sees them large and plentiful. She has been in this type of work for three years and she considers the most difficult part to be bringing her crops to the city of San Francisco (located in the department of Ayacucho) where she sells them, because the sacks which she uses to bring the crops are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops so that she can sell them at a better price.

This is Floriana’s third loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make her loan payments on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very supportive and responsible member of her communal bank. With the 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy seeds, which she hopes will ensure her future harvests.

loans.use: To buy cacao and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Haydee Paquita

texts.es:
Haydee es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Caminos del Inca, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Cayaltí,  un distrito agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de leche de vaca desde hace más de siete años. Ella cuenta con ganado vacuno y diariamente extrae la leche que producen con sus vecinos y pobladores de la zona. El negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda para su familia.

Ella desea adquirir alimento para su ganado de modo que pueda mantener su producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Haydee es una mujer responsable y muy entregada a su familia, las personas de la zona que le conocen le consideran una vecina trabajadora y de confianza.
texts.en:
Haydee is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Caminos del Inca, a rural area in the Cayaltí district.  This is a rural area with regular commercial activity that is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has sold cow's milk for more than seven years.  She has a dairy cow and milks it every day so she can sell milk to her neighbors and other residents in her area.  This business is an important source of income for her family.

She would like to buy feed for her cow so that she can maintain its production, so she has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve her goal.  

Haydee is a responsible woman who is very dedicated to her family.  The people in her area who know her consider her a hard-working and trustworthy neighbor.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Yesenia

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 22 años de edad, vende hot dog y hamburguesas, vive con su familia tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, por el momento su hermana menor depende económicamente de ella al igual que su hijo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona de flujo de personas cerca de una zona recreativa, trabaja de 9:00am a 6:00 pm y lo viene haciendo desde hace 3 años, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San miguel.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de otro coche para colocar otro puesto de venta en otro sector, con este préstamo lograra instalarse en otro lugar a parte del que ya tiene así mejoraran sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Sueña con algún día instalar una casa donde pueda ofrecer los hot dog y las hamburguesas, mejorar la condición de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a 22 year old woman.  She sells hot dogs and hamburgers.  She lives with her family and has a one year old child.  Currently her son and her younger sister depend on her economically.

The business is located in an area with lots of foot traffic near a recreational zone.  She is open for business from 9am until 6pm and has been in business for three years.  She lives in San Miguel, San Miguel department.

She is asking for a loan to buy another hot dog cart to set up a second sales spot.  With this loan she will be able to set up in another place besides the one she now has so that her income to help her family will increase.

She dreams with one day having a house where she can sell the hot dogs and hamburgers and with improving her family’s condition.

loans.use: To buy a new hot dog cart.

loans.name: Bahit

texts.en: Bahit is 42 years old.  He is married and is blessed with three children.  He has been running an electronic workshop for the past ten years.  His business is located in Kibera slums, hence most of his customers are low-income earners.  He has managed to employ one person in his business.  He also owns rental houses, which earns him extra income.  He hopes to buy a piece of land in the future and build his own house.  He has requested a loan of  25,000 Kenyan shillings to connect power to his new workshop.

loans.use: To connect power to new workshop

loans.name: Clever Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Clever Cirilo; el tiene 66 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente del nivel primario y su esposa trabaja en artesanía y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere tener una tienda de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Clever Cirilo is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Clever Cirilo is 66 years old.  He lives with his partner and has 4 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his work as an elementary school teacher.  His wife works making handicrafts and together they get their children ahead in life.  Clever Cirilo would like to own a handicrafts store.  He is requesting this loan to maintain his home.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To maintain his home

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan.  Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. 
Shahnaz lives there with her family in the area of Mughalpura, in a 2-room brick house.  She is 34 years old and married with 5 children. Three of the children are studying, while the remaining two are very young and have not started to attend school. 

Her husband runs a barber shop in the market, where he offers hair-cutting and hair-dressing services to his clients. He specifically deals with male clients. He has been in this business for over 9 years and is well known in his area for his quality work and good behavior with his customers. 

Shahnaz is a hardworking lady and operates a business selling clothes.  She buys famous-named clothes, such as "Ichra" and "Shahalmi", from markets in Lahore, and sells to her neighbors in order to support her husband financially.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan he will purchase scissors, hair gels and shampoos, etc., in bulk, and expand his business.  Shahnaz is hopeful that this investment will prove to be a profitable one for her husband and will help him to improve his business condition. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.   Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Shahnaz”.

loans.use: To buy scissors, hair gels & shampoos for barber shop

loans.name: Benter Anyango

texts.en:
Benter Anyango is a single mother of two children, from Migori County, Western Kenya. They live in the busy Rongo Township in Migori and she is the sole breadwinner for her children.

Benter operates a pharmacy in Rongo town, selling all kinds of human drugs, and she has been running this business for the last four years with a lot of success. She makes a monthly income of Kshs 16,000 and she anticipates increasing this amount since she is taking out her third loan from KADET LTD to add to her stock of drugs which are frequently needed by her clientele. 

With additional stock she believes her sales will increase and her clientele will not have to walk long distances looking for drugs. Benter will use anticipated profits to repay her loan and thus maintain a good credit history. Her hope and dream is to one day open a hospital within her Migori county as a way of bringing services closer to her community.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of drugs

loans.name: Senorina

texts.es:
La señora Senorina V. P. tiene la edad de 68 años, no tuo estudios y esta casada con el señor Miguel  con el cual tiene diez hijos de los cuales seis son hombres y cuatro son mujeres, ellos ya estan casados y actualmente vive solo con su esposo en la comunidad de Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Senorina nos platica que hace algunos meses inicio a vender refrescos en su casa, ella tambien vende chiles rellenos los fines de semana (sabado y domingo) casa por casa en su comunidad con sus amigos y sus vecinos, ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que queria trabajar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que en estos tiempo todo es muy caro. 

Ella necesita este credito para invertiro en la compra de refrescos, chiles, carne, tomates, cebolla, huevos, aceite y col para preparar sus chiles rellenos y posteriormente venderlos.	

Ella nos dice que espera en un futuro Dios le siga prestando salud para seguir trabajando ya que es la unica forma de salir adelante, tambien nos dijo que se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por la confianza que le otorgo al brindarle este prestamo.
texts.en:
Senorina V. P. is 68 years old.  She didn't attend school and is married to Miguel with whom she has ten children: 6 sons and 4 daughters.  All her children are now married and she currently lives only with her husband.  They live in the community of Mata Naranjo which is thirty-five minutes from the town of Tierra Blanca, in the State of Veracruz.

Senorina tells us that some months ago she started selling soft drinks from her home.  She also sells 'chiles rellenos' (stuffed mild chili peppers) on weekends (Saturdays and Sundays), door to door in her community to her friends and neighbors.  She decided to start working in her own business since she wanted to work and help her husband with their household expenses since everything is very expensive these days.

Senorina needs this loan to invest in buying soft drinks, chili peppers, meat, tomatoes, onion, eggs, oil and cabbage to prepare her 'chiles rellenos' and then sell them.  She tells us that she hopes that God keeps her healthy so that she can continue working as this is the only way she has to get ahead in life.  She also tells us that she is very grateful to Fundación Realidad for the trust that they are placing in her by offering her this loan.

loans.use: To sell soft drinks and Mexican snacks

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Nelly; La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es casada,  y tiene 2 hijos (19,5 años de edad); la socia tiene una unidad vehicular, ella tiene un bus que presta el servicio de transporte público, la socia tiene la ruta de Aeropuerto hacia el cementerio el Almudena, el bus pertenece a la empresa El Dorado; la socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de piezas para el bus. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra piezas nuevas para el bus.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “ALLIN MUJU” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cuzco.  

The member is named Nelly. She is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children, 19 and 5 years old.  The member has a public transportation bus. She has the route that goes from airport to the Almudena cementery. The bus belongs to the El Dorado business. The members wants the loan to invest in the purchase of new parts for the bus.

Nelly is happy with the loan and committed to making the payments according to schedule.

loans.use: The member will invest the loan in buying new parts for her bus.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Don Jorge, tiene 55 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 24 y 28 años de edad, tienen casa propia y don Jorge se dedica a las labores de la ganadería y agricultura desde que tenía 13 años, pues su padre le enseñaba todo lo relacionado a la actividad para que fuera su apoyo. Esta enseñanza le ha servido mucho, pues es a través de este oficio que ha podido mantener a su familia y darles lo necesario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en insumos para la agricultura, abono y fertilizantes, otra parte la utilizara en el techo de su vivienda, la cual se encuentra deteriorado, este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir dos necesidades importantes, como lo es su trabajo y el hogar, para que este con su familia más seguros.
Su aspiración es crecer en la ganadería y trabajar fuerte por el bienestar de su familia, aumentando sus cosechas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 55, lives in Usulután Department with his wife and two children who are 24 and 28 years of age; they own their house.

Jorge has been a farmer and cattleman since he was 13 years old because his father would teach him everything related with this activity so that it would be his source of support.  This teaching has helped him quite a bit because through this occupation he’s managed to support his family and meet their needs.

He is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies: manure and fertilizer.  Another part of it will be used to repair his house’s roof which is deteriorated.  The loan will help him meet two important needs which are his work and his home so that his family will be more secure.

His wish is to grow as a cattleman and to work hard for his family’s wellbeing increasing crop yields and income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 35, is the mother of five children. She is married to a businessman from Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

She needs a loan to buy maize for resale. She dreams of building a permanent house for her family, educating her children and increasing her sources of income by starting other businesses despite challenges in price fluctuations.

She acquired her initial capital from growing maize that she sold off.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B. is 55 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She lives at Pob. Sapang Dalaga, where she has made a living for the last 10 years by selling snacks. She currently earns about 3,200 PHP a month.  

In 2006, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid nine previous loans and is applying for a new one, for PHP 20,000, to buy ingredients to make more snacks to sell to her customers.    

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en una cas propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, que se encuentra a mas de una hora de distancia del distrito de Chiclayo.   Es un  distrito que se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la  actividad agricola y ganadera.

José se dedica hace más de 10 años a las labores agricolas junto con sus hijos quienes le ayudan para que el trabajo sea menos pesado, en sus chacaras o tierras cultiva frejol que es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores.

José  a solicitado un préstamo  de 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lacompra de úrea paramejorar sus tierras y tenga una mejor cosecha de frejol, también para pagos de jornales de trabajadores que lo ayudan en el cultivo de frejol.

En Cayaltí José es conocido por el buen trato que da ha sus trabajadores que lo ayudan en las actividades agrícolas, es responsable y  trabajador.  Todas esas mejoras que tiene es solo para tener mejores ingresos econónicos y poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a 55 year old husband and father. He lives with his wife and children in their own home in the district of  Cayaltí, located an hour from the district of Chiclayo. It's a district characterized by the inhabitant's agricultural and ranching work.

José has spent more than 10 years doing farm work with his children, who help with the lighter work in his fields and bean fields, a healthy and delicious food for the residents' daily consumption.  

José has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa  to buy for urea to improve his land and have a better bean crop. He also needs to pay his laborers who help harvest the beans. 

In Cayaltí, José is known for treating his workers well, which has helped him in his farm work. He is responsible and hard working. All of of these inprovements are to have more income and be able to pay for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his crop land and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Ervin Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Ervin Santiago  de 35 años es propietario de un taller artesanal de calzado. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años cuando decidió independizarse este tipo de negocio se trabaja diario según comento diario realiza calzado y diario entrega el producto.
Él con el crédito comprará materia prima como  pega, cuero, cuerina, brasil, plantillas, suelas…etc.
texts.en:
Ervin Santiago, 35, owns an artisanal shoemaking shop.  He started this business 8 years ago when he decided to become independent.  This type of business requires daily work, he commented.  He makes and sells shoes daily.

He will use the loan to buy raw materials like: adhesive, leather, naugahyde, imitation leather, soles, etc.

loans.use: to buy shoemaking supplies.

loans.name: Erik Leonardo

texts.es:
Erik  es un joven de 24 años que fabrica cabinas de sonido, o bafles para equipos de sonido. En el taller de Erik sus clientes  pueden comprar las cajas con el sonido integrado o solamente la caja, porque algunas  veces el cliente  adiciona por su cuenta el sonido. Su negocio inició hace 8 años después de recibir su liquidación en un almacén de audio  donde trabajaba y decidió invertirla en su propio emprendimiento, teniendo en cuenta que  había aprendido este arte en un instituto de educación diversificada del estado, lo perfeccionó  mediante estudios técnicos en el servicio nacional de aprendizaje “Sena” y finalmente lo diversificó a través de un centro de sistema  especializado. En su negocio cuenta con dos empleados y  muchos clientes ubicados  en las ciudad de Barranquilla en el departamento del Atlántico, en Ocaña  en el departamento de Santander y en Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia,  además de contar con un mercado doméstico muy cercano en su propio municipio:  “Soledad” también ubicado en el departamento del Atlántico. 
Su sueño es tener un local que integre su taller de producción y un punto de venta, meta por la que  está dispuesto a esforzarse y  a trabajar persistentemente con tal de alcanzarlas,  pues es un hombre joven y casado que tiene un pequeño hijo de 4 años, al cual desea  forjarle un futuro prometedor, mientras él también crece como empresario de la microempresa. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales como tablex y  felpa en mayor volumen,  para elaborar bafles y poder dar curso oportunamente  al pedido que han hecho sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es el costo de producción de sus productos, que hace que tengan un precio costoso, pero también reconoce que estos artículos tienen clientes 
muy selectos, que son los que justamente se acercas a su taller  para comprarle, y con ello Erik obtiene sus utilidades para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Erik is a young man of 24 years who makes speaker cabinets or speakers for sound equipment. At Erik’s workshop his customers can buy the boxes with the speaker drivers included or only the box, because sometimes the customers add the speaker drivers on their own. He started his business eight years ago after being laid off at an audio store where he was working and deciding to invest his severance pay in his own enterprise, keeping in mind that he had learned this trade at a diversified high school of the state. He perfected his skills through a technical education with the “Sena” national learning service and finally diversified by means of a specialized systems center. He has two employees in his business and quite a few customers located in the city of Barranquilla in the Atlantic Department, Ocaña in the Santander Department and Medellín in the Antioquia Department, in additional to a local market quite near his own city of Soledad, also located in the Atlantic Department. 

His dream is to have a business location that integrates his production workshop with a point of sales. He is willing to work hard and persistently to meet his goals, since he is a young man and married, with a young, four-year-old son for whom he wishes to forge a promising future, while he himself grows as the owner of a microenterprise. This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy materials in large volume such as particle board and plush cloth for making speakers and fulfilling the orders of his customers in a timely way. His major challenge is the production cost of his products, which makes them expensive, but he also acknowledges that these items have very select buyers, who are precisely those who come to his workshop to buy from him, and by whom Erik makes his profits with which to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as particle board and plush cloth in large volume.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 36 años de edad,  el es casado, vive en casa de la madre con una hija que ya es dependiente. Hipólito vive en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Mórrope,  cuenta con servicios de agua, el lugar donde vive  es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Hipólito se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales,  dicha labor la realiza desde hace 12 años, el cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando su ganado se encuentra con el tamaño y peso ideal lo comercializa en el mercado local, teniendo experiencia otorgada por la madre con la cual inicio este negocio.

Hipólito está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para poder pagar la mano de obra para la construcción de su domicilio. 

Hipólito tiene la seguridad de que su negocio cuenta con un mercado amplio de comercialización, lo que garantiza el éxito, el es una persona perseverante y responsable, las personas que lo conocen lo describen como alguien amable y generoso.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 36 years old, married, and lives in his mother's house with a dependent daughter.  Hipólito lives in a marginal urban area in the Mórrope district that has running water.  The place that he lives is a small community of about 100 families.

Hipólito works raising and selling animals.  He has done this work for 12 years.  He has appropriate and spacious animal pens that are located in the back part of his house.  When his livestock reaches the idea size and weight, he sells it at the local market.  His mother started the business and taught him about it.

Hipólito is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to pay for labor for the construction of his home.

Hipólito is confident that his business has a large market for sales, which guarantees success.  He is a responsible and persevering person.  The people who know him describe him as kind and generous.

loans.use: to pay for labor to construct his home.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 48, a grocery seller, and her husband, a carpenter, earn a combined income of $14 per day. They have three children, all of them studying in school. Every month, Nary has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses.

Because all of her children are studying now and she hopes to send them to university, Nary needs to earn more income to support them and the other family expenses. She is therefore requesting a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell and hopes to ultimately expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has two children and was born in Quillabamba. Judith has her own tailoring business which is located in her home. She studied the art of tailoring for three years in a private institution called, "Arco Iris." She has had her business in her home for one year. 

With the $600 loan Judith plans to purchase fabric, thread, and other materials that she needs for her business. Her dream is to expand her tailoring shop and to concentrate on making dresses and other clothes. Judith is a very ambitious woman and is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Lanie has a food shop that sells homemade ice cream in different flavors. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream.

Lanie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream.

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gioconda soltera, madre sus hijos están estudiando, sus metas es que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente. Mujer trabajadora, emprendedora tiene su propio negocio venta de cosméticos y variedad. Su vivienda muy humilde se le ha presentado dificultades como los efectos del invierno provocando inundaciones.
 El negocio lo inicio con fondo propios y para el mejoramiento económico de su estado de vida. Con el préstamo comprar mercadería como: pinturas labiales, de mano, sombra, vanidad, cremas, perfume, desodorantes entre otros productos.  Para cumplir con los pedidos y ofrecerle mayores variedades. Permitiendo obtener utilidades.
texts.en:
Gioconda is a single mother with school-age children. Her goals include helping her children to prepare themselves so that they can become professionals. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has her own business selling cosmetics and a variety of other products. Her modest home has presented her with difficulties, such as the after-effects caused by the winter flooding.

Gioconda started her business with her own funds so that she could improve her financial status in life. With this loan she will buy merchandise such as lipsticks, hand lotions, eye shadows, compacts, crèmes, perfumes, deodorants, and other products so that she can complete her orders and offer more variety. This will allow her to generate a profit.

loans.use: to purchase lipsticks, hand lotions, eye shadows, compacts, crèmes, perfumes, deodorants, and other products.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 28 years of age and is married. She is engaged in a retailing business in her village. She sells spices, breads, milk, diapers and cooking oil. She just started her business last year and is happy that her business still operates and is able to gain PHP 3,000 per month.

Lourdes believes that she can increase her profits if she can add more products to sell in her village.  She  is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy beauty products like perfumes, lotions and face powder to sell to her customers.  She will earn 25% of the capital she invests. She will use the profit to create a better way of living for her family.

loans.use: buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
María Elba tiene 32 años de edad es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 12,11,10,8,7,5 y 3 años de edad  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.
se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos,urea, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprar un solar y hacer una casa para poder vivir con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y viajar.
texts.en:
Maria Elba is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 7 children, aged 12, 11, 10, 8, 7, 5, and 3 in Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

The members of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Progressing Towards the Future) Communal Bank are located in the “Jesus de Gran Poder” (Jesus of Great Power) settlement in Ventanas canton. They are dedicated to short-cycle agricultural activities, sowing corn and rice. They buy their products in Comercial Marlin and sell their crops in the same location in Ventanas.

Maria Elba is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, urea, liquids, and fertilizers for her crops. The loan will help her economically to supply necessities and confront challenges such as plant plagues and illnesses. 

Maria Elba's dream is to be able to buy a lot and build a house where she and her family can live. In her free time she likes to go for walks and travel.

loans.use: buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is 43 and married, with two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Minh City.

For the past seven years, Minh and his wife have owned a general store in front of their house where they sell instant foods, beverages, and personal-use products.

Minh would like a loan to buy a greater quantity and quality of products to sell to his customers. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers.

He hopes that he will increase his income and help improve his family's living conditions through the loan.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Kazia

texts.en:
Kazia is 30 years old, a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has been in this business for three years.

Kazia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beans for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans for sale.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien was born in 1965. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune, D. Anh district. She has three children who are going to school. Her husband has been in the army for many years. He earns a monthly income. He usually stays with the army, but sometimes he comes home to visit his family. Because her husband is often away, Mrs. Lien has to care for her children alone. She grows rice and operates a general store out of her home where she sells groceries. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and has repaid loans punctually. She is the leader of a 5-member group loan from SEDA. At this time she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy tables and chairs to expand her general store.

About other borrowers in her group:
Cam is 42 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Xuan is 57 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy chicken feed.
Hiep is 46 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Nu is 31 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her general store.

loans.name: Malaa B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Malaa B Group in Western Kenya! Joshua is the facilitator of the Malaa B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  

Joshua takes care of seven children at home, together with his wife.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joshua had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 23 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joshua was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joshua and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joshua will educate his children and repay his loan with the same.

In 2012, the members of Malaa B Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Joshua is pictured in the photograph together with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 27 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has two children, aged 8 and 11; they are currently in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She has less customers so she is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to become a big business owner in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en:
Tham, 41, is married and earns a living to support her family by running a general store. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tham has been running a general store from her home for three years. Tham would now like to take out a loan to expand her business. With the loan, she intends to repair her home and store and buy products in bulk, such as food and basic goods to sell from her store. She hopes that this will improve the living conditions of her family and generate more income from her business. She also hopes that this will enable her to save money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to repair her home and store and buy foods and basic goods in bulk to sell from her store.

loans.name: Nui

texts.en:
Nui is 40 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has two children who are going to school.

She makes rice cakes to sell.  She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). The last time she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the third time she borrowed money from SEDA. In this loan she would like to borrow 9,630,000 VND to buy rice to make rice cakes.

loans.use: to buy rice to make rice cakes

loans.name: Rosa Jahayra

texts.es:
Rosa Jahayra tiene 21 años de edad evive en unión libre tiene 1 hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao hace 2 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan.

Solicita el crédito para  seguir trabajando en la agricultura comprar abonos agrícolas. Con el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar las semillas sin ningún tipo de problema por el dinero.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema El sueño  es tener un terreno.

En los tiempos libres le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Rosa Jahayra is 21 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. She lives with her husband and two-year-old son in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Rosa is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Rosa is a farmer who has been growing cacao for two years. She buys and sells in San Juan. Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can continue farming. She plans to buy compost. The loan will be a great help because the money will enable her to buy seeds without any problems. At the moment, she is not facing any challenges. Her dream is to have a plot of land.

In her free time, Rosa enjoys performing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana  de 40 años de edad casada, trabaja como estilista en su propio salon de belleza desde hace más de 20 años.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de comprar productos para su negocio (tintes, pinturas, otros), pues se acerca la epoca de promociones y navidad y sus clientas demandan mas atencion y trabajos y asi puede ofertar a sus clientes diferentes cosas para que sus clientas esten satisfechas con el trabajo que ella hace en su negocio.
texts.en: Ana is 40 years old, married, and has worked as a stylist in her own beauty salon for more than 20 years. She is asking for her 3rd loan with the intention of buying products for her business (tints, dyes, etc.) since she's approaching sale season and Christmas. Her clients are asking for more care and services. Also she can offer her clients different things so that they may be satisfied with the work she does in her business.

loans.use: to buy business supplies (tints, dyes, etc.)

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: El joven Oscar a sus 19 años de edad es un excelente trabajador e hijo, puesto que es el principal apoyo de su madre en el taller de confecciones en el cual trabaja y donde realiza labores de confección que su madre le enseño. Con el ánimo de mejorar el proceso productivo y calidad de las prendas elaboradas en el taller, se requiere de la compra de una máquina recubridora con la cual se pueda cumplir estos objetivos. El sueño del señor Oscar es continuar trabajando en el taller de su madre e iniciar estudios universitarios que pueda aplicar en el taller.
texts.en: The young man Oscar, age 19, is an excellent worker and son.  He is the principal support of his mother in the sewing shop in which he works and carries out the sewing work which his mother taught him.  The goals of improving the production process and the quality of dresses made in the shop require the purchase of a reconditioned sewing machine with which he can fulfill these objectives.  Señor Oscar’s dream is to continue working in his mother’s shop and begin university studies that can be applied to the business.

loans.use: to purchase a reconditioned sewing machine.

loans.name: Ledmy Esther

texts.es:
Ledmy es una joven de 21 años de edad muy trabajadora y optimista, ha trabajado desde pequeña porque sus padres no tenían muchos medios económicos y con su trabajo los apoyaba para los gastos de la casa, ella a pesar de lo difícil de su infancia, Ledmy vive en una choza, pero eso no la amilana para salir adelante y con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria.
 
Ella ha trabajado de todo y con los ingresos que obtenia, poco a poco pudo juntar el dinero suficiente y con ello inicion su negocio de venta de ropa, Ledmy camina por las calles de su barrio vendiendo sus productos , los cuales tienen mucha acogida por sus clientes, ya que ella es muy atenta con ellos y sobre todo porque es honrada y honesta, lleva trabajando en este negocio desde hace ya 1 año y medio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque desde muy temprano sale a las calles para ofrecer sus productos y ese esfuerzo tiene su recompensa, como dice el dicho “ Al que madruga Dios lo ayuda”.

Ledmy está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá mejorar su vivienda ya que ella desea colocar un kiosco para ofrecer sus productos y no mucho a las calles y con esta mejora ella tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y mas seguridad para ella asi como tambien mejores ingresos y poder cumplir su mas grande sueño: "Tener una vivienda optima para vivir"
texts.en:
Ledmy, 21, is a very hardworking, optimistic young woman.  She’s worked since childhood because her parents did not have many economic resources and she helped cover household expenses with her work.  Despite the difficulties in her childhood, Ledmy lives in a hut but this does not discourage her from continuing forward and with much effort she works selling clothes in an itinerant manner.

She has worked at everything and with the income she earned she gradually saved up enough money to start a business selling clothes.  Ledmy travels along the streets in her neighborhood selling her wares which are well received by her customers because she’s very attentive to them and, above all, because she’s very honest and trustworthy.  She’s been working in this business for a year and a half and she believes that she does well because she heads out to the streets very early to offer her products and this effort has its reward; like the saying states: “God helps she who gets up early.”

Ledmy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she’ll be able to finish building her dwelling and and be able to improve her home and install a kiosk and not spend so much time on the streets. This improvement will mean a better quality of life and more security for her since she’ll have a dwelling in good condition.  For her, her greatest dream is: “To have an optimum dwelling to live in.”

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino tiene 36 años, es un hombre trabajador y se esmera por sobresalir adelante, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Nery de 31 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes desea ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Paulino es el cultivo de café, pues posee 03 hectareas de propiedad, siendo el lugar exacto donde siembra sus productos, convirtiéndose así en uno de los principales productores de la zona porque trabaja sus cultivos de manera tecnificada. Sus productos más rentables son la piña y el cacao, por tener mayor demanda en el mercado nacional. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar y lo hace con mucha perseverancia, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los puntos de venta situados en la ciudad de San Francisco. Ahora lo que prioriza es dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos como sacar la maleza, fumigar y fertilizarlos, por necesita contratar jornaleros. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, esta llano a aportar sus cuotas puntualmente como lo venía haciendo en sus anteriores créditos, en su banco comunal es un socio participe y  puntual en toda las reuniones acordadas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mantener sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Paulino is 36 years old. He is a hard working man and tries to get ahead. He lives in his own house with his wife Nery, who is 31, and their four dear children, to whom he would like to offer a better quality of life. The activity in which Paulino makes a living is in coffee crops, as he has three hectares of land where he plants his products. He has become one of the main producers in the area due to his technologized method of cropping. His most profitable products are pineapple and cocoa, as there is a greater demand for these in the national market. 

What he likes the most about his job is harvesting his crops and he does this diligently. He has worked for the last 15 years in this activity and he believes that the most difficult part is transporting his products from his ranch to the outlets in the city of San Francisco. 

At the moment his priority is to care for his crops by weeding, fumigating and fertilizing, for which he needs to hire labourers. This will be his first loan with MFP. He is committed to paying his quotas punctually as he has done in other loans. In his communal bank he participates and is punctual to all of his arranged meetings. With the 1,500 PEN he will buy manure and fertilizers to care for his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Juanitah

texts.en: Juanitah is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as busy because many people do business in that place. To earn extra income she runs a grocery store. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standard and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair chemicals

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa, tiene 40 años de edad, no pudo completar de forma completa sus estudios de modo que no termino su primaria. Con el tiempo ella conoció a su hoy en día esposo con quien procreó 2 hijos uno en sexto grado y el mayo quien solo curso la primaria quienes apoyan a su padre a realizar limpieza, aplicación de abonos y demás insumos agrícolas para proteger sus cultivos de café. El terreno que ella cultiva lo adquirió por medio de su padre quien le dio una parte y otra con mucho esfuerzo donde siembra además de café, granos básicos (maíz y frijol). Una vez recolectado el grano ella le vende a una persona de su comunidad quien compra, procesa y a su vez revende el producto a bodegas que se dedican exclusivamente a la compra-venta de café ubicadas en la ciudad y en ocasiones lo hace ella directamente cuando tiene la posibilidad de ahorrarse el traslado del grano hasta la ciudad. Ella solicita crédito el cual invertirá en abonar y foliar sus cultivos de café para hacer de su propiedad más productora y pagar mano de obra para darle un buen mantenimiento a la misma teniendo como resultado una mejor producción en esta nueva temporada y un mayor cuidado sobre sus cultivos. Sus metas hacer de esta producción más exitosa que la anterior, incrementar los ingresos económicos y apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios. Como sueño fortalecer el patrimonio a sus hijos y dar a cada uno de ellos una tierra digna y bendecida para trabajar.

loans.use: para compra de insumos agricolas y pago de mano de obra para asistir sus cultivos de café

loans.name: Scholastica's Group

texts.en:
Scholastica, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Chwele District. She is 55 years old, is married and has 10 children.

Scholastica likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2015 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Scholastica plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Scholastica’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Amento

texts.en:
Mr. H. Amento is a very dynamic man. A married father with four (4) children, he manages a mill he set up himself thanks to a $450 credit that was subsequently reimbursed. This initiative allowed him, with the assistance of his wife, a salesperson, to feed his children and provide them with an education.

Now, in Mr. H. Amentos' community, there is a great need for a spice mill and he would like to provide it to his people. However, he does not have the money needed for this new project. He is asking for an $850 loan to build this new mill. The loan will help Mr. H. to take better care of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Amento est un homme très dynamique. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il gère un moulin qu’il a installé lui-même grâce à un crédit de $450 qu’il a obtenu et remboursé sans incident. Cette activité lui permet, avec le concours de sa femme, revendeuse, de nourrir les enfants et d’assurer leur scolarité. Aujourd’hui, un grand besoin de moulin à condiments se fait sentir dans la localité et Monsieur H. Amento se propose d’en mettre un à la disposition des populations. Mais il n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour ce nouveau projet. Il sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $850 pour l’acquisition d’un moulin à condiments. Comme impact, ce crédit permettra à Monsieur H. de mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.

loans.use: to acquire a spice mill

loans.name: Maulid

texts.en:
Maulid lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children of which two are in primary school other two are in secondary school. Maulid sells fresh fish in retail. He has to wake up very early in the morning everyday, go to the shores of Indian Ocean and buy fish from fishermen. He resell these fish in Tandika market.

Maulid want to improve his business by having enough working capital to purchase a large amount of fish. The profit margin for fish selling is small but he can improve it by having enough stock of fish. Since fish business is perishable Maulid is planning to buy some equipments which together with ice blocks can help keep the fish fresh until evening. Ice blocks are bought from Ice suppliers. Maulid is in need of USD 550 to make his plan work.

loans.use: Equipment to improve fish selling business

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.en:
My name is Ruth M. and I sell ice lollies and jelly. I have been doing this for a year and my sales are excellent as there are a lot of kids in the area who buy them a lot. I want to buy more ingredients so I can make more and therefore sell more. I would use the earnings to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ruth M. me dedico a la venta de paletas y gelatinas, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mi ventas son excelentes ya que en nuestra comunidad viven muchos niños y estos son los mayores compradores, deseo tener mas inventario para tener una mayor produccion y asi vender mucho mas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy gelatine, milk, fruit, sugar, lolly sticks, cups, colouring and flavouring/compra de gelatina, leche, frutas, azucar, paletas de madera, vasos, colorantes y saborisantes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica T. is an orphan who is married and has five children. As an orphan she said it was never easy. But having seen other orphans in positions of responsibility and leadership Veronica states that she then decided to make it in this cruel world. Her constant motivation has been the challenge of providing education, food and medication to her kids, especially as her husband earns very little from his job.

With a loan of $100, she intends to provide her community with beauty products. She intends to buy some hair products and cosmetics that she will sell and use the profit to educate her children and provide basic needs for them. She also plans to increase her business and train apprentices. She plans to repay her loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Veronica would like to purchase hair products and cosmetics for her hair salon.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
For three years Nadir has been running his own orchard, and this business gives him the opportuniy to support himself. He is 27 years old, lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region and is single.
He needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides to improve his orchard and enjoy a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo O. is a 45 year old married mother of 4. She is from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, provision, food and has machine for grinding of tomatoes for her customers. She has been in this business since 1987. She is requesting for a loan of $625 to buy more drinks, provisions, food for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provisions, foodstuffs

loans.name: Avazbicko

texts.en: Avazbicko S. lives in Mastchokh; she is divorced and has 4 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. She describes herself as a serious and strongly motivated client. Loan sums have been permanently increased, which shows business stability and income increase. Avazbicko S. is a very experienced business person, who has a wide variety of business, including women's wear and shoes. She is partially engaged in another business: livestock.
