She trades in the bazaar, and thanks to her business capacities, she has clients who want to buy only her goods. Now Mrs. S. requires a loan for 4100 STJ, to increase her existing turnover and to purchase new merchancise, popular and in demand among the population today.

loans.use: To renew the existing assortment.

loans.name: Kasokoso Group

texts.en:
Hildah is a 38 year old widow with five children. Hildah, Aisha and Annet all have brick laying businesses. Hildah wants to pay school fees for the orphans with the extra business profits.Mollaw sells raw foodstuffs in the market and wants to use the loan to purchase more foods for sale. Margret sells used shoes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their businesses

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Rhoda K.. She is married with four children, who are between the ages of 12 and 24 years old. In 2007, Rhoda established a clothing business. Rhoda has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now seeks another loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Rhoda is a perfect example of why micro-finance works and why the vast majority of people in her position repay their loans. A lot of people who hear about micro-finance (or kiva.org) for the first time wonder “how do you make sure people pay back their loans?" and "won't the borrowers just take the money?” Such questions wrongfully imply that the individuals who access micro-credit (usually the "poor") are less trustworthy, efficient, or educated than other people. Regardless, most MFIs have due diligence procedures in place to assess client risk, as well as measures (e.g., collateral arrangements and group lending, where a loan in default is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk. More importantly, there is an incentive that is built into each and every micro-loan: the borrowers are incentivized to repay their loans so that they can receive additional loans as their businesses continue to grow.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Bahodurova

texts.ru:
R. Bahodurova who is 29 years old, is married and is a mother of two sons. She has a college education. After marriage she began selling women's clothing because all of the responsibilities of a family caretaker were on her shoulders after her husband went to Russian Federation to find work. She was studying in a university with hopes of getting a good education and finding a decent job in her field. But the circumstances were not in her favor of realizing her dream. She has been applying for a loan at MicroInvest since 2005 with a $100 in assets. In the future she plans to expand and increase the assortment of goods to include children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Баходурова Рано – 29 лет. Замужем, мать двоих сынов. Образование высшее. После замужества начала заниматься продажей женскими одеждами потому как все заботы о семье легли на ее плечи после поездки мужа в РФ на заработки. Она училась в Вузе с надеждой получить хорошее образование и найти достойную работу в своей сфере. Но обстоятельства не позволили ей осуществить свою мечту. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест с 2005-го года с активами на 100 долларов. А в будущем планирует расширится и добавить в свой ассортимент детскую одежду.

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Melania Patricia

texts.es:
When she began her business, Melania Patricia had on old pedal sewing machine. With time and due to demand, she purchased a modern machine. She works with families and especially with her husband, who sells her products in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando inicio el negocio tenia una maquina de pedal viejita con el tiempo debido a la demanda compro una maquina moderna, trabaja con sus familias y en especial su esposo que es quien comercializa en otras ciudades.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as fabric, thread, lacework and other supplies

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi A. is professional photographer. He is married and has 3 dependants. Mr. A. covers a wide area for his work, and would like to have a motorbike to help him make his rounds.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy a motorbike to carry out his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use in his business

loans.name: Nangendo Agnes, Kamu Kamu Group

texts.en:
Agnes N. is a member of the Kamu kamu women’s group in Lugazi. She is 35 years old and married with 6 children.

She has been selling new clothes as a hawker for 3 years, and she has been a member of her group for 2 years. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by purchasing new clothes, which will in turn enable her to continue to pay for her children's school fees. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and to then construct her own house.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony S. and her husband, Voeun Krouch, live in a small village on the Mekong River about 10 miles north of Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital city. Married for 24 years, they have one son and four duaghters. Two of their children are married themselves; one son is a construction worker; and the youngest two daughters are in school.

For the past 16 years, Sony has helped support her family by weaving silk into cloth, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in her village, who then resells it in Phnom Penh's markets. Meanwhile, Voeun is a mason.

To help grow her weaving business, Sony is requesting a loan of $300 U.S. dollars to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To buy silk for a weaving business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and lives with her husband in the town of Pavlograd in central Ukraine. After Ludmila had resigned from her last job she couldn't find a new job in her field for a while. Her family was facing a tough financial situation at the time, so she decided to take a risk and start her own small business. Today Ludmila runs a small kiosk selling shoes and clothing in the local market. Currently, she has 4 vending facilities in the same marketplace and about $16,000 invested in inventory.

Ludmila is a determined entrepreneur. She has been in business for about 20 years. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Ludmila recognizes that financial assistance from "Nadiya Ukraine" has provided significant support for her business and has promoted its stable growth. Ludmila is requesting a loan for 5000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital, which will allow her to re-supply her inventory and increase her sales. Eventually, Ludmila Anna is hoping to rent a bigger vending facility and open her own little shoe store. She believes that financial assistance in combination with her zeal, perseverance and diligent work will someday help her dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal footwear and clothing

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada y tiene 1 hija de 19 años, su esposo es albañil, es por eso que ella inicio su negocio para apoyarlo con los gastos familiares ya que sus ingresos eran variables, comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo ropa entre sus vecinos y poco a poco logro incrementar sus clientes obteniendo buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses comprar mercancía y así tener variedad para la temporada otoño que esta por empezar. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Francisca is married and has a 19-year-old daughter. Her husband is a bricklayer. Since his income was not steady, she started her business to help out with family expenses. Two years ago she began selling clothing to her neighbors and little by little she was able to increase her customers and make a good profit. She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 month, to buy merchandise and to have variety for the fall season which is about to start. With your help she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil, is a 43 year-old father of four children. Khalil lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in the South of Lebanon where he works as a mechanic. He is a well-known expert in his business, and people from all the surrounding villages come to his garage to repair their cars. Over the years, Khalil has learned that it is far less expensive to buy spare parts in bulk by their wholesale unit price, rather than individually. He has therefore requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to purchase the wholesale spare parts which will help him increase his small business's profitability. This is the second time that Khalil will be working with Al Majmoua. His first loan was repaid successfully and on-schedule.

loans.use: Khalil would like to purchase a supply of wholesale car parts for Khalil's auto repair shop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice K. is an executive member of Ntinda Kafene Women's Group.  She manages a retail shop in her town's trading center that sells sugar, soap, maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, and many other household staples.  Beatrice's shop is know for always being open, as well as being very clean, organized, and tidy.  Therefore, she has many loyal customers.  In order to restock her shop and increase the variety of products she offers, however, Beatrice is requesting a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To restock supplies and diversify products offered.

loans.name: Erick Enmanuel

texts.es: El joven Erick Manuel tiene la edad de 29 años habita en la Concepción, junto a su mamá y hermanos este joven es muy trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura y a la vez trabaja en una empresa para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar a su mamá y hermanos .E l papá del joven le ayuda en la finca para que el vaya a trabajar. Los sueños de este joven es llegar a establecer una manzana más de piña. Ya que el se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda nuestra financiera. El solicita este préstamo para comprar insumos agrícola, como abono, veneno y otros para los cultivos y así tener una buena cosecha del cultivo de piña, y ofertar a sus clientes la buena calidad y la captación de mas clientes.
texts.en:
Erick Manuel is 29 years old and lives in the Concepcion with his mom and brothers. He is very hard working, works in a farm and at company to help his mom and brothers. His father helps him on the farm, so he can go to work. Erick would like to create another block of pineapple. He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies, like fertilizers among others. He wants to have a good harvest of pineapple and offer his clients good quality products and increase his clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will purchase garlic and hot peppers

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 28 años de edad, por mucho estuvo viviendo con su pareja, pero hace 6 años se casaron, viven en una casa alquilada. Desde que se casó es la encargada de preparar los almuerzos para los que laboran en la chacra, se levanta eso de las 6.00am para preparar el desayuno, luego alimenta a los animales que cría, tanto cuyes, como conejos, y ahora último acaba de comprar tres cerditos de los que tiene que estar muy al pendiente de su alimentación. A eso de las 8.00am preparar el menú para llevar el almuerzo para su esposo que esta preparando la chacra para la siembra de arvejas, una vez que les sirvió regresa recogiendo pasto para sus cuyes y conejos. Pero cuando es la temporada de cosecha si permanece en la chacra para coger las arvejas y a la vez supervisar a los peones. Mientras que su esposo se dedica a los trabajos más duros y pesados como cargar los sacos una vez que ya están cosechadas. Delfina viene trabajando 4 préstamos consecutivos con MFP y siempre pagó todas sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. La cantidad solicitada es para la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arvejas, lo que calcula costará 820 soles y con el resto del dinero comprará abonos para la chacra de papa que sembraron hace un mes.
texts.en:
Delfina is 28 years old, and has lived with her partner for many years. They married six years ago, and live in a rented house. Since they married, she is in charge of preparing meals for those who work on the farm. She gets up at 6.00am to make breakfast, then feeds the animals that she raises, including guinea pigs and rabbits. She has recently bought three little pigs, and has to be very attentive to their feeding. At 8.00am she makes the lunch meal to take out to her husband, who is preparing the fields for sowing peas. Once she has delivered the meal she returns home with grass for the guinea pigs and rabbits. During the harvest season she stays out in the fields to pick the peas and supervise the labourers. Her husband undertakes the hard and heavy work such as filling the sacks with the harvest. Delfina has worked with MFP on four consecutive loans and has always made her repayments on the designated dates. This loan will be used to buy two bags of pea seeds which will cost 820 soles, and with the rest of the money she will buy fertilizer for the potato field that was sown one month ago.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios de secundaría completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, se dedica al engorde de ganado menor (ovinos y porcinos); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir ganado (ovinos) para venderlos como carne. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas ganado (ovejas cara negra) y engordarlos para venderlos en forma de carne en las ferias y mercados de Ilave, su anhelo es dedicarse también al engorde ganado mayor y ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the community bank 21 de Febrero, in Ilave district, Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married, has four children, and has completed her high school education. Maritza has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years, and she’s in the business of raising small livestock (sheep and pigs). With her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy and raise more livestock (sheep) to sell for meat. With a new loan of 600 soles, which she plans to repay in three monthly installments, Maritza will be able to buy more blackface sheep to raise and sell for meat at the fairs and markets in Ilave. Maritza plans to become very skilled at raising livestock; she wants to set a professional example for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and raise more livestock (blackface sheep), which can be sold for meat at fairs and markets in Ilave.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader, S., 39, is a mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. She is a widowed mother. She works in the massage center providing massage service. She has been in this service for more than two years. She gets good recognition from her manager very often because she works very hard. She is a manageable mother and a responsible neighbor.

She uses an old motorbike as her family's transportation but it is broken very often. S. is taking out a loan to buy a new motorbike for her work and for her family's transportation.

The other group members are: S., 24, who works in a hotel and is taking out a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for his wife's store; S., 30, who also works in the hotel, is applying for a loan to repair her motorbike for her transportation; and N., 23, who serves as a public cleaner and is taking out a loan to buy more cooking materials for selling Khmer noodles after her work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Divino Rostro Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Divino Rostro, está integrado por las señoras Martha S., quien vende comida en su casa, ofrece platos de menú corriente en los almuerzos y cenas que ofrece a sus clientes, Doña Sandra Vanesa Sequeira, vende cosméticos y joyería de plata, doña Juana Mercedes que tiene una pulpería en su casa y doña María Auxiliadora R. que vende rosquillas de manera ambulante en los diferentes departamentos del país. Estas señoras son originarias de la ciudad de Diriomo, siendo mujeres muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y responsables, ejemplo de esto tenemos a la señora Juana Mercedes B. quien con mucho esfuerzo ha sabido mantener su pequeña pulpería, ella es una mujer de 56 años con muchas esperanzas de salir adelante, se siente con muchas energías de emprender más en su negocio. Ella vive con su esposo, no tiene a ningún hijo a cargo, trabaja para mantenerse, su esposo le ayuda a hacer compras y además colabora con los gastos de la casa.
Doña Juana expresa que ella se siente muy orgullosa de trabajar con Adim porque ha tenido la oportunidad de compartir capacitaciones donde está aprendiendo a manejar el negocio, poco antes de trabajar con el crédito ella pensaba cerrar el negocio y en Adim ha aprendido que el negocio puede seguir compitiendo con otros establecimientos, esto le ha dado un reto en la vida.
El grupo espera siempre ser un grupo puntual, esto les ha dado mucha satisfacción y oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
The members of the Divino Rostro group are Martha S. who sells food from her house, providing a running menu for lunch and dinner; Sandra Vanesa Sequeira who sells cosmetics and silver jewelry; Juana Mercedes who owns a general store in a space at her house; and Maria Auxiliadora R. who travels the country selling "rosquillas" (a local pastry). These women are natives of the city of Diriomo. They're hard-working, entrepeneurial and responsible. As an example of this, we have Juana Mercedes Bermudez who, with much effort, has learned to operate a small general store. She is a woman of 56 with a lot of experience at getting ahead and energy to spare for improving her business even more. She lives with her husband. She works to keep herself but her husband helps with sales and shares the household expenses. Juana says that she is very proud to work with Adim because it's given her the chance to attend seminars and learn to manage her business. Before starting to work with the bank, she thought about closing the business but Adim has taught her that businesses sometimes have to compete with other businesses and that it's nothing more than another of life's challenges. The group always expects its members to repay their loans on time, something that has given them a lot of satisfaction along with the chance to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.en:
H. Truong (632981252) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 2 infant children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities.

In 1998, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the 10th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: For baby livestock

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Худойкулов Абубакр житель города Яван. Имеет собственный участок земли , который использует для того под посев пшеницы и других злаковых культур. Кроме того он сажает овощи. В днный момент земля засеена пшеницей. Поэтому он обратлся к нам за кредитом , для того, чтобы купить удобрения и обработать пшеницу. Своевременная обработка даст возможность получить хороший урожай. Урожай он сможет быстро реализовать и получить доход.Абубакр жнат и имеет троих детей.
texts.en:
Abubakr K. lives in the town of Yavan. He has his own plot of land which he uses for sowing of wheat and other cereals. He also plants vegetables. At this time the land is sown with wheat. He has come to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for wheat. Timely fertilization will help him collect a good harvest. And then he can quickly sell the harvest and make a profit. Abubakr is married and has three children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fertilizer for wheat

loans.name: Armando Javier

texts.es:
A sus 41 años de edad, en la ciudad de Masaya, el señor Armando Z. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de hamacas típicas dedicándose a esto desde hace 7 años habiendo alcanzado una gran experiencia en este trabajo.

Actualmente, el señor Armando requiere de la compra de los materiales de trabajo para elaborar las hamacas ya que son comercializadas tanto a personas nacionales como a extranjeros. Es por este motivo que él ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos materiales de trabajo con el fin de continuar elaborando estas bellísimas hamacas típicas Nicaragüenses para todas las personas.
texts.en:
At 41 years of age, in the city of Masaya, Armando Z. makes typical hammocks. He has been doing this for seven years, and he has achieved a high level of experience in this work. Currently, Armand needs to buy work materials to make his hammocks, which are commercialized as much to Nicaraguans as to foreigners. For this reason he has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. He will use the loan to buy work materials to continue making this beautiful, typical, Nicaraguan hammocks for everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work materials

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Y. Nguyễn Thị (1044061361) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Y. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Y. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 5th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es: Foto De izquierda a derecha: Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Consuelo del Carmen P. González e Idayda Carolina P.
texts.en: In the photo from left to right: Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Consuelo del Carmen P. González, and  Idayda Carolina P.

loans.use: Pruchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.en:
Junie L. is a 23-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her family in a slum in Puerta Plata. She is originally from Haiti, but moved to the Dominican Republic with her husband in search of a better life. The Dominican Republic boasts a much higher standard of living and per capita GDP (gross domestic product) than Haiti. Even so, there is a great deal of racism toward Haitians, who tend to find themselves working at menial jobs if they are lucky enough to find work at all. Junie has been struggling to adapt to the new culture and language in Puerta Plata.

Junie and her husband live with their children, Ricardo and John Pierre, who are 8 and 5 years old. The children attend a local school where they study hard to make good grades. Junie ultimately hopes to enroll her children into a university, but her income is not currently sufficient to harbor such a dream. She makes 2,000 DRP a month (about 57 USD), but thinks she will be able to significantly increase her earnings through Esperanza.

Junie plans to use her loan to start a small restaurant in her home. She says that she will cook rice, beans, chicken, and beef, which are some of the staples of the Dominican diet. She will buy the raw materials from a local food vendor in her neighborhood. Ultimately, Junie would like to open a fully-fledged restaurant in a busier section of Puerta Plata. That goal is a long way off, but the determination in Junie’s eyes suggests it is a definite possibility. Your contribution will help Junie make the first step to turn her aspirations into reality.

loans.use: To purchase food and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Astromelia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Astromelia es socia del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte, un grupo de 21 mujeres que residen en el pueblo de Rocafuerte, aproximadamente media hora de la ciudad de Portoviejo. La ciudad es muy conocida por los dulces que vende. El grupo Rocafuerte es muy unido, y las señoras se llevan muy bien entre ellas. El día de nuestra entrevista con Sra. Astromelia era el cumpleaños de una de las socias, por eso sirvieron unos bocaditos y cada socia aportó un poco de dinero para regalarla. 

Sra. Astromelia tiene 44 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y 2 son menores (de 15 y 16 años). 3 de ellos viven con ella todavía. Ella y su esposo tienen un estudio de fotografía, llamado “Estudio Arely’s” por su hija, Arely. Su esposo también trabaja como profesor, entonces ella atiende el negocio durante la semana mientras él está en clases. Su hija también les ayuda con el negocio. Iniciaron el negocio porque el sueldo de su marido no les alcanzaba para pagar sus necesidades básicas, y a ella no le gustaba mucho al inicio, pero ahora sí le gusta, aunque dice que siempre llega muy cansada a la casa al fin del día. Trabajan todo tipo de eventos, como por ejemplo matrimonios y cumpleaños, normalmente 1-2 por semana, y trabajan tanto con cámaras digitales como de rollos. 

La señora está pidiendo un crédito a la Fundación ESPOIR para invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio, como por ejemplo papel, químicos, álbumes y una cámara. Dice que su sueño para el futuro es jubilarse para poder descansar, también está pensando en poner algun negocio en la misma casa para no tener que salir más de la casa para trabajar. 

Ella ha sido socia de su banco comunal para años ya, es socia fundadora y el banquito en sí es bastante antiguo, el grupo ya tiene 32 ciclos trabajando juntos. “Me ayudan bastante,” dice de los préstamos. Solamente una vez hace 4 años tuvo un problema para pagar su crédito, aparte de eso ha sido muy puntual.
texts.en:
Mrs. Astromelio is a member of the Rocafuerte Community Bank and is in a group of 21 women who live in the town of Rocafuerte, which is approximately half an hour from the city of Portoviejo. The city is very well-known for the sweets that it sells. The group Rocafuerte is very united, and the women get along very well. The day of the interview with Mrs. Astromelia was the birthday of one of the members, so they served snacks and every member contributed some money to give a gift. Mrs. Astromelia is 44 years old, is married, and has 4 children, of whom 2 are adults and 2 are younger (15 and 16 years old). Three of her children still live with her. She and her husband have a photography studio, called “Arely’s Studio,” after their daughter Arely. Her husband also works as a teacher, so she takes care of the business during the week while he is in classes. Her daughter also helps them with the business. They started the business because her husband’s salary isn’t enough for them to meet their basic needs. At first, she didn’t like the business very much, but now she enjoys it, even though she says that she is very tired when she comes home at the end of the day. They work at all kinds of events, like weddings and birthdays. They normally work once or twice a week, and they work with both digital cameras and cameras with film. She is asking for a loan from Fundación ESPOIR to invest in the purchase of materials for her business, like paper, chemicals, albums and a camera. She says that her dream for the future is to retire so that she can rest. She is also thinking about having some business in her own house so that she doesn’t have to leave home to work. She has been a member of the community bank for years. She is a founding member, and the bank is very experienced. The group has already worked together for 32 cycles. She says that the loans help her a lot. Only once, four years ago, she had a problem of repaying her loan, and apart from this, she has been very punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper, chemicals, albums and a camera for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La Sra. Mary F. tiene 32 años y esta casada con el Sr. Rubén Darío Martinez que tiene 30 años, el mismo se desempeña como oficial de policía en la ciudad de Caacupé, a 50 km. De la capital del país. Tienen una hija de ocho años que actualmente esta cursando sus estudios primarios.
La Sra. Mary F. habilito la despensa cuyo nombre es Vanina Jazmín en el año 2007. Dicha decisión la tomo considerando que se mudo a un barrio nuevo donde había pocos negocios habilitados por lo que prácticamente no tendría competencia en la zona. 
El préstamo que solicita desea invertir en la compra de mercaderías en forma mayorista como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos de distintos tipos, yerba, harina, productos enlatados y otros. De esa manera tendría un menor costo por las mercaderías y obtendría mayor utilidad por la venta de las mismas.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías en forma mayorista como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos de distintos tipos, yerba, harina, productos enlatados y otros.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. is a fish vendor and has been in her business for the past twenty-five years. She and her fisherman husband, Delfin, are partners not only in life but also in business.

Growing a business without access to credit was hard for Cecilia since both she and her husband have no other business for a source of income. This became worse when her two children had to go to college.

Wanting to sustain the education of her children in college, Cecilia had to make her business profitable by growing it. Thus, she decided to join ASHI to be able to have access to additional capital.

From then on, Cecilia’s business started to grow until the time has come when Cecilia now has to request a larger amount of capital. She has to increase the volume of the various fish she buys and sells in her fish stall in the municipality’s public market.

Someday, Cecilia wishes that, out of the profit her business makes, she will be able to purchase a vehicle to be used in her business for selling and buying a larger volume of fish in far off places.

Cecilia is so happy for having loans for her business because her profits have enabled her to send her two children to college. Her eldest is a commerce graduate while the second child is a college undergraduate. Whatever life they will be having in the future, Cecilia will be very happy to turn over her business to her children someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Luz Amelia

texts.es:
Luz Amalia tiene dos negocios, hacen movilidad escolar, su esposo maneja una de las combis,  en diferentes horarios llevan 30 niños al colegio en Nueva Esperanza, también tienen una  bodega donde vende gas, en este negocio las ventas han bajado bastante.  
Necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles, para compra de 4 llantas para sus carros y realizar algunos arreglos de la combi.
El sueño de Luz es tener una flota de autos.
texts.en:
Luz Amalia has two businesses, one of which is taking children to school. Her husband drives one of their small vans and takes 30 kids to school in Nueva Esperanza at different times during the day. They also have a small shop where they sell soda. Sales in this business have dropped significantly. She needs a loan of 2800 soles to buy 4 tires for their vehicles and to make a few repairs on the van. Luz dreams of having lots of cars.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 4 tires for their vehicles

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is popular as “Vangie” in their community. She is one of the inhabitants in Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 26 years old and finished only high school studies. Due to financial constraints, she is not able to pursue her college studies. She works as a maid and helps her parents to earn a living until she got married to Alexander B. and they are blessed with five children. For the sake of their daily living and future of their children, both of them work hard to earn income.
	As a way of gaining income, her husband works in a rice mill located at Boret, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya while Vangie engaged in fish, fruits and vegetable vending. She started it with a small capital, but being an industrious mother, she can able to earn a net income of Php 600.00 per week which they used to budget for their daily needs and for the education of their children. Since their children are in the highest stage of education, they need to earn more income to support their studies. In this regard, Evangeline joined the Microfinance Institution and applied for a loan amount of P 5,000.00 to be able to increase her capital for the improvement of her business. She hopes that with her patience and sacrifices, she can able to improve her small business and their children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: additional capital in selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica en las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, él sale todas las mañanas para observar sus tierras y estar pendiente del crecimiento de sus cultivos. Sus principales productos agrícolas son la papa, el olluco, la cebada y el trigo, pero los más rentables, en su caso, son la cebada y el trigo porque tiene mejores precios en el mercado. Adicionalmente, Gregorio cría vacas, ovejas y cerdos, en un lugar que preparó en su propio terreno, los cuales vende cada tres meses, luego de que han alcanzado el peso adecuado. 
Su deseo a futuro, como el de todo agricultor, es incrementar su producción e incrementar sus animales.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP a su nombre, pues anteriormente era su esposa la titular de los créditos, siendo ambos muy reconocidos en su banco comunal por su responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un torete para incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 43 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children in his own home. For the past 20 years he has worked in farming and ranching. He goes out each morning to check on his fields and to watch his crops grow. His main crops are potatoes, olluco (a small, potato-like tuber), barley and wheat, but the most profitable are barley and wheat because they have better prices on the market. In addition, Gregorio raises cows, sheep and pigs in a place that he fixed up on his land. He sells them every three months once they reach the right weight. His hope for the future, like all farmers, is to increase production and have more animals. This is the first time he has asked for a loan from MFP in his own name. Before, his wife was the borrower but both are known in their community bank for being responsible. The loan he requests will be used to buy a bull in order to increase the number of animals he has.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Rad

texts.en: Rad S., 33, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in a business of selling fish at the market, earning collectively an income of US $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. They help each other in the business to ensure that their new and existing customers are satisfied with their services. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. S. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a kind of Cambodian food (Pror Huk) made from fish to stock and resell at retail for a higher price.

loans.use: To buy supplies of fish  (Pror Huk) for resale

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is happily married to Dace Jane, who is also his business partner. They run a computer shop in their village of Arellano, beside the University of Saint Louis Tuguegarao City. Most of their customers are teachers and students. They have been engaged in this business for almost five years.

Since technology is becoming more advanced, Romeo is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 from Kiva lenders to buy the necessary materials for them to upgrade their computers. This loan will enable the business to grow and become more stable for the future of their children. Romeo is hoping that his request will be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital to upgrade their computers

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut E. is a 48-year-old cultivator, a married mother of three young children. Sut E. was not available for a photograph so her husband is pictured instead. Sut E. is married to Sgoun Vinh, age 47, who is a construction worker. Sut E. hopes to make extra income by using her loan to order rice to resell at a profit.

loans.use: To order rice to resell

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mr. Sun V., 20, is a single man and resides in Phnom Penh city. Presently, he works as internal staff in the marketing department for a private school and earns a salary of $150 each month. Sun V. dreams of having a new enterprise but he does not have the capital to start it. Recently, he borrowed a loan of from Kiva through HKL to be used to operate a phone sale business.

loans.use: To operate a phone sale business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is thirty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Sara sells beans and groundnuts. She buys bags of beans and groundnuts from nearby communities and sells them to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for thirteen years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: El grupo Nuevo Horizonte se caracteriza por ser muy unido, y por tener negocios en la misma zona central D. la localidad, una parte del grupo vive en alquiler, algunos en casa prestada pueD. ser D. suegros o padres, algunos en casa propia. El grupo está compuesto por 10 socios D. los cuales 3 son varones y 7 son mujeres, la mitad D. las socias se dedican al negocio D. la venta D. alimentos tipo snack, el resto se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y comercio D. computadora. Marisel Shirley que es la presidenta del grupo es una promotora  mayorista D. tarjetas D. teléfono desD. hace 10 años, Julia atienD. en su snack desD. hace 15 años, AyD. tiene su frial y también una tienda D. artículos en general esto desD. hace 10 años, Leoncia	se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes con una antigüedad en el rubro D. 20 años, Amanda	es comerciante	desD. hace 6 años, Marcia Olivia es comerciante D. calzados desD. hace 3 años atrás, Maria angelica se dedica al comercio D. ropa y tiene una experiencia D. 20 años en este rubro, Ross Aurelio venD. 	equipos informáticos con una experiencia D. 6 años, Freddy atienD. su pensión donD. ofrece almuerzos y otros platos esto desD. hace 23 años, Nestor Hector tiene una vidriería que atienD. hace 15 años. Como se pueD. ver el grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en sus respectivos grupos. La competencia como en todo negocio a nivel nacional está presente pero lo bueno es que tienen sus temporadas y este grupo va a invertir para tener ingresos en las fiestas carnavaleras. El crédito es utilizado para la compra D. mas mercadería para surtir un puesto D. ingreso como por ejemplo un snack, una proveedora D. alimentos que tiene puesto en el mercado y los comerciantes D. computadoras para la compra D. accesorios que luego comercializa, el que hace trabajos D. vidrios comprara marcos y vidrios para la venta y para sus trabajos que mensualmente tiene. Las personas negociantes que solicitan créditos en agrocapital esperan ver mejorar sus negocios con la ayuda del crédito que se les otorga, esperan ver mejorar a sus hijos en la educación y mejorar su forma D. vida, aumentar y ampliar sus negocios. Estas personas componentes del grupo son personas con experiencia en créditos y están muy acostumbrados a trabajar con créditos ya que saben utilizarlo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Nuevo Horizonte" (New Horizon) is very close and the members have businesses in the same central area of their town. Some of the group lives in rented homes, others in houses loaned to them by in-laws or parents, and others own their own homes. The group is maD. up of 10 members, of whom 3 are men and 7 are women. Half of the members sell snack food, the rest sell groceries and have a computer business. Marisel Shirley, the president of the group, has been a wholesaler of telephone cards for the past 10 years. Julia has had a snack business for 15 years. AyD. has a snack shop and has also had a general store for 10 years. Leoncia has been selling groceries for about 20 years. Amanda has had a business for 6 years. Marcia Olivia has sold shoes for 3 years. Maria Angelica sells clothing and has been in this business for 20 years. Ross Aurelio has been selling computer equipment for 6 years. Freddy has had a small restaurant where he offers lunches and other meals for 23 years. Nestor Hector has been making glass for 15 years. As you can see, in general the group has a great deal of experience in their respective areas. As with all businesses in the country, there is competition, but the good thing is that each group has its season. This group is going to invest in order to make money during the Carnival parties. The loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to stock a business such as a snack stand, or for a person who makes meals to have a stand in the market. The people with computer businesses will purchase accessories that they will sell, the glass maker will purchase frames and glass for sale and for his monthly jobs. The business people who request loans from Agrocapital hope to improve their businesses with the help of the loan. They hope to improve their children's education, improve their quality of life, and to grow and expand their businesses. The members of this group are experienced with loans and are very accustomed to working with loans as they already know how to use them in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Soan

texts.en: Soan C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 19 years old. Soan is single. To make a living, Soan operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling processed food like pork tocino, longganiza and chorizo in the local community. Soan has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Soan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Soan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Soan from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Idermunh

texts.en:
Idermunh is 29 years old and lives with his parents and two younger siblings in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His father works at a government tax office, and his mother works as a accountant for an electric power center. They have been living in their current home for 19 years. They repaired their car this year with money from these jobs. 

Idermunh has been operating a taxi service since 2008. After running his business for almost three years, he has a number of consistent customers. Idermunh's customers usually call him by phone when they need his services, an arrangement convenient for the customers. His average daily revenue is approximately 15,000 tugrugs (~ 10 USD). Previously, he had a Korean “Excel” car, but he was able to acquire the higher quality Toyota Chaser for his taxi service. 

Furthermore, since 2008 Idermunh has been growing potatoes in Jargalan soum of Tov province as well. He is a decent and very hardworking person. He says, “I would like to work hard in order to expand the business and to purchase my own place to live separately from the family. ” He is requesting a 3,600,000 tugrug loan to purchase large amount of seed  potato to plant in the upcoming spring.

loans.use: To purchase large amount of potato seeds to plant

loans.name: Eirá  Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Eirá Mercedes S. Aguilera, es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de jugos, agua y choco-litas. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en Mercado Israel lewite entrada principal de la COTRAN 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de leche, agua helada y gaseosa.

Es casada, con dos hijos a su cargo, este se encuentra en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 8 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 3 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Eirá is an enterprising woman and the owner of a business that sells juices, water, and chocolate milk. She started with capital of 10,000 NIO which she borrowed ten years ago. Her business is located in the Israel Iewite market, in the principal entrance to COTRAN. She is asking for this loan in order to provide working capital to invest in milk, water, and soft drinks. She is married and has school-aged two children. She says that she used to work as a domestic before starting this business. Eirá has had eight previous loans through CEPRODEL, within the past three years, which she has invested into her business. She's been able to grow the business by diversifying her merchandise to be able to compete in the marketplace. All of this thanks to the financing through CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana, de 21 años, es una joven muy alegre y con muchas ganas de sobre salir en la vida. Vive con su esposo en la casa de su madre y lo que más desea es tener un futuro mejor.

Desde muy joven sintió que tenía que trabajar en todo lo que pudiera, fue así que a la edad de 17 años se dedicó a vender comida rápida. Con esas ganancias pudo juntar el dinero que necesitaba para comprar 2 vacas, las cuales junto a los corderos que su madre le regaló, han logrado que poco a poco salga adelante con la venta de ganado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, ya que les tiene mucho cariño, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar su ganado hasta la feria de la ciudad. Con el tiempo, espera incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene, ya que siente que es hora de crecer.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Maximiliana con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a posteriores préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyaran y la guiaran, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un par de corderos para alimentarlos y cuidarlos, y posteriormente venderlos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 21 years old. She is a very joyful young woman who really wants to get ahead in life. She lives with her husband in her mother's house and what she wants the most is to have a better future. Since the time she was very young, she felt that she had to work as much as she could. That is why, when she was 17 years old, she began to sell fast food. With those earnings she was able to get the money together that she needed to buy 2 cows. Together with the lambs that her mother gave her, she has been able to get ahead little by little by selling cattle. What she likes the most about her job is feeding her animals, since she has a lot of affection for them. She has been doing this for 7 years and thinks that the hardest part is transporting her cattle to the city market. With time, she hopes to increase the number of animals that she has, since she thinks that it is time to grow. This is the fifth loan that Maximiliana has had with MFP. She want to make her payments on time since she wants to access loans afterwards in order to improve her business. She knows that her communal bank will support her and guide her, since she is a well liked member. With the thousand nuevos soles she has requested, she will buy a couple of lambs to feed and take care of and later sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animals

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 52 años, madre D. cuatro 4 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia. DesD. hace 18 años venD. golosinas, en donD. su público objetivo son los niños, escolares la gran mayoría, puesto que venD. cerca D. una escuela. Aprovechando los horarios D. recreo y D. salida, no se da abasto para atender varios niños, es por ello que recibe la ayuda D. sus hijos, además la apoyan cuando necesite comprar alguna mercadería y necesita transportarla hasta su casa.  Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que lo productos que venD. tiene mucha demanda. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar sus ventas, así como su carreta D. golosinas para poder abastecerse D. más mercadería. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. pertenecer a su grupo comunal, ya que valoran mucho la amistad, además asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor D. golosinas, como: cajas D. galletas D. diferentes sabores, caramelos, chupetines, refrescos, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Luz is 52 years old, the mother of 4 children, and together, they live in her own house. For around 18 years she has sold treats and her customers are children, the great majority students, since she sells near a school. She benefits from the students' recreational and departure times but is unable to buy merchandise to serve all the various children and has to rely on assistance from her own children for both merchandise and transportation to and from her home. The business is very profitable due to high demand for the products. Her major hope is to increase sales, and to supply her cart of treats with more merchandise. This is her 11th loan with MFP. She is very content to belong to her communal group, since she places high value on friendship, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. The loan she solicits will be used for buying wholesale treats, such as packages of cookies of different flavors, caramels, and lollipops, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TREATS TO SELL

loans.name: Ijilsekhbayar

texts.en: Ijilsekhbayar is 41, widowed, and has a 12-year-old daughter, Bolor-Erdene, who attends a local secondary school. They live in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2008, Ijilsekhbayar, started selling bricks to local construction companies. From the beginning, the business has been doing well, with business capital increasing from 500,000 MNT (~357 USD) to 2.3 million MNT (~1,660 USD). Ijilsekhbayar dreams of owning a larger brick factory that can meet the needs of larger construction companies. She also hopes her daughter will achieve a high level of education. Ijilsekhbayar is now requesting a loan to buy construction materials for her brick baking.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Ma. Jesovie

texts.en:
Ma. Jesovie F., 39 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married to Raymundo. To earn a living, Ma. Jesovie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ma. Jesovie has been engaged in her business for over three years now.

In 2008, Ma. Jesovie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Jesovie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ma. Jesovie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Three people make up this group loan, located in Ha Bour village in Prey Veng province. Mrs. Ly S. is the group leader, selected by the other members, each of whom will use their pieces of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Ly S. is 40 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Choun Soy, have a small child. They are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land on which they grow rice to support their family. In addition, her husbandworks as a laborer. Although they try to maximizetheir business, they believe they can earn more of an income. For this reason, to improve the standard of living of her family, Mrs. Ly S. is requesting a loan to buy piglets and pig feed in order to start a new business. The rest of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Mrs. Seun N. is a married woman with three children, one of whom is a laborer in Thailand, while the others are attending local public school. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Khen, is a fisherman who can earn some money from selling fish and frogs to support his family. This family lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Seun N. is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family. Now she has a problem because her field should be planted but she does not have enough money to support it. So to improve production, Mrs. Seun N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, gasoline, and rent a plow to plow her field. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, gasoline, and rent a plow to plow her field

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mrs. Vutha C. (pictured above) was married in 1991 and she has three children:  two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village a long National Road Number Two, about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vutha has been selling fruit (banana and jackfruit) since 1994. She buys them from her fellow villagers and transports them to sell in Takhmao market located in Phnom Penh. In addition, she also sells Cambodian cakes in her village. From 12 pm after lunch, Vutha prepares and makes the cakes by herself and sells them through the afternoon.

Vutha does not have enough capital to use for her cake selling business, so she is asking for a loan of $100 to finance her capital.

loans.use: To use as additional capital.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel de 27 años de edad  es casado, labora en la alcaldía municipal de Nueva Guinea como supervisor de proyecto,  ademas cuenta con ingresos adicionales que le permiten mayor estabilidad economica. 

Abel esta solicitando su 2do credito  para realizar compra de material de construcción y poder construir un dormitorio que le brindara mayor comodidad a su familia. Expresa sentirse muy satisfecho con el servicio recibido, pues con el credito anterior logro comprar su computadora, la que le sirve como instrumento de trabajo en su jornada diaria. 

Se ha caracterizado por ser un excelente cliente, responsable, honesto, de buen liderazgo, su familia es de buenos principios religiosos y morales.
texts.en:
Abel is 27 years old, married, and works for the City of Nueva Guinea as a project supervisor. He also has additional income that allows him to have greater financial stability.

Abel is requesting his second loan so that he can buy construction materials to build a bedroom that will provide greater comfort for his family. He is very happy with the service he has received. With his previous loan he was able to purchase a computer that he uses every day for work.

Abel is known for being an excellent client. He is responsible, honest, demonstrates good leadership, and comes from a family with outstanding religious principles and morals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build an additional bedroom

loans.name: Agape Women Group

texts.en:
Kolu B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Agape Women. Kolu is 41 years old and is married with four children who range from 5 to 15 years old. She also cares for two siblings. Kolu was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For six years, Kolu has been selling bread in Congo Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,400 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,800 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of flour. She describes herself as a hard-working person.

Kolu’s goal is to expand her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour

loans.name: Carpo

texts.en:
Carpo T. is from the town of Talibon. He is 45 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Carpo owns and operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income is primarily from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members.

Carpo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Carpo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Carpo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to expand his business. This will be Carpo's seventh loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his family.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth for his business

loans.name: Juvylyn

texts.en: Juvylyn A. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 30 years old. Juvylyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juvylyn raises pigs for breeding. Juvylyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Juvylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Juvylyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Juvylyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khusravjon

texts.en:
Since he was a boy, Khusravjon has loved animals. He has learned to raise them well so that he can market them. Khusravjon is not married and lives with his large family. As the oldest brother, he has to work hard to support his family. He needs to invest in his livestock and sheep breeding business and, consequently, he's asked IMON International for a loan that will allow him to purchase young cattle and the feed for them. Khusravjon is sincerely grateful for your support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Tajikistan has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Today Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture, and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and manufacturing, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have the opportunity to develop viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kisoga United Group-Kayunga

texts.en: N. Christine belongs to Kisoga United Group-Kayunga. Her involvement in business began years back when she tried her hand at a poultry business that sadly is not operational any more. She used the experience and money she got out of running that business to venture into agro produce sales. She also has a commercial motorcycle business that she says is invaluable as regards the addition onto her overall profits. 160,000 shillings is what she makes in a month. With this loan, she wants to buy more agro produce for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more agro produce for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con seis hijos y sin estudios.
Rosa   se dedica  a la crianza, compra y venta de animales menores, además de esto, también realiza el engorde de ganados como, toros y chanchos. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, con un préstamo inicial de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, el cual  le permitió iniciar con la actividad que realiza. Agradece a la institución por haberle dado la facilidad del préstamo para poder levantarse y seguir adelante no solo  en lo económico sino también en lo moral a través de las charlas.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir adelante  con  su negocio y tener una granja de cuyes. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank "22 de Septiembre" [September 22nd] located in the Llave district, province of El Collao and department of Puno. She is 50 years of age, in a committed relationship, with six children and uneducated. 

Rosa earns a living raising, buying and selling small animals. In addition to this she fattens livestock such as bulls and pigs. She has been working with the Manuela Rosa Movement for five years with an initial loan of 300 nuevos soles which allowed her to start up her business. She appreciates the institution for granting her the loan so that she may rise up and continue on, not just economically but also morally by means of the talks. 

Now she will seek a new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, money which will allow her to expand her business capital. Her dream is to continue on in her business and have a guinea pig farm. Her favorite part of the Communal Bank are the talks.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey G. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old and is married. Rey owns & operates a transportation business. He has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rey joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle to offer better service. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle to offer better service

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es: Ruth María N.  vive en el barrio Los Almendros del municipio de Soledad,  donde vende productos naturales y mercancía variada;  es muy usual encontrar en su negocio  vitaminas, Omega 3 entre otros productos  como fantasías, cosméticos, aunque también vende calzado y ropa interior y para niños. Ella inició este negocio puerta a puerta  en el año 2004 entusiasmada por su cónyuge,  que se dedica a la litografía y  haciendo trabajos a los laboratorios conoció los que hoy son los  proveedores de Ruth María y a los que  inició comprándole  $200.000 COP,   en productos naturales como los ya mencionados;    gradualmente  Ruth ha ido adicionando otros artículos, como ropa, fantasías, cosméticos y casi todo lo que sus clientes necesitan para su vida diaria, porque ha  aprovechado efectivamente  la gran clientela que se desprendió de su negocio inicial de venta de productos naturales. Sus principales clientes, son los habitantes del barrio y muchos referidos de estos en  otras comunidades; Ruth María es una muy buena empresaria que les acredita  a sus clientes  solo lo que ellos pueden pagar  y en los plazos acordados, por eso recupera su cartera semanalmente y algunos en cada quincena. Ella compra de contado y adquiere frecuentemente descuentos, porque sus proveedores la conocen muy bien y a su vez sabe como negociar sus compras. Su margen de contribución es del 40%   con respecto a los productos naturales,  recupera esta  inversión con la primera cuota, pero regularmente las  divide en 4   plazos de pago de acuerdo a cada cliente y también hace algunas excepciones con un pequeño número de sus compradores ofreciéndoles plazos especiales un poco más largos,  pero no muy usuales.  Relacionado con la mercancía que distribuye su margen de contribución  es de 45% y los planea con sus clientes en 2 cuotas. Su sueño ahora es tener un punto de ventas en un sitio estratégico, pero sabe que se requiere un capital inicial importante y por eso está trabajando fuertemente para lograrlo. Con su Credikiva que es su primer financiamiento comprará productos naturales que tiene encargados por sus clientes y también jeans, calzado, ropa interior y especialmente vestidos para niños, teniendo en cuenta que en las fiestas los padres de familia vestirán a sus pequeños con nueva ropa y estos a su vez lucirán los vestidos de Ruth María con mucha alegría y distinción.
texts.en:
Ruth María N. lives in Soledad’s Los Almendros neighborhood where she sells natural products and assorted merchandise.  It is quite usual to find vitamins and Omega 3 among other products like costume jewelry, and cosmetics in her store.  She also sells footwear, underwear and children’s clothes.

She started the business around 2004 encouraged by her spouse to do so.  He is a lithographer and while doing jobs for laboratories he got to know the people who today are Ruth Maria’s suppliers and from whom he originally bought $200,000COP worth of natural products like the ones already mentioned.

Gradually Ruth has been adding other items like: clothes, jewelry, cosmetics and almost everything else customers need in their daily lives because she’s known how to take advantage of the vast clientele that her initial natural products business generated. Her main customers are residents of the neighborhood and referrals from them who live in other areas.

Ruth María is quite a good businesswoman who floats her customers just the amount of credit they are able to repay in the time agreed upon.  Thus she recovers her outstanding debts weekly and some biweekly. She, however, pays cash so often gets discounts because her suppliers know her well and she is very good at negotiating her purchases.

Her recovery margin on the natural products is 40% and she usually gets that back on the first installment.  However, she splits up the amount into four installments according to the customer and sometimes makes exceptions for some customers giving them still longer repayment schedules; but this isn’t too common.  The other merchandise has a 45% margin and that she recovers in two installments.

Her dream now is to have a point of sale in some strategic location but she knows she needs an important injection of capital to do so.  This is why she’s working so hard to accomplish this.

With the Kiva loan, which is her first loan, she will buy natural products that she has pending orders for as well as jeans, footwear, underwear and especially children’s clothes keeping in mind that during the festive season that’s approaching parents will dress up their children in new outfits and the children will sport Ruth Maria’s outfits with much cheer and distinction.

loans.use: She will buy natural products her customers have ordered and also will buy jeans, shoes, underwear and especially children’s clothes.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr.Edmundo; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papas el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja siendo esta la que administra el negocio, a la vez el socio administra el servicio público de baño del mercado Virgen Asunta en el mismo que se encuentra su otro negocio el socio está muy contento ya que con el préstamo el podrá implementar mas su negocio.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su negocio de venta de papas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen Natividad communal bank that is located in the Urubamba district that is part of the Urubamba province in Cusco department.
He is Edmundo, 47, in a common-law marriage and he has 5 children.  The member alternates his daily activities by selling potatoes with his partner.  She manages this business and he  takes care of the public bathrooms in the Virgen Asunta market.  Their business is also located in this market.  He is very happy with the loan because this will allow him to improve the business.

The member is requesting a loan to buy more products for his potato sales business.

He is very content with the loan and promises to make all of the payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy more products for his potato sales business.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de San Sebastián. El distrito de San Sebastián se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 10 km. de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca.
Nicolás se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes en su propio taxi y trabaja en el cercado del Cusco. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios y le va regular. Nicolás y su esposa tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas de forma ambulatorio, ellos llevan sus productos en una carreta y se instalan en la calle y venden a todos los transeúntes que pasan por esa calle. Con su próximo préstamo, Nicolás que espera recibir S/. 2300 nuevos soles. Por el momento desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar mercadería como por ejemplo, dulces, galletas, gaseosas, tortas y muchos productos más. Nicolás pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Nicolás lives with his wife and three children in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco and located 10km from the town square. It is also the archaeological capital of South America. Cusco is an enchanting city that dates back to the time of the Incas. The city of Cusco is built at the base of an ancient Incan village.

Nicolás provides transportation services with his own taxi and works along the outskirts of Cusco. He has been providing transportation services for many years and works on a regular basis. Nicolás and his wife also have a small business selling sweets as street vendors. They haul their products in a cart, park it on the street, and sell to everyone who passes through their location. With this next loan Nicolás will receive 2300 PEN. At the moment, he wants to increase his business capital and purchase merchandise such as candy, cookies, sodas, cakes, and other products. Nicolás belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) Communal Bank that is part of Asociación Arariwa. The Communal Bank is in its second year of operation and is doing very well.

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, sodas, cakes, and other products to sell

loans.name: Pasos Firme 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ruth is one of the members of Pasos Firme 1 2 & 3 (Firm Steps) groups. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 3 children.

Ruth is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around 3 years, starting with a capital her partner in love gave her to make a  business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing underwear for men and women. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to add more products to his business.

Ruth's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area,.
