This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Notes: The two women in the small photo at the bottom are part of the group, they are completing the fifteen members. At the moment of the group photo, they were organizing the repayments schedule.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry A. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 41 years old. Marry is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marry owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Marry has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Marry is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marry from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik V. lives in Vanadzor city with her family. Her daughter and husband help Goharik in her business, which consists of souvenir and glassware trading. Goharik has been engaged in this business for 21 years. She uses the income for her family. Goharik purchases an assortment of products from Yerevan once or twice a month, and from Georgia once a month.
This is Goharik’s 13th loan from Kiva partner, Nor Horizon, and her second loan via Kiva. Goharik used her first Kiva loan to buy a large lot of glassware and souvenirs, which she sold very profitably. Now she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to increase her shop’s assortment by purchasing flower bowls, fruit bowls, etc.

loans.use: To purchase flower bowls, fruit bowls, etc.

loans.name: Elnura's Group

texts.en:
Elnura B., 25, is the leader of this group.  Elnura is a young mother of two children ages 2 and 6 months. She and her husband have started cattle breeding and reselling 6 years ago.  A monthly salary from her husband was used to purchase a bull. Her husband’s family helps to takre care of cattle and resell it in a local farmyard, because Elnura stays busy with her kids. Her husband is a police officer and very committed to his work, and devotes all of his free time to looking after cattle. Elnura’s customer base is constantly increasing since she has a good reputation due to dedication and product quality.  She plans to use this loan to continue to meet customer demand and buy two more good healthy bulls. Elnura and her group thank the lenders for understanding her situation. She hopes to build a good working capital and become the most successful supplier of cattle in the region. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Erwin Daniel

texts.es:
Erwin de 33 años, es un hombre trabajar que tiene un negocio de confección y elaboración de sandalias. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm elaborando y reparando sandalias en su taller. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso el comienza a trabajar desde muy temprano haciendo sandalias. Vende las sandalias según sea su elaboración hasta $ 14. Quiere en un futuro tener un taller grande pero para eso primero quiere comprar con el préstamo suelas y materiales.
texts.en:
33-year old Erwin is a hardworking man who runs a sandal-making business. He works from 8am to 3pm making and repairing sandals in his workshop. As he is ambitious, he starts work early in the day. Depending on their style, he sells the sandals for around $14. 

In the future Erwin wants to have a large workshop, but at the moment his goal is to use the loan to buy soles and other materials.

loans.use: to buy soles etc. for his sandal-making business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos D. C.:de 37 años trabaja en la albañileria, y aparte de eso tiene otra ocupacion y es el cultivo de cafe y mais el contrata personal para que le eyuden a cultivar su tierra,tambien para que lo riegue y le eche abono,el solicita este credito para la compra de plantas de cafe y compra de abono organico. como toda persona tiene su sueño el de el es sembrar la mayor parte de cafe y poder exportarlo al extrangero y asi aumentar su ganancia y asi tener mas oportunidades de superarse, cada dia mas.
texts.en: Juan Carlos D. C. is 37 years old. He works as a mason, and apart from this he also has another occupation: growing coffee and corn. He hires workers who help him farm his lands, and also to water them and add fertilizer. He is requesting this loan to buy coffee plants and also to buy organic fertilizer. Like every person, he has his dream, and his is to plant his lands mostly with coffee and be able to export it abroad, so he can increase his earnings and thus have more opportunities to get ahead in life, day by day.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora V. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years of age and married to Job V., a dressmaker. They were blessed with four children. Leonora is presently engaged in buying and selling firewood. She have been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be purchase more firewoods to sell. This will be her 4rth  loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha L. (pictured with her loom) has been married for just three months and has no children yet. She is a silk weaver, while her husband is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

The family does not have any means of transportation. They spend a lot of money on traveling costs very often, so Sokha is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yulisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Yulisa Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y hielo. Tiene más de  9 años en su negocio, es una persona muy trabajadora. Inicio este medio de vida con la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo no ha sido fácil ya que estar pendiente de sus hijos y de su trabajo. El crédito es para la compra de leche, cremas, queso y cuajada, también bolsas para sus hielos. Sueña con ampliar su negocio, proporcionar más ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en: Yulisa Del Carmen sells milk products and ice.  She has had her business for more than 9 years.  She is a very hard-working person.  She started doing this for a living because she needed to defray household costs.  She has 3 children in her charge, and it has not been easy, since she has to keep an eye on both her children and her work.  The loan is for the purchase of milk, cream, cheese, and cuajada (cheese curd), as well as bags for her ice.  She dreams of expanding her business and bringing in more earnings for her household.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cream, cheese, and cuajada (cheese curd), as well as bags for her ice

loans.name: Santo Jeovanny

texts.es:
Santo de 37 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es soltera tienen 5 hijos cada uno están en colegios fiscales. Su actividad comercial es la venta y elaboración de chifle.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás era empleado de una empresa hasta que un  día se independizo y realizo su propio negocio. Labora diariamente cortando y preparando los chifles. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere incrementar su capital comprando verde y mas para mercadería para su preparación.
texts.en:
Santo is 37 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban area that was originally irregular with various hills, brooks and ponds that are still present but it’s a disappearing ecosystem). He is single and has 5 children in primary school. He sells and makes chifle (fried plantain chips).

Santo used to work in a company until he decided to venture out on his own and started his own business. He works daily cutting and preparing chifles. With the loan, Santo wants to increase his capital by buying more plantains and foodstuffs for the chifle’s preparation.

loans.use: buy plantains.

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en:
Ernesta is a farmer working in the Philippines in the far place of Mocag Baggao, Cagayan. She is asking for a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers and a seed variety of corn. She has been doing the business for 7 years with her husband Jaime.

She is now 39 years old, a mother to four school-aged children. Through their average net profit from farming of around PHP30,000, Ernesta is able to send her children in school continuously. In the future, she hopes for her children's success for she knows their success someday is also hers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a seed variety of corn.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja is 45 years old and lives in the West Point area.  She’s married and her husband is an office worker.  They have 3 children between 12 and 18 years old, all of whom live at home and attend school.  Haja sells a range of goods, including lappa (traditional clothing), cold water and soft drinks.  Her mother gave her the money with which to start the business.

Her main challenge is the high level of competition. What she likes about this business is that it gives her the ability to support her children.  Haja has requested this loan to purchase more lappa. She wants to be a worthy woman and give her children a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional Cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tejidos, ella tiene maquinas de tejer, ella teje chompas y pantalones de lana para niños y bebes y después lo distribuye a las diferentes tiendas donde vende ropa para bebes y niños, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, hilos, cierres y botones para tejer las chompas y pantalones y también para el mantenimiento de las maquinas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Generación III” (New Generation III) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

She is 30 years old and has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with selling knitwear.  She has knitting machines and she knits sweaters and wool pants for children and infants that she then sells to various stores that sell clothes for infants and children.  She is able to support her children thanks to this business.  She wants to expand and improve the knitwear sales and is asking for the loan to buy materials like wool, thread, zippers and buttons to knit sweaters and pants and also to service her machines.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wool, thread, zippers and buttons to knit sweaters and pants and also to service her machines.

loans.name: Deverly

texts.en:
At 23, Deverly is very determined to be successful. She is single and is engaged in a retail business which is situated in front of her house. She offers shampoo, soap, bread and snacks in the community.

Deverly is requesting a loan of Php15,000 to purchase one box of milk, a box of detergent soap and some boxes of snack food. Deverly plans to save money for her future and also to support her mother and father in their daily needs.

In the future, Deverly hopes to expand her business by offering more products.

loans.use: to purchase one box of milk, a box of detergent soap and some boxes of snack food

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos al señor Mario que nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 66 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades, Yo soy jubilado pero trabajo de cocinero en el centro comercial “La Canasta” en la ciudad del Cusco los días sábados y domingos. También me dedica a la venta de ropa y compro mi mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca. Este crédito es para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo vestidos. Y mi sueño es abrir un restaurante turístico en el centro de la ciudad del Cusco”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vamos Juntas” (We Go Together) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, which is known in the region for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

It is here that the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sr. Mario, who was born in the city of Cusco in Peru. He is 66 years old, married, and has three children. Mario said the following:

“At the moment, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I conduct my activities. I am retired but work as a cook at the La Canasta shopping center in the city of Cusco on Saturdays and Sundays. I also sell clothing and buy my merchandise in the city of Juliaca. This loan will be used to buy merchandise, such as dresses. My dream is to open a tourist restaurant in central Cusco.”

loans.use: to buy dresses.

loans.name: Nayantai

texts.en:
Nayantai is 55 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Hovd province of Mongolia. His three children attend the local high school. His wife works as a waitress at the Sports Center.

He worked as a carpenter at the wood factory from 1977 to 1995. In 1995 he started to make wooden frames for Mongolian yurts privately. He produces Mongolian yurt's walls, roof poles, and doors. He is very experienced in his field. He is planning to make more wooden yurt frames as the demand for new yurts will increase because of the marriage and festival season in September. He is a diligent man who says, "My oldest son just got married and I want to make wooden yurt frames for my son."

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood to make doors, cabers (poles) and walls.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Digna Patricia

texts.es:
Digna Patricia tiene 21 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos de 5, 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Digna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Digna Patricia, 21, is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 8, in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of Caminando Hacia el Futuro Communal Bank, located in the Jesús de Gran Poder area of Ventanas Canton, work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Digna works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  She buys her products in Marlín Store and in the stalls there and in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for the crops.  The support of the loan would help her economically to supplement her needs, to confront challenges like disease and illness.  Her dream is to be able to have her own piece of land to be able to work better.

In her spare time, Digna likes to go for walks and spend more time working.

loans.use: to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Rouba

texts.fr: Madame Rouba  est une femme mariée de 61 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle gère  7 enfants et évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le souci de ne pas rester inactive. Et c’est une activité qui marche bien pour elle au moment des fêtes. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires a revendre destinés a relancer et élargir son activité de commerce. Ce financement lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière afin de mieux gérer les dépenses familiales.
texts.en: Madam Rouba is a 61 years-old woman who lives in Senegal. She takes care of 7 children and works for more than 10 years in the foodstuffs business. She chose this activity in order to not stay inactive. Her business is working pretty well and espacially during Holidays. She is a member of U-IMEC since April. Madam Rouba is applying to a 100 000 frs loan to purchase foodstuffs to resell in order to boost and expand her business. This loan will allow her to be financially independent and to better run the family spending.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and resell

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en:
Sisi  is a married woman with one child who is not yet schooling. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Sisi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase or order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan  for building a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 49 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband is selling food earning $3 per day. They live with only one child, he is 18 years old. He helps her to sell the groceries at home. Each month, she has to spend $83 on food, $5 on electricity, and $5 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more groceries to sell in her shop. She started this career about 7 years ago and she is able make some income to support the family, so she wants to extend her shop when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 25 años, convive con Dagoberto de 24 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la urbanización Sivia. Adela, consecuente y luchadora con sus objetivos, cuenta que años atrás la situación económica de esta parte del país estuvo estancado por la inestabilidad social y económica. Por tal razón no logró concluir sus estudios al quedarse huérfana de Papá y Mamá; y con 5 hermanos pequeños que tuvo que cuidar. La chacra que tenían no era suficiente para mantenerse ya que los frutos, no tenían mucha rentabilidad, es por ello que decidió trabajar como empleada del hogar, donde conoció a Dagoberto que ahora es su querido esposo. Tiempos después Adela con el poco ahorro que tenía más el de su esposo decidieron abrir un bar, donde ahora expenden licores, y toda clase de bebidas. Para ella los mejores días de venta son los fines de semana y feriados, dicho bar cuenta con un amplio lugar de esparcimiento. Esta feliz con este negocio ya que le genera un buen ingreso económico. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que ella esta comprometida en cancelar puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Además está contenta con los de su banco comunal, porque son puntuales con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más licores para abastecer su bar.
texts.en:
Adela, 25, lives with Dagoberto, 24, and their son. They live in their own house located in the Silvia neighbourhood. 

Adela, who is consistent and fights for her goals, explains that a few years ago the financial situation in this part of the country suffered from stagnation due to social and economic instability. Because of this and the death of her mother and father she was unable to finish her schooling; she had 5 younger siblings to look after. The farm they had was not enough to support them as it wasn't very profitable. That's why she decided to work as maid, where she met Dagoberto, her beloved husband. 

Some time later, Adela and her husband used their small savings to open a bar, where they sell liquor and all kinds of drinks. For her the best days for the business are week-ends and holidays. The bar has plenty of room for recreation. She is happy with the business as it generates a good income. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to repaying it on time. She is also very pleased with her community bank, because everyone repays the loans on time. She will invest the 1,500 soles requested in the purchase of liquor to stock up her bar.

loans.use: to buy liquor for her bar.

loans.name: Aïda Thiam Fonk Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Fonk Liggey du banc villageois de Yaral  est créé le 05/10/11. Il est constitué de 15 femmes. Le commerce est leur principale activité. Il existe une parfaite solidarité entre les membres.

La présidente du groupe,Palla, âgée de 30 ans, est veuve et mère de 03 enfants. Elle fait du commerce et vend des denrées de première nécessite (riz, niébé, arachide, maïs, etc. Elle se ravitaille au marché de de sa localité ou dans les villes les plus proches dés fois. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en bleu-saumon et a levé la main gauche.

Avec son prêt elle voudrait acheter du niébé, du riz, de l'arachide, du maïs etc. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle voudrait acheter un terrain pour ses enfants et les soutenir dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Group Fonk Liggey, which depends from the Yaral "banc villageois" (village lending group), was created on 10/05/11. It is constituted of 15 women. Their main activity is retail. The members are in perfect solidarity with one another.

The group’s president, Palla, is 30 years old. She is a widow and a mother of three. Trade is her business, and she retails first-necessity goods (rice, cowpeas, peanuts, corn, etc). She gets her supplies from the market in Gouye Mbeut or sometimes from closer cities. She has been in this business for over ten years and is quite experimented. On the photo, she is standing on the right and is dressed in blue and salmon. She is raising her left hand. With her loan she would like to buy cowpeas, rice, peanuts, corn, etc.

With her loan, she would like to purchase black-eyed peas. With the profit, she would like to buy a parcel for her children and to help them attend school.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Mody

texts.fr:
Mody est un homme habite dans la région sud du sénégal agé de 57 ans , marié ,il a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Le premier fait la terminale le deuxième fait la 3em et le troisième est l'école primaire.
Mody travail dans le commerce de bétail depuis 1996 jusqu'à nos jours(15 ans).Avec son commerce ,il assure les dépenses de sa famille et la scolarisation des enfants.
Mody avec ce crédit augmente le nombre de bétails et dans l'avenir développer son activité pour pouvoir demain avoir sa propre maison et s'occuper de sa famille
texts.en:
Mody lives in the south of Senegal and is 57 years old. He is married and has three children who all attend school. The oldest is in the last year of secondary school, the second is in the last year of middle school,  and the third is in primary school. 

Mody has been working selling animals from 1996 until now (that is, for 15 years). With his business, he covers the family expenses and school fees of his children. 

With this loan, Mody wants to expand his flock and in future, develop his business so that later he can have his own house and live there with his family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to expand his flock.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen is 28 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village in the Yen Phong district of Bac Ninh. She was married and has three children who are still young. To earn a living, she not only grows rice but also makes tofu to sell. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about VND 6,000,000. Duyen has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed VND 7,392,000 and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow VND 9,632,000 to buy beans for making tofu.

loans.use: to buy beans for making tofu to sell

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is 26 years old and is single. He is a carpenter and sells products such as tables, chairs, windows, and doors. His business is well organized. He works from 7 am until 5 pm every day and has five years of experience in this business. Anastasie employs five people to help him.

Anastasie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more wood to build more tables, chairs, windows, doors, and so on. With the profits from this loan, Anastasie will buy his own house and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es casada, tiene 47 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 9 hijos 4 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la crianza de animales, cerdos y pollo de engorde, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital y tiene 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de de pollos de engorde y la alimentación de estos, espera en el futuro contar con un capital mucho mas amplio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Eusebia is married.  She is 47 years old and completed 6 years of her primary education.  She has 9 children, 4 of whom are in school.  Her business is raising animals (pigs and chickens).  She started this business with a little capital and has 7 years experience.  She has the support of her husband who is a farmer.

Eusebia got together a group to request a loan for buying chickens to fatten and feed for these animals.  She hopes, in the future, to have more capital.  The other members of her group farm and raise animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten, and chicken feed

loans.name: Tofi

texts.en:
Tofi is married, 21 years of age and has one child.

Tofi owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Tofi needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase push knives, a wheelbarrow and pesticides. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 300 or USD $125 per week) to improve or expand the business.

Tofi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tofi's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase push knives, wheelbarrow and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and oil.

loans.name: Crisantemo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Crisantemo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Oscar Enrique de 42 años quien se dedica al comercio de flores naturales en uno de los mercados más grande de Managua. Este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace 20 años junto a su esposa.
El tiene tres hijos de 20, 19 y 4 años de los cuales solo la menor está a su cargo.
Los otros integrantes son Marbelly de 29 años quien vende cosméticos desde hace 6 años y Leopoldo desde hace 15 años vende granos básicos.
texts.en:
The Crisantemo Group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people. Oscar Enrique is 42 years old and a member of this group; he runs a flower selling business in one of Managua's largest markets. He and his wife have been running this business together for 20 years.
Oscar has three children aged 20, 19 and 4 years; he now only has to provide for his youngest child.
The other members of this group are 29 year old Marbelly, who has been selling cosmetics for 6 years, and Leopoldo has been selling grains and pulses for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice retailing.

Nida dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé. Agée de 56 ans, Afi vit avec quatre enfants à charge. Afi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Afi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.

loans.use: Acheter 14 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Dotsè

texts.en:
Mr. Dotsè H. is a married father of five (5) children. His primary business activity is shoe manufacturing and repair. His wife, reduced to being a simple housewife, has no ability to contribute to the household. Mr. H. is solely responsible for providing for the needs of the family. As generous as he is charitable, he provides free training to a group of very poor young men in his shop and provides benefits for his apprentices such as healthcare and lunch. His shop is very well frequented due to the quality of his work, but he is in dire need of materials to better meet the demands of his clients.

Mr. Dotsè H. is asking for a loan of $850 to purchase a machine and acquire shoe manufacturing materials in order to increase his clientele and improve his services. Realizing this ambition will benefit him greatly, particularly with regard to increasing his income.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Dotsè est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants. Il a pour activité principale la fabrication et la réparation des chaussures. Sa femme, réduite à une simple ménagère n’a aucune capacité de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Monsieur H. se bat seul pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Aussi généreux que charitable, il forme gratuitement dans son atelier certains garçons très nécessiteux et subvient à certains besoins de ses apprentis comme la santé et le déjeuner. Son atelier est très bien fréquenté à cause de la qualité de son travail mais il manque cruellement de matériels pour mieux répondre aux exigences de ses clients.

Monsieur H. Dotsè sollicite ce crédit de $850 pour s’acheter une machine et s’approvisionner en matériels de fabrication de chaussures pour élargir la liste de sa clientèle et améliorer sa prestation de service. La réalisation de cette ambition lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’augmentation de son revenu.

loans.use: Purchase a machine and acquire materials for manufacturing shoes

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos started selling tacos in his own home six years ago. Little by little, clients and demand for his product increased. A little while ago, he took his earnings and bought a trailer that allowed him to set up his business along the main streets of the city, creating a larger market for his tacos and the possibility to increase sales. But he spent all he had and now needs a loan of $925 that will allow him to buy ingredients to make his tacos.

Carlos is a hard worker and he promises to repay the loan within six months to a year. His daughter works alongside him at the taco stand, and with the two of them working together they are confident the business will grow. You have the opportunity to help them, and your support will be very useful. They are sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

El señor Carlos, inició con la venta de tacos hace seis años, en su propio domicilio, poco a poco fueron incrementándose los clientes y la demanda por sus productos. Hace poco utilizó las ganancias que tenía para comparar un remolque que le permite ubicarse en una de las principales avenidas para cubrir un mercado más amplio, e incrementar sus ventas. Pero gastó todo lo que tenia y ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares que utilizará para la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de los tacos.

Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador y se compromete a regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses, su hija colabora con él en la taquería y con el trabajo de los dos confían en que su negocio podrá crecer. Tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudarlos, tu apoyo será de gran utilidad para ellos y te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy taco ingredients

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
My name is Blanca D. and I am dedicated to the sales of home decorations such as vases, flowers, tablecloths, and kitchen towels. I have been involved with this business for the past 4 years and I have many clients that are very pleased with my products as well as the prices which are accessible for our community. My goal is to increase my inventory for greater earnings so I will be able to better feed my family and cover expenses in our home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Blanca D. me dedico a la venta de adornos para el hogar como ser jarrones, flores, manteles, toallas para cocina, actividad que me dedico hace 4 años, tengo muchos clientes ya que les gusta mucho mi producto y tambien el precio que es accesible para nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ganancias y asi poder alimentar mi familia y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar

loans.use: purchase of decorations for the home

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo Sean is a 54-year-old widow and lives with her single child in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her family’s income, Keo Sean is not only employed as a primary school teacher, but she also runs a small tailoring business at home --together, she can typically earn around $2 each day.

In addition, her son works helping his household as a motor-taxi driver. This loan will be used by Keo Sean to purchase a motorcycle for her son and the leftover of the money is to buy thread and some tailoring tools.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle and some tailoring tools for her business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Since she and her husband split 3 years ago, Dominga, 47, has had to work hard so as to survive and feed her 3 children. She earns a living selling clothes for children, curtains, bed sheets and shoes for men. She walks around the streets and goes door-to-door to sell her products, since her house is too narrow and not handy for her customers.

As the holiday season is coming, Dominga needs a loan to purchase a large amount of the products she’s selling, especially clothes for children. Indeed, this period is usually the high season for selling clothes.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of clothes, curtains and shoes to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a 52 year-old widow with 4 married children. Catalina works hard to rent out tables, chairs, tablecloths and other party related products. She opened this business together with her sister but after 6 years, her sister left the country and left her to run the business.

Catalina underwent difficulties to operate the business alone, which was worse after her husband's death. Her late husband supported her emotionally and financially. His job at the factory helped to cover their living costs.

In spite of these vicissitudes, Catalina persevered and today, her business is running more smoothly. She wants to buy more merchandise. She seeks a loan that will allow her to invest in plastic chairs so she can increase the variety of products to offer in her renting business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Catalina tiene 52 años, ella es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, todos ya casados. Catalina se dedica al alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles y otros afines para fiestas. El negocio lo abrió junto con su hermana, pero hace 6 años, su hermana viajo a otro país y quedo ella sola frente al negocio.

Le costo mucho a Catalina salir adelante sola, más aún luego de la muerte de su marido, ya que el era su gran apoyo emocional además de económico, pues el trabajaba en una fábrica y ayudaba con los ingresos y gastos de la casa.

A pesar de las vicisitudes, Catalina persevero y hoy día el negocio marcha bastante bien. Ella desea adquirir hoy un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de sillas de plástico de esta forma poder aumentar la variedad de su stock de alquiler.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Nuri

texts.en: Nuri is one of the active clients of Microinvest. Her first loan from our organization was in 2003, which was spent on an expansion of her assortment. She has been in trade for over 10 years, and of course she has a great number of constant clients. Her goods are less expensive than those in commercial shops and she purchases the goods herself. She brings her goods from the Istaravshan wholesale market, district of Khujand, Tadjikistan. Her daughter is her business partner, and she stays in business since her mother has left on a trip. Nuri has one problem: her roof is leaky  in her home, and she wants to increase the volume of her goods and get maximum profit so she can spend part of her income on reconstruction of her roof for family.

loans.use: Increasing the volume of goods.

loans.name: Kigandazi A Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Irene runs a small restaurant. Jane sells used clothes wants to increase the stock with the loan. Annet has a canteen business. Prossy sells fish while Rose has a public pay phone.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their current businesses

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz M. is an independent plaster worker in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 30 years old and has been working in this business for the last 5 years. The town of Khachmaz has been growing at an exceptional rate the last few years, resulting in a great demand for Ramiz’s services to increase. He is currently looking for funding, so he can purchase new tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for his corn crop, cattle and feed. Also to rent machinery, contract labor and have the cattle  vaccinated and disinfected.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
The transportation business requires much investment being that the cost of fuel increases each time and the cost of spare parts has elevated to great magnitudes. In the city of Somotillo, Miguel Angel R. has been in the transportation industry with his own taxicab, which he works daily in an effort to bring home the daily bread to be ingested by his wife and three children.

The problem Mr. R. is facing is that he needs to buy spare parts for his vehicle because it is in bad condition and needs to be taken to the shop for repairs. For this, he has turned to Ceprodel for support with the goal of obtaining a loan to purchase the parts and continue with his transportation business in the municipality of Somotillo, from which he is a native.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de transporte es una labor que requiere de mucho inversión por la razón de que hoy en día el costo del combustible se eleva cada vez más y además los repuestos de los vehículos se elevan a grandes magnitudes. En la ciudad de Somotillo el caballero Miguel Angel R. se dedica desde hace cuatro años al negocio de transporte teniendo su propio taxi el cual lo trabaja todos los días procurando llevar el pan a la mesa para que lo puedan ingerir sus tres hijos y esposa.

La problemática atravesada por el señor R. es la necesidad de la compra de repuestos para el vehiculo debido a que está en malas condiciones y necesita adquirir estos repuestos para llevar el auto al taller y que sea reparado. Para esto ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel con el fin de que le proporcionen créditos para adquirir estos repuestos y así continuar con su labor de transporte en el municipio de Somotillo de donde es originario.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to repair his taxicab.

loans.name: Nolvia Cecilia

texts.es:
Nolvia is 37 years old, is married and has one son aged 17 years. She lives in the region of Waspan Norte in the city of Managua. Her husband works as an officer in a company and he covers the household expenses. Nolvia is a designer and the loan she is requesting is to install ceramic tiling in her home as a remodelling project to improve their way of life. The family's plans are to continue improving and remodelling their home to obtain a dignified place to live and help with the professional education for their son.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nolvia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad. Habita en el barrio Waspan Norte, de la ciudad de Managua. Su esposo trabaja como fiscal en una empresa y aporta a los gastos del hogar, Nolvia es diseñadora y el préstamo lo quiere para poner cerámica y mejorar su vivienda y tener un mejor nivel de vida. Los planes de la familia es seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda para lograr obtener un hogar digno y ayudar en la educación de su hijo para formarlos como profesionales.

loans.use: To install ceramic tiles in her home.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi T. is one of the first members of the TYM Fund when it first came to her area. She has 3 children, one of which is still going to school and the other two are grown-up and working. She and her husband have been doing carpentry for 8 years, selling tables, chairs, beds, closets and staircases. Having clever hands and being experienced, she has more and more customers and her designs satisfy many peoples’ needs. This time, she wants to borrow 425 USD to buy more wood and expand her business. Her average income is approximately 325 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Là một trong số những thành viên tham gia vào Quỹ đầu tiên của cụm. Chị Bùi Thị Thêu 47 tuổi cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Đề, vợ chồng anh chị có 3 người con, 1 con đang còn đi học, 2 con đã lớn và có công ăn việc làm ổn định, gia đình anh chị đã có trên 8 năm làm nghề mộc, hiện tại anh gia đình anh chị chuyên làm bàn, ghế, giường, tủ và cầu thang với một số mặt hàng đó là rất phù hợp với nhu cầu hiện nay, là người thợ khéo tay cùng với kịnh nghiệm làm nghề mộc nên các mặt hàng của gia đình anh chị rất có chất lượng và mẫu mã cũng đa dạng, từ đó việc kinh doanh của gia đình anh chị là rất thuận lợi, để đáp ứng với nhu cầu thị trường gia đình anh chị có bàn bạc vòng vốn này xin vay 7.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào mua gỗ và mở rộng xưởng sản xuất. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: buy wood for carpentry

loans.name: Djantoyerela (La Prudence Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Djantoyerela group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have five children. They live in extended families with their husbands, their in-laws, their husbands’ other wives, and their children in the village of Djinina, in the Fana subprefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali). The members of the Djantoyerela group sell grains, Shea almonds and candy. They came together because they are in the same line of business and all live in the same village. The Djantoyerela group is on its eighth group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and all of its previous loans were repaid in full. They buy their products in neighboring villages (Marka Coungo, Tinkole and Santiguila), which allows them to keep a sufficient supply. These products are sold as is or are turned into flour to make “farou farou,” a local cake adored by children. For the part of their business that consists of processing Shea almonds, a portion of the loan will be used to pay other women for the almonds. They will sell their products in the villages named above. Each member of the group is involved in at least two different parts of the business and has a great ability to adapt to economic hardships. They hope to earn an average profit of 17,500 CFA francs per month.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Djantoyerela sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’age de 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles élargies avec leurs maris, les beaux parents, les coépouses et les enfants dans le village de Djinina, sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Les membres du groupe Djantoyerela font le commerce de céréales et d’amendes de karité et la vente des friandises. Elles se sont connues parce qu’elles font les mêmes activités et vivent dans le même village. Le groupe Djantoyerela est à sont huitième prêt de groupe avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles s’approvisionnent dans les villages voisins (Marka Coungo, Tinkole ou Santiguila) et constituent ainsi un stock suffisant. Ce stock est soit vendu en l’état ou transformé en poudre pour faire le fourou fourou (gâteau local) très prisé par les enfants. Pour l’activité de transformation des amendes de karité, une partie du prêt est utilisée pour payer les amendes auprès d’autres femmes. Les ventes sont effectuées dans les localités ci-dessus citées. Comme on le constate elles mènent chacune au minimum deux activités et disposent d’une grande capacité d’adaptation à la réalité économique. Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17.500 FCFA par mois.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Santos Rosendo

texts.es:
Santos works buying plastic tubes in order to cut them into small pieces and shape them in the forms of T, Y, L. These serve for sewer connections and the finished product is sold in large quantities in the stores of the El Rosario Santos area. He is single and lives in the area of Tembladerani (city of La Paz) in his parents’ house. His loan will be directed toward the purchase of a greater quantity of tubes, which will allow him to reduce costs. It is the second time that he has applied for a loan through Impro as well as Kiva. His credit history favors him very much as he is qualified as client 1, meaning that he makes all of his payments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Santos se ocupa en comprar tubos plásticos para cortarlos en pequeños pedazos y moldearlos en forma de T, Y, L. Esto sirve para las conexiones de alcantarillado, el producto terminado se vende en grandes cantidades a las tiendas de la zona de El Rosario Santos es soltero y vive en la zona de Tembladerani (ciudad de La Paz), en la casa de sus padres. El crédito será destinado para comprar mayor cantidad de tubos, lo que le permitirá reducir sus costos. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito, tanto en Impro como en Kiva. Su historial le favorece bastante, esta calificado como cliente 1, lo que quiere decir que paga puntualmente todas sus cuotas.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Norma inicio su negocio porque tenia muchos gastos ya que 2 de sus hijos estudian la secundaria y el mas pequeño de 7 años esta en la primaria, fue entonces que para ayudar a su esposo busco una actividad que le brindara ingresos y con ayuda de su cuñada quien la enseño hace 2 años a vender productos plásticos ella poco a poco esta logrando una estabilidad económica a través de sus ventas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía ya que la falta de capital hace que se le caigan algunas ventas. Con tu ayuda Norma saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Norma began her business because she had a lot of expenses. Now her two older children are in middle school and the smallest, seven years old, is in elementary. To help her husband cover household expenses, Norma looked for a means of earning income. With the help of her sister-in-law, who taught her how to sell Tupperware two years ago, Norma is using her sales to slowly achieve economic stability. Norma is asking for a loan of US $250 to buy merchandise. She currently lacks the capital because her sales have fallen. She’ll repay the loan in three months. With your help Norma will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Зайналова Мохира проживает в районе Файзабад. Работает учителем в средней школе. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Живет с родителями , всю семью обеспечивает сама. Кроме работы в школе занимается животноводством. Возможность получить кредит , дает возможность купить еще одного бычка. Увеличив поголовье скота , ее хозяйство будет приносить больше дохода.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mohira Z. lives in the Fayzabad region. She works as a teacher in a secondary school. She is divorced and has one child. She lives with her parents and supports the entire family herself. Besides working as a teacher she also does animal husbandry. The opportunity to receive a loan is an opportunity for her to buy another calf. By increasing the head count of her cattle her business will bring her more income. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  vive junto a su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 años y 2 meses.
 
Ellos constituyen una pareja joven que,  gracias a su trabajo adquirieron un  lote de terreno en una de las zonas periféricas de la cuidad en donde realiza mejoras para poder vivir con un poco de comodidad.

 Se dedica a la confección de pequeñas alfombras, y su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas y trabaja como portero de medio turno en una institución, de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de materiales de construcción para ampliar las habitaciones de su domicilio.
 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, y el segundo vía KIVA la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Gladys lives with her husband and two small children, who are three and two years old, respectively. Gladys and her husband are a young couple, who acquired some land thanks to their hard work. Their land is in one of the peripheral zones of the city where they are making improvements so as to live more comfortably. Gladys sews small rugs, and her husband makes backpacks and works as a doorman in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy construction materials to expand the bedrooms in their home. This is Gladys' second loan with Impro, and the second through Kiva, whose evaluation qualified her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to expand two bedrooms in her house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. Two of them are currently learning apprenticeship in the auto mechanic and glazing industries. Florence started her fish-selling business 25 years ago in Teshie, a suburb of Accra, where she lives. Specifically, Florence prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good fish meals. She has lots of customers who buy from her stand. 

With the loan, she wants to increase her working capital to enable her purchase fresh fish in bulk to serve her community. She expects to see her business grow and to be able to support her children’s education. she is a member of the loan group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She was in a meeting with her group members when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fresh fish.

loans.name: Gladis Adriana

texts.es:
Gladis P. F. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” de la provincia de Carhuaz.

Gladis tiene 31 años, y dos hijos con su conviviente, ella comenta que desde que falleció su mamá se ha sentido sola, siendo este hecho la mayor dificultad que ha tenido que enfrentar, Gladis afirma que ha crecido mucho en su negocio, considerando dicho crecimiento como su mayor logro. Ella comercializa animales mayores y menores, carne vacuna que lo vende en la feria de Carhuaz hace ya 04 años, comenta que empezó con s/300.00 comprando animales menores y vendiéndolos en la feria de Carhuaz como cuyes y gallinas y que en la actualidad tiene invertido en todo su negocio un aproximado de s/15 000.00 en animales vacunos, carneros, gallinas y cuyes que compra de las zonas rurales y los vende en carne o vivos, en la feria de Carhuaz, ella tiene que enfrentar los peligros que significa trasladar a los animales en camionetas, comenta que incluso una vez sufrió un accidente cuando se dirigía a su lugar de venta.
  
Con este préstamo de s/.3000.00, que pagará en ocho cuotas invertirá en la compra de ganado ovino.
 
Gladis comenta que el crecimiento que ha tenido es debido al esfuerzo individual y familiar.
texts.en:
Gladis P. F. is a member of the community bank “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” in the province of Carhuaz. Gladis is 31 years old and has 2 children with her partner. She says that since her mother's death she has felt alone. This has been the most difficult situation that she has ever faced. Gladis says that she has expanded her business a lot and that she considers this her greatest accomplishment. She sells both large and small animals. She has sold beef at the Carhuaz market for the past 4 years. She started with 300 soles, buying small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens and selling them at the Carhuaz market. She currently has a total of 15,000.00 soles invested in her business, in the form of cattle, sheep, chickens, and guinea pigs which she buys in rural areas and then sells live or butchered at the Carhuaz market. She bears the risks of transporting the animals in vans, saying that she once had an accident on her way to market. With this 3,000.00 soles loan which she will repay in 8 months, she will buy sheep. Gladis says that the growth of her business is due to her efforts and the support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
El Emprendedor Concepción R. B. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don Concepción tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades un varón de 10 años y cursa el 4 grado de primaria y su hijo mayor de 17 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañera de vida no labora, los propósitos de Don Concepción son de mejorar cada día en la calidad de su negocio y proporcionarle al cliente la mejor atención para que quede satisfecho con el servicio sus deseos son que uno de sus hijos sea docente a como lo es Don Concepción para que esta tradición se mantenga en familia  por lo que Don Concepción tiene 2 trabajos imparte clases de primaria y el destace de cerdo que es una ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos sus sueños son seguir luchando en la vida para darle a su familia todo lo necesario para que no pasen por necesidades y también el contribuir a darle a sus hijos y a su esposa un lugar digno para vivir y así enseñarles a sus hijos a luchar por sus deseos y sueños propuestos.


La actividad económica a la que Don Concepción se dedica es el destace de cerdo, la ubicación de su negocio es en malpaisillo en el barrio larreynaga, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Don Concepción inicio este negocio por necesidades de cubrir los gastos de su familia ya que el imparte clases de primaria y al ver que el salario no le ajustaba por lo que se ve obligado a trabajar en un oficio como es el destace de cerdo al comienzo le fue difícil porque no tenia la practica pero con la ayuda del tiempo fue que la adquirió y fue así como empezó y sus clientes le realizaban los pedidos de carne y así logro su fama con sus vecinos y sus amigos su esposa lo apoya y le ayuda en este oficio que le beneficia a toda la familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdo en pie ya que tiene que recorrer las diferentes comarcas en busca del mejor cerdo para sacar una buena producción de este.
texts.en:
Concepción R. B. is a 47-year-old entrepreneur who has a live-in partner and 2 children—a 10-year-old son who is in the fourth grade and a 17-year-old son who is a senior in high school. His live-in partner does not work. Mr. R.’ goals are to improve the quality of his business and provide better customer service so that the customer can be satisfied. He hopes that one of his sons will be a teacher like he is, so that the family tradition can stay alive. Mr. Concepción is both an elementary school teacher and a pork butcher, and these two jobs help him move his sons forward in life. He wants to keep struggling in life in order to give his family everything they need, and he wants to give them a decent dwelling, thus showing his children how to struggle to reach their dreams, wishes, and goals.

Mr. Concepción has a pork business located on Malpaisillo, in the Larreynaga neighborhood. He has been in business for 15 years, a business which he started out of the necessity to cover his family’s expenses because his teaching salary was insufficient. At first, being a pork butcher was difficult for him due to his lack of experience, but as time passed by, he started gaining more experience and consequently more customers. He gained popularity through his friends and neighbors, who started ordering pork. His wife supports him and helps him with the business, which benefits the whole family. The loan will be used as business capital to purchase pork because he has to frequent the different regions in search of the best pork.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Ángeles inició el negocio desde joven, aprendió el oficio gracias a su abuela, y lo practicaba solamente con la familia y amigos cercanos, posteriormente una amiga que tenia un salón de belleza, la invito a ofrecer los masajes en su negocio. Comenzó el negocio en Julio del 2002 cuando su amiga le prestó el dinero para iniciar el negocio, el cual lo liquidó en un año, ya que al principio tenía poca clientela, principalmente eran sus familiares y no les cobraba como debía de ser.
Actualmente ya cuenta con dos mesas para aplicar los masajes, un pequeño stand donde tiene sus cremas, vendas, y demás utensilios que necesita, ya que ella misma elabora las cremas; además esta realizando una ampliación en su casa para tener independiente su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir más materia prima para la producción de las cremas y aceites, ya que en estas fechas, (inicio de año), aumenta un poco la clientela, que regularmente es por recomendación, y poner un anuncio en la fachada de su negocio para mayor proyección.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles started her work when she was young. She learned from her grandmother and she only worked for family and close friends. Later, a friend who owned a beauty salon invited her to offer massages from her business. She started her business in July 2002 when her friend lent her money to open her business, which she repaid in a year as at first she had few clients, most of her customers were friends and she was not charging them enough. Currently she has two massage tables and a small stand for her creams, cloth strips and other tools which she needs. She prepares the creams herself and is also enlarging her house to have a separate area for the business. She needs a MXN $4,000 loan which she will repay in six months in order to acquire the raw materials for preparing the creams and oils as these days, at the start of the year, she gets more customers. Most of her customers learn about her through word of mouth; she will use part of the loan to advertise in the storefront to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for creams and oils

loans.name: Johneth

texts.en:
Johneth U. is a resident of Balite, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and happily married to Allan U.; they were blessed with 6 children. Johneth's husband is a fisherman, and fishing is the major source of income in the family. Because of her desire to help, Johneth is the one who goes to the market and sells all the catch of fish of her husband.

Due to a strong demand for fish in the village, she joined HSPFI's micro-finance program and was able to receive her first loan. As time passed, their business has improved. And now dried squid is in demand not just in their village, but also in nearby villages of the province. Johneth now needs PHP 7,000 to buy boxes of dried squid and be the one in their place who stocks it.

loans.use: to purchase  boxes of dried squid for re-sale

loans.name: El Pozo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo tiene su domicilio en pueblo de Niquinohomo perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, estas tres mujeres tienen la misma actividad de ventas de Ropas y especies, venden  en la zona norte del país en ciudades como Matagalpa, Estela y Somoto. Se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra.

Doña Yahaira es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, madre de un niño, expresa que tenía necesidad de un crédito para comprar algunos artículos que no ofrecía, se informó en el mercado con una señora que trabaja con Adim, que es de la comarca y visitó la oficina, obtuvo la información y conformó su grupo para recibir la charla.
Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad que la aprendió de su mamá, espera salir bien en su crédito junto a sus compañeras y poder darle a su hijo estudios superiores.
Ella viaja por tres días a la semana fuera de su comunidad y un día va a Managua a comprar la ropa y especies, los otros días los dedica a su familia y a ir a dejar la cuota, ella es bien organizada con su tiempo y su negocio.
Su esposo le colabora con los gastos de su trabajo en la finca, piensa que van a mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
Doña Yhajaira ha  recibido varias capacitaciones y le ha servido para llevar un mejor control en su negocio.
texts.en:
This group calls the village of Niquinohomo, part of the city of Masaya, home. These three women all work in the same business: clothing and spice sales. They sell in the northern region of the country, in cities including Matagalpa, Estela and Somoto. They have known each other for many years and have a great deal of confidence in each other. Yahaira is the coordinator of the group. She is the mother of a young son. She comments that she needs a loan in order to buy items that she does not currently offer. She learned about Adim, a local organization, from a woman at the local market who works with the organization. She visited the office, gathered the information and formed her group, so they could all meet with Adim. Yahaira has been working in this business for years. She learned the business from her mother. She hopes to get ahead with this loan together with her partners in the group; she hopes to be able to give her son a college education. She travels 3 days of the week outside of her community, and one day of the week she goes to Managua to buy the clothing and spices. The other days she spends taking caring of her family and going to Adim to make the group's loan payment. She is very organized about her time and her business. Her husband helps pay the household expenses with his work on a farm. Yahaira plans to make improvements to their home. Yahaira has received several training courses; they have helped her to better manage her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Đào Hoàng (1328030876) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, Đào owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling poultry products in the local community. Đào has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $226) a month from these activities.

In 2003, Đào joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Đào has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Đào is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 6th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Đào plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: Food products for resale

loans.name: Zhkera Group

texts.en: Zhkera is the group leader of Zhkera group. There are three members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger. Zhkera wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. Sheullah wants to take out a loan for her quilt making business. Moaui wants to take out a loan for her father who makes cauldrons. They are requesting a group of loan 42000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. They are happy about this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila is the president of the Virgen D. Los Angeles Village Bank, which meets once a month in the town of Huayllacocha, where she lives. Zoila is sixty years old and is the widowed mother of three children, all of whom are now adults with families of their own. Zoila’s main business is selling “jora,” the fermented corn used to make chicha, a traditional Andean corn beer. She buys dried corn in 14-kilo sacks for $7 apiece, soaks the corn to ferment it, and resells each 14-kilo sack for $10 soles to local chicha producers. She works seven days a week selling jora at the market in Izcuchaca, a large town about thirty minutes away that serves as a transportation and commerce hub for the Anta region. She usually works from 6:00 am to 3:00 or 4:00 pm, depending on business, and earns about $20 per day in profits. She has been in this line of work for the past ten years, and has developed rheumatism over the years from having her hands in cold jora water all throughout the day. 

Zoila is requesting a loan to buy sacks of dried corn. The money should be enough to buy 100 sacks of corn. Zoila has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. She is grateful for the loans offered to her by Asociacion Arariwa, since it is the only financial institution that offers services in her town.

loans.use: Buy dried corn for fermentation

loans.name: Edjoè

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une sage femme, pour aider les femmes n’ayant pas de moyens à se procurer des  médicaments elle a commencé la vente de produits génériques et pharmaceutiques en détail. Elle fait cela depuis 5 ans déjà. Ainsi les femmes arrivent à se procurer les médicaments quand elles sont malades.
Son stock actuel est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits génériques "MEG".
texts.en:
This lady is a midwife. In order to help women who don't have the means to buy medicines, she began to sell generic and pharmaceutical products retail. She has been doing this for 5 years already. Thus the women manage to get medicines when they are ill.

Her inventory is presently sold out so she wants to replenish it and has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy "MEG" generic products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic medicines

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty es una mujer de 56 años, los últimos años ha trabajado mucho para tener los ingresos necesarios para la construcción de su casa propia, la cual está en proceso y espera pronto se termine para tener seguridad y comodidad, ya que por el momento vive en la casa de su suegra. En el tiempo que lleva casada aprendió el oficio de su esposo, ahora es un apoyo dentro del negocio, puesto que es la encargada de la administración de los contratos. Ellos se dedican al alquiler de andamios (soportes de metal) que requieren para las construcciones, de la misma forma apoya en el negocio que tiene con sus hijos en el mercado de la ciudad donde atienden los pedidos de elaboración o reparación de diversos materiales de construcción. Esta actividad la viene desempeñando con mayor compromiso desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el que, junto a su esposo e hijos, atienden su taller desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Betty menciona que en compañía de su familia las labores son menos pesadas y juntos tienen proyectado ampliar su negocio para dar mejores servicios bajo el rubro de construcción. En Microfinanzas PRISMA este es su crédito número 18 y como parte de su banco comunal trata de apoyar a todas sus compañeras para trabajar en conjunto por el desarrollo y crecimiento de ellas mismas. Los 3200 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de algunos materiales que tiene pensado adquirir para alquilar y ampliar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Betty is a 56 year-old woman. Recently, she has worked very hard in order to earn the necessary income for the construction of her own home, which is still in progress. She hopes that it will be finished soon so that she can have security and comfort. Right now she lives in the home of her mother-in-law.

In the time that she has been married, she has learned the business of her spouse, and now has a support role in his business, a role where she is in charge of the administration of the contracts. They rent scaffolding (metal supports) which are required for construction. In the same way, the business, which they have with their children in the city market, serves the requests for the creation or repair of diverse construction materials. This venture began 3 years ago, during which, along with her spouse and children, Betty works in the shop from 9 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Betty says that in the company of her family, the work seems less tedious. Together they plan to grow their business so that they can provide better services in the field of construction.

This is her 18th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and as part of her community bank, Betty tries to support all of her fellow members to help them develop and grow. The 3200 Peruvian Soles she seeks she will us to invest in the purchase of some materials which she plans to rent to improve their services.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to rent

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet prepares and sells pastries like doughnuts. She is 31 years old, married and a mother with four children who are currently in school. She has been in business seven years now, taking care of the family. In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to handle the demands of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials, as the price of raw materials has gone up. She requests the support of a loan to remain in business. With this loan, she believes she can provide for her family and save money for future eventualities. She says your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Chea, 42, and her husband, Mr. Ny Khin, 49, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1984 and have seven children, five sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and one lives outside the family home. Two of their sons are construction workers, one of their daughters weaves silk at home, and the others are still in school. 

S. was a weaver for twenty-three years. It is a skill she learned from her neighbor. She gave her loom to her daughter and started new business growing vegetables and crops. Mr. Ny Khen has been a fisherman for over twenty-five years. He fishes in the village and sells the fish to villagers.

S. is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase silk material for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 30 años se viene dedicando a las tareas agrícolas, cultivando la papa y otros productos oriundos D. su zona. D. esta forma, junto a su esposo, han sostenido durante mucho tiempo su hogar. Por esa razón y para menguar su trabajo físico, hace algunos años atrás decidieron implementar una tienda D. comestibles en su casa, para obtener ganancias con ella y ya no tener que realizar mucho esfuerzo en sus chacras. Los productos que ofrece son los comestibles básicos y más demandados D. consumo diario, por lo que su tienda se ha convertido en una D. las más visitadas D. su localidad y eso les está brindando ingresos económicos estables. Esta la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, donD. trabajar en un banco comunal le ha permitido aprender el valor del ahorro. El dinero que ahora está solicitando será utilizado en la compra D. mercadería para surtir su tienda con productos D. primera necesidad.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn N. is a 36-year-old mother of two, and raising a pig is a main part of her daily routine. Other than a daily profit from pig raising, she relies on her husband's business of driving a motor taxi, and fishing in Tunle Sap Lake.

The family includes two children, and one of them is enrolled in primary school. The family's living environment is not comfortable, due to the frequent collapses of their house. Thorn N. would like a loan to repair and decorate her old house.

loans.use: Repair and decorate her old house

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 42 años y vive con su pareja y padre D. sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. ElL. tiene terrenos temporales (según L. lluvia) que son apropiados para L. siembra D. papas y olluco, auque le gustaría también producir arvejas, pero el clima muy frío perjudica este producto. Enriqueta está satisfecha porque tanto L. papa como el olluco son productos muy rentables, sobre todo el olluco, pues en algunas ocasiones ha llegado en vender hasta 120 soles cada saco.
